They say: Had Allah guided us, we should have guided you.  Whether we rage or patiently endure is (now) all one for us; we have no place of  refuge. 
14|22|Ibrahim: Abraham|And Satan saith, when the matter hath been decided: Lo! Allah promised you  a promise of truth; and I promised you, then failed you. And I had no power over you  save that I called unto you and ye obeyed me. So blame not, but blame yourselves. I  cannot help you, nor can ye help me, Lo! I disbelieved in that which ye before  ascribed to me. Lo! for wrong-doers is a painful doom. 
14|23|Ibrahim: Abraham|And those who believed and did good works are made to enter Gardens  underneath which rivers flow, therein abiding by permission of their Lord, their  greeting therein: Peace! 
14|24|Ibrahim: Abraham|Seest thou not how Allah coineth a similitude: A goodly saying, as a goodly  tree, its root set firm, its branches reaching into heaven, 
14|25|Ibrahim: Abraham|Giving its fruit at every season by permission of its Lord ? Allah coineth the  similitudes for mankind in order that they may reflect. 
14|26|Ibrahim: Abraham|And the similitude of a bad saying is as a bad tree, uprooted from upon the  earth, possessing no stability. 
14|27|Ibrahim: Abraham|Allah confirmeth those who believe by a firm saying in the life of the world  and in the Hereafter, and Allah sendeth wrong-doers astray. And Allah doeth what He  will. 
14|28|Ibrahim: Abraham|Hast thou not seen those who gave the grace of Allah in exchange for  thanklessness and led their people down to the Abode of Loss, 
14|29|Ibrahim: Abraham|(Even to) hell ? They are exposed thereto. A hapless end! 
14|30|Ibrahim: Abraham|And they set up rivals to Allah that they may mislead (men) from His way.  Say: Enjoy life (while ye may) for lo! your journey's end will be the Fire. 
14|31|Ibrahim: Abraham|Tell My bondmen who believe to establish worship and spend of that which  We have given them, secretly and publicly, before a day cometh wherein there will be  neither traffick nor befriending. 
14|32|Ibrahim: Abraham|Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth, and causeth water to  descend from the sky, thereby producing fruits as food for you, and maketh the ships  to be of service unto you, that they may run upon the sea at His command, and hath  made of service unto you the rivers; 
14|33|Ibrahim: Abraham|And maketh the sun and the moon, constant in their courses, to be of service  unto you, and hath made of service unto you the night and the day. 
14|34|Ibrahim: Abraham|And He giveth you of all ye ask of Him, and if ye would count the bounty of  Allah ye cannot reckon it. Lo! man is verily a wrong-doer, an ingrate. 
14|35|Ibrahim: Abraham|And when Abraham said: My Lord! Make safe this territory, and preserve  me and my sons from serving idols. 
14|36|Ibrahim: Abraham|My Lord! Lo! they have led many of mankind astray. But whoso followeth  me, he verily is of me. And whoso disobeyeth me - Still Thou art Forgiving, Merciful. 
14|37|Ibrahim: Abraham|Our Lord! Lo! I have settled some of my posterity in an uncultivable valley  near unto Thy holy House, our Lord! that they may establish proper worship; so  incline some hearts of men that they may yearn toward them, and provide Thou them  with fruits in order that they may be thankful. 
14|38|Ibrahim: Abraham|Our Lord! Lo! Thou knowest that which we hide and that which we  proclaim. Nothing in the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah. 
14|39|Ibrahim: Abraham|Praise be to Allah Who hath given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac! Lo!  my Lord is indeed the Hearer of Prayer. 
14|40|Ibrahim: Abraham|My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity  (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer. 
14|41|Ibrahim: Abraham|Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and believers on the day when the  account is cast. 
14|42|Ibrahim: Abraham|Deem not that Allah is unaware of what the wicked do. He but giveth them a  respite till a day when eyes will stare (in terror), 
14|43|Ibrahim: Abraham|As they come hurrying on in fear, their heads upraised, their gaze returning  not to them, and their hearts as air. 
14|44|Ibrahim: Abraham|And warn mankind of a day when the doom will come upon them, and those  who did wrong will say: Our Lord! Reprieve us for a little while. We will obey Thy  call and will follow the messengers. (It will be answered): Did ye not swear before  that there would be no end for you ? 
14|45|Ibrahim: Abraham|And (have ye not) dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves  (of old) and (hath it not) become plain to you how We dealt with them and made  examples for you ? 
14|46|Ibrahim: Abraham|Verily they have plotted their plot, and their plot is with Allah, though their  plot were one whereby the mountains should be moved. 
14|47|Ibrahim: Abraham|So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Lo!  Allah is Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong). 
14|48|Ibrahim: Abraham|On the day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth, and the  heavens (also will be changed) and they will come forth unto Allah, the One, the  Almighty, 
14|49|Ibrahim: Abraham|Thou wilt see the guilty on that day linked together in chains, 
14|50|Ibrahim: Abraham|Their raiment of pitch, and the Fire covering their faces, 
14|51|Ibrahim: Abraham|That Allah may repay each soul what it hath earned. Lo! Allah is swift at  reckoning. 
14|52|Ibrahim: Abraham|This is a clear message for mankind in order that they may be warned  thereby, and that they may know that He is only One God, and that men of  understanding may take heed. 
15|1|al-Hijr: The Rock|Alif. Lam. Ra. These are verses of the Scripture and a plain Reading. 
15|2|al-Hijr: The Rock|It may be that those who disbelieve wish ardently that they were Muslims. 
15|3|al-Hijr: The Rock|Let them eat and enjoy life, and let (false) hope beguile them. They will  come to know! 
15|4|al-Hijr: The Rock|And We destroyed no township but there was a known decree for it. 
15|5|al-Hijr: The Rock|No nation can outstrip its term nor can they lag behind. 
15|6|al-Hijr: The Rock|And they say: O thou unto whom the Reminder is revealed, lo! thou art  indeed a madman! 
15|7|al-Hijr: The Rock|Why bringest thou not angels unto us, if thou art of the truthful ? 
15|8|al-Hijr: The Rock|We send not down the angels save with the Fact, and in that case (the  disbelievers) would not be tolerated. 
15|9|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! We, even We, reveal the Reminder, and lo! We verily are its Guardian. 
15|10|al-Hijr: The Rock|We verily sent (messengers) before thee among the factions of the men of  old. 
15|11|al-Hijr: The Rock|And never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him. 
15|12|al-Hijr: The Rock|Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty: 
15|13|al-Hijr: The Rock|They believe not therein, though the example of the men of old hath gone  before. 
15|14|al-Hijr: The Rock|And even if We opened unto them a gate of heaven and they kept mounting  through it, 
15|15|al-Hijr: The Rock|They would say: Our sight is wrong - nay, but we are folk bewitched. 
15|16|al-Hijr: The Rock|And verily in the heaven we have set mansions of the stars, and We have  beautified it for beholders. 
15|17|al-Hijr: The Rock|And We have guarded it from every outcast devil, 
15|18|al-Hijr: The Rock|Save him who stealeth the hearing, and them doth a clear flame pursue. 
15|19|al-Hijr: The Rock|And the earth have We spread out, and placed therein firm hills, and caused  each seemly thing to grow therein. 
15|20|al-Hijr: The Rock|And we have given unto you livelihoods therein, and unto those for whom ye  provide not. 
15|21|al-Hijr: The Rock|And there is not a thing but with Us are the stores thereof. And we send it not  down save in appointed measure. 
15|22|al-Hijr: The Rock|And We send the winds fertilising, and cause water to descend from the sky,  and give it you to drink. It is not ye who are the holders of the store thereof. 
15|23|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! and it is We, even We, Who quicken and give death, and We are the  Inheritor. 
15|24|al-Hijr: The Rock|And verily We know the eager among you and verily We know the laggards. 
15|25|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! thy Lord will gather them together. Lo! He is Wise, Aware. 
15|26|al-Hijr: The Rock|Verily We created man of potter's clay of black mud altered, 
15|27|al-Hijr: The Rock|And the jinn did We create aforetime of essential fire. 
15|28|al-Hijr: The Rock|And (remember) when thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am creating a  mortal out of potter's clay of black mud altered, 
15|29|al-Hijr: The Rock|So, when I have made him and have breathed into him of My Spirit, do ye  fall down, prostrating yourselves unto him. 
15|30|al-Hijr: The Rock|So the angels fell prostrate, all of them together 
15|31|al-Hijr: The Rock|Save Iblis. He refused to be among the prostrate. 
15|32|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: O Iblis! What aileth thee that thou art not among the prostrate ? 
15|33|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: I am not one to prostrate myself unto a mortal whom Thou hast  created out of potter's clay of black mud altered! 
15|34|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: Then go thou forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast. 
15|35|al-Hijr: The Rock|And lo! the curse shall be upon thee till the Day of Judgment. 
15|36|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised. 
15|37|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: Then lo! thou art of those reprieved 
15|38|al-Hijr: The Rock|Till the Day of appointed time. 
15|39|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: My Lord! Because Thou hast sent me astray, I verily shall adorn the  path of error for them in the earth, and shall mislead them every one, 
15|40|al-Hijr: The Rock|Save such of them as are Thy perfectly devoted slaves. 
15|41|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: This is a right course incumbent upon Me: 
15|42|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! as for My slaves, thou hast no power over any of them save such of the  froward as follow thee, 
15|43|al-Hijr: The Rock|And lo! for all such, hell will be the promised place. 
15|44|al-Hijr: The Rock|It hath seven gates, and each gate hath an appointed portion. 
15|45|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! those who ward off (evil) are among gardens and watersprings. 
15|46|al-Hijr: The Rock|(And it is said unto them): Enter them in peace, secure. 
15|47|al-Hijr: The Rock|And We remove whatever rancour may be in their breasts. As brethren, face  to face, (they rest) on couches raised. 
15|48|al-Hijr: The Rock|Toil cometh not unto them there, nor will they be expelled from thence. 
15|49|al-Hijr: The Rock|Announce, (O Muhammad) unto My slaves that verily I am the Forgiving,  the Merciful, 
15|50|al-Hijr: The Rock|And that My doom is the dolorous doom. 
15|51|al-Hijr: The Rock|And tell them of Abraham's guests, 
15|52|al-Hijr: The Rock|(How) when they came in unto him, and said: Peace. He said: Lo! we are  afraid of you. 
15|53|al-Hijr: The Rock|They said: Be not afraid! Lo! we bring thee good tidings of a boy possessing  wisdom. 
15|54|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: Bring ye me good tidings (of a son) when old age hath overtaken me  ? Of what then can ye bring good tidings ? 
15|55|al-Hijr: The Rock|They said: We bring thee good tidings in truth. So be not thou of the  despairing. 
15|56|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: And who despaireth of the mercy of his Lord save those who are  astray ? 
15|57|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: And afterward what is your business, O ye messengers (of Allah) ? 
15|58|al-Hijr: The Rock|They said: We have been sent unto a guilty folk, 
15|59|al-Hijr: The Rock|(All) save the family of Lot. Them we shall deliver every one, 
15|60|al-Hijr: The Rock|Except his wife, of whom We had decreed that she should be of those who  stay behind. 
15|61|al-Hijr: The Rock|And when the messengers came unto the family of Lot, 
15|62|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: Lo! ye are folk unknown (to me). 
15|63|al-Hijr: The Rock|They said: Nay, but we bring thee that concerning which they keep  disputing, 
15|64|al-Hijr: The Rock|And bring thee the Truth, and lo! we are truth-tellers. 
15|65|al-Hijr: The Rock|So travel with thy household in a portion of the night, and follow thou their  backs. Let none of you turn round, but go whither ye are commanded. 
15|66|al-Hijr: The Rock|And We made plain the case to him, that the root of them (who did wrong)  was to be cut at early morn. 
15|67|al-Hijr: The Rock|And the people of the city came, rejoicing at the news (of new arrivals). 
15|68|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: Lo! they are my guests. Affront me not! 
15|69|al-Hijr: The Rock|And keep your duty to Allah, and shame me not! 
15|70|al-Hijr: The Rock|They said; Have we not forbidden you from (entertaining) anyone ? 
15|71|al-Hijr: The Rock|He said: Here are my daughters, if ye must be doing (so). 
15|72|al-Hijr: The Rock|By thy life (O Muhammad) they moved blindly in the frenzy of approaching  death. 
15|73|al-Hijr: The Rock|Then the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the sunrise. 
15|74|al-Hijr: The Rock|And We utterly confounded them, and We rained upon them stones of heated  clay. 
15|75|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! therein verily are portents for those who read the signs. 
15|76|al-Hijr: The Rock|And lo! it is upon a road still uneffaced. 
15|77|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! therein is indeed a portent for believers. 
15|78|al-Hijr: The Rock|And the dwellers in the wood indeed were evil-doers. 
15|79|al-Hijr: The Rock|So we took vengeance on them; and lo! they both are on a high-road plain to  see. 
15|80|al-Hijr: The Rock|And the dwellers in Al-Hijr denied (Our) messengers. 
15|81|al-Hijr: The Rock|And we gave them Our revelations, but they were averse to them. 
15|82|al-Hijr: The Rock|And they used to hew out dwellings from the hills, (wherein they dwelt)  secure. 
15|83|al-Hijr: The Rock|But the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the morning hour, 
15|84|al-Hijr: The Rock|And that which they were wont to count as gain availed them not. 
15|85|al-Hijr: The Rock|We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save  with truth, and lo! the Hour is surely coming. So forgive, (O Muhammad), with a  gracious forgiveness. 
15|86|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! Thy Lord! He is the All-Wise Creator. 
15|87|al-Hijr: The Rock|We have given thee seven of the oft-repeated (verses) and the great Qur'an. 
15|88|al-Hijr: The Rock|Strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs among  them to enjoin, and be not grieved on their account, and lower thy wing (in  tenderness) for the believers. 
15|89|al-Hijr: The Rock|And say: Lo! I, even I, am a plain warner, 
15|90|al-Hijr: The Rock|Such as We send down for those who make division, 
15|91|al-Hijr: The Rock|Those who break the Qur'an into parts. 
15|92|al-Hijr: The Rock|Them, by thy Lord, We shall question, every one, 
15|93|al-Hijr: The Rock|Of what they used to do. 
15|94|al-Hijr: The Rock|So proclaim that which thou art commanded, and withdraw from the  idolaters. 
15|95|al-Hijr: The Rock|Lo! We defend thee from the scoffers, 
15|96|al-Hijr: The Rock|Who set some other god along with Allah. But they will come to know. 
15|97|al-Hijr: The Rock|Well know We that thy bosom is oppressed by what they say, 
15|98|al-Hijr: The Rock|But hymn the praise of thy Lord, and be of those who make prostration (unto  Him). 
15|99|al-Hijr: The Rock|And serve thy Lord till the Inevitable cometh unto thee. 
16|1|an-Nahl: The Bee|The commandment of Allah will come to pass, so seek not ye to hasten it.  Glorified and Exalted be He above all that they associate (with Him). 
16|2|an-Nahl: The Bee|He sendeth down the angels with the Spirit of His command unto whom He  will of His bondmen, (saying): Warn mankind that there is no God save Me, so keep  your duty unto Me. 
16|3|an-Nahl: The Bee|He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. High be He Exalted  above all that they associate (with Him). 
16|4|an-Nahl: The Bee|He hath created man from a drop of fluid, yet behold! he is an open  opponent. 
16|5|an-Nahl: The Bee|And the cattle hath He created, whence ye have warm clothing and uses, and  whereof ye eat; 
16|6|an-Nahl: The Bee|And wherein is beauty for you, when ye bring them home, and when ye take  them out to pasture. 
16|7|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they bear your loads for you unto a land ye could not reach save with  great trouble to yourselves. Lo! your Lord is Full of Pity, Merciful. 
16|8|an-Nahl: The Bee|And horses and mules and asses (hath He created) that ye may ride them, and  for ornament. And He createth that which ye know not. 
16|9|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah's is the direction of the way, and some (roads) go not straight.  And had He willed He would have led you all aright. 
16|10|an-Nahl: The Bee|He it is Who sendeth down water from the sky, whence ye have drink, and  whence are trees on which ye send your beasts to pasture. 
16|11|an-Nahl: The Bee|Therewith He causeth crops to grow for you, and the olive and the date-palm  and grapes and all kinds of fruit. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for people who reflect. 
16|12|an-Nahl: The Bee|And He hath constrained the night and the day and the sun and the moon to  be of service unto you, and the stars are made subservient by His command. Lo!  herein indeed are portents for people who have sense. 
16|13|an-Nahl: The Bee|And whatsoever He hath created for you in the earth of divers hues, lo!  therein is indeed a portent for people who take heed. 
16|14|an-Nahl: The Bee|And He it is Who hath constrained the sea to be of service that ye eat fresh  meat from thence, and bring forth from thence ornaments which ye wear. And thou  seest the ships ploughing it that ye (mankind) may seek of His bounty and that haply  ye may give thanks. 
16|15|an-Nahl: The Bee|And He hath cast into the earth firm hills that it quake not with you, and  streams and roads that ye may find a way. 
16|16|an-Nahl: The Bee|And landmarks (too), and by the star they find a way. 
16|17|an-Nahl: The Bee|Is He then Who createth as him who createth not ? Will ye not then  remember ? 
16|18|an-Nahl: The Bee|And if ye would count the favour of Allah ye cannot reckon it. Lo! Allah is  indeed Forgiving, Merciful. 
16|19|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah knoweth that which ye keep hidden and that which ye proclaim. 
16|20|an-Nahl: The Bee|Those unto whom they cry beside Allah created naught, but are themselves  created. 
16|21|an-Nahl: The Bee|(They are) dead, not living. And they know not when they will be raised. 
16|22|an-Nahl: The Bee|Your God is One God. But as for those who believe not in the Hereafter their  hearts refuse to know, for they are proud. 
16|23|an-Nahl: The Bee|Assuredly Allah knoweth that which they keep hidden and that which they  proclaim. Lo! He loveth not the proud. 
16|24|an-Nahl: The Bee|And when it is said unto them: What hath your Lord revealed ? they say:  (Mere) fables of the men of old, 
16|25|an-Nahl: The Bee|That they may bear their burdens undiminished on the Day of Resurrection,  with somewhat of the burdens of those whom they mislead without knowledge. Ah!  evil is that which they bear! 
16|26|an-Nahl: The Bee|Those before them plotted, so Allah struck at the foundations of their  building, and then the roof fell down upon them from above them, and the doom  came on them whence they knew not; 
16|27|an-Nahl: The Bee|Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and will say: Where  are My partners, for whose sake ye opposed (My guidance) ? Those who have been  given knowledge will say: Disgrace this day and evil are upon the disbelievers, 
16|28|an-Nahl: The Bee|Whom the angels cause to die while they are wronging themselves. Then will  they make full submission (saying): We used not to do any wrong. Nay! Surely Allah  is Knower of what ye used to do. 
16|29|an-Nahl: The Bee|So enter the gates of hell, to dwell therein for ever. Woeful indeed will be the  lodging of the arrogant. 
16|30|an-Nahl: The Bee|And it is said unto those who ward off (evil): What hath your Lord revealed ?  They say: Good. For those who do good in this world there is a good (reward) and the  home of the Hereafter will be better. Pleasant indeed will be the home of those who  ward off (evil) - 
16|31|an-Nahl: The Bee|Gardens of Eden which they enter, underneath which rivers flow, wherein  they have what they will. Thus Allah repayeth those who ward off (evil), 
16|32|an-Nahl: The Bee|Those whom the angels cause to die (when they are) good. They say: Peace  be unto you! Enter the Garden because of what ye used to do. 
16|33|an-Nahl: The Bee|Await they aught say that the angels should come unto them or thy Lord's  command should come to pass ? Even so did those before them. Allah wronged them  not, but they did wrong themselves, 
16|34|an-Nahl: The Bee|So that the evils of what they did smote them, and that which they used to  mock surrounded them. 
16|35|an-Nahl: The Bee|And the idolaters say: Had Allah willed, we had not worshipped aught beside  Him, we and our fathers, nor had we forbidden aught without (command from) Him.  Even so did those before them. Are the messengers charged with aught save plain  conveyance (of the message) ? 
16|36|an-Nahl: The Bee|And verily We have raised in every nation a messenger, (proclaiming): Serve  Allah and shun false gods. Then some of them (there were) whom Allah guided, and  some of them (there were) upon whom error had just hold. Do but travel in the land  and see the nature of the consequence for the deniers! 
16|37|an-Nahl: The Bee|Even if thou (O Muhammad) desirest their right guidance, still Allah  assuredly will not guide him who misleadeth. Such have no helpers. 
16|38|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they swear by Allah their most binding oaths (that) Allah will not raise  up him who dieth. Nay, but it is a promise (binding) upon Him in truth, but most of  mankind know not, 
16|39|an-Nahl: The Bee|That He may explain unto them that wherein they differ, and that those who  disbelieved may know that they were liars. 
16|40|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Our word unto a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say unto it:  Be! and it is. 
16|41|an-Nahl: The Bee|And those who became fugitives for the cause of Allah after they had been  oppressed, We verily shall give them goodly lodging in the world, and surely the  reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they but knew; 
16|42|an-Nahl: The Bee|Such as are steadfast and put their trust in Allah. 
16|43|an-Nahl: The Bee|And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men whom We  inspired - Ask the followers of the Remembrance if ye know not! - 
16|44|an-Nahl: The Bee|With clear proofs and writings; and We have revealed unto thee the  Remembrance that thou mayst explain to mankind that which hath been revealed for  them, and that haply they may reflect. 
16|45|an-Nahl: The Bee|Are they who plan ill-deeds then secure that Allah will not cause the earth to  swallow them, or that the doom will not come on them whence they know not ? 
16|46|an-Nahl: The Bee|Or that He will not seize them in their going to and fro so that there be no  escape for them ? 
16|47|an-Nahl: The Bee|Or that He will not seize them with a gradual wasting ? Lo! thy Lord is  indeed Full of Pity, Merciful. 
16|48|an-Nahl: The Bee|Have they not observed all things that Allah hath created, how their shadows  incline to the right and to the left, making prostration unto Allah, and they are lowly ? 
16|49|an-Nahl: The Bee|And unto Allah maketh prostration whatsoever is in the heavens and  whatsoever is in the earth of living creatures, and the angels (also) and they are not  proud. 
16|50|an-Nahl: The Bee|They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are bidden. 
16|51|an-Nahl: The Bee|Allah hath said: Choose not two gods. There is only One God. So of Me, Me  only, be in awe. 
16|52|an-Nahl: The Bee|Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth, and religion  is His for ever. Will ye then fear any other than Allah ? 
16|53|an-Nahl: The Bee|And whatever of comfort ye enjoy, it is from Allah. Then, when misfortune  reacheth you, unto Him ye cry for help. 
16|54|an-Nahl: The Bee|And afterward, when He hath rid you of the misfortune, behold! a set of you  attribute partners to their Lord, 
16|55|an-Nahl: The Bee|So as to deny that which We have given them. Then enjoy life (while ye  may), for ye will come to know. 
16|56|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they assign a portion of that which We have given them unto what they  know not. By Allah! but ye will indeed be asked concerning (all) that ye used to  invent. 
16|57|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they assign unto Allah daughters - Be He Glorified! - and unto  themselves what they desire; 
16|58|an-Nahl: The Bee|When if one of them receiveth tidings of the birth of a female, his face  remaineth darkened, and he is wroth inwardly. 
16|59|an-Nahl: The Bee|He hideth himself from the folk because of the evil of that whereof he hath  had tidings, (asking himself): Shall he keep it in contempt, or bury it beneath the dust.  Verily evil is their judgment. 
16|60|an-Nahl: The Bee|For those who believe not in the Hereafter is an evil similitude, and Allah's is  the Sublime Similitude. He is the Mighty, the Wise. 
16|61|an-Nahl: The Bee|If Allah were to take mankind to task for their wrong-doing, he would not  leave hereon a living creature, but He reprieveth them to an appointed term, and when  their term cometh they cannot put (it) off an hour nor (yet) advance (it). 
16|62|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they assign unto Allah that which they (themselves) dislike, and their  tongues expound the lie that the better portion will be theirs. Assuredly theirs will be  the Fire, and they will be abandoned. 
16|63|an-Nahl: The Bee|By Allah, We verily sent messengers unto the nations before thee, but the  devil made their deeds fairseeming unto them. So he is their patron this day, and  theirs  will be a painful doom. 
16|64|an-Nahl: The Bee|And We have revealed the Scripture unto thee only that thou mayst explain  unto them that wherein they differ, and (as) a guidance and a mercy for a people who  believe. 
16|65|an-Nahl: The Bee|Allah sendeth down water from the sky and therewith reviveth the earth after  her death. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for a folk who hear. 
16|66|an-Nahl: The Bee|And lo! in the cattle there is a lesson for you. We give you to drink of that  which is in their bellies, from betwixt the refuse and the blood, pure milk palatable to  the drinkers. 
16|67|an-Nahl: The Bee|And of the fruits of the date-palm, and grapes, whence ye derive strong drink  and (also) good nourishment. Lo! therein is indeed a portent for people who have  sense. 
16|68|an-Nahl: The Bee|And thy Lord inspired the bee, saying: Choose thou habitations in the hills  and in the trees and in that which they thatch; 
16|69|an-Nahl: The Bee|Then eat of all fruits, and follow the ways of thy Lord, made smooth (for  thee). There cometh forth from their bellies a drink divers of hues, wherein is healing  for mankind. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for people who reflect. 
16|70|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah createth you, then causeth you to die, and among you is he who is  brought back to the most abject stage of life, so that he knoweth nothing after (having  had) knowledge. Lo! Allah is Knower, Powerful. 
16|71|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah hath favoured some of you above others in provision. Now those  who are more favoured will by no means hand over their provision to those (slaves)  whom their right hands possess, so that they may be equal with them in respect  thereof. Is it then the grace of Allah that they deny ? 
16|72|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah hath given you wives of your own kind, and hath given you, from  your wives, sons and grandsons, and hath made provision of good things for you. Is it  then in vanity that they believe and in the grace of Allah that they disbelieve ? 
16|73|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they worship beside Allah that which owneth no provision whatsoever  for them from the heavens or the earth, nor have they (whom they worship) any  power. 
16|74|an-Nahl: The Bee|So coin not similitudes for Allah. Lo! Allah knoweth; ye know not. 
16|75|an-Nahl: The Bee|Allah coineth a similitude: (on the one hand) a (mere) chattel slave, who hath  control of nothing, and (on the other hand) one on whom we have bestowed a fair  provision from Us, and he spendeth thereof secretly and openly. Are they equal ?  Praise be to Allah! But most of them know not. 
16|76|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah coineth a similitude: Two men, one of them dumb, having control  of nothing, and he is a burden on his owner; whithersoever he directeth him to go, he  bringeth no good. Is he equal with one who enjoineth justice and followeth a straight  path (of conduct) ? 
16|77|an-Nahl: The Bee|And unto Allah belongeth the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and the  matter of the Hour (of Doom) is but as a twinkling of the eye, or it is nearer still. Lo!  Allah is Able to do all things. 
16|78|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers knowing  nothing, and gave you hearing and sight and hearts that haply ye might give thanks. 
16|79|an-Nahl: The Bee|Have they not seen the birds obedient in mid-air ? None holdeth them save  Allah. Lo! herein, verily, are portents for a people who believe. 
16|80|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah hath given you in your houses an abode, and hath given you  (also), of the hides of cattle, houses which ye find light (to carry) on the day of  migration and on the day of pitching camp; and of their wool and their fur and their  hair, caparison and comfort for a while. 
16|81|an-Nahl: The Bee|And Allah hath given you, of that which He hath created, shelter from the  sun; and hath given you places of refuge in the mountains, and hath given you coats  to ward off the heat from you, and coats (of armour) to save you from your own  foolhardiness. Thus doth He perfect His favour unto you, in order that ye may  surrender (unto Him). 
16|82|an-Nahl: The Bee|Then, if they turn away, thy duty (O Muhammad) is but plain conveyance (of  the message). 
16|83|an-Nahl: The Bee|They know the favour of Allah and then deny it. Most of them are ingrates. 
16|84|an-Nahl: The Bee|And (bethink you of) the day when we raise up of every nation a witness,  then there is no leave for disbelievers, nor are they allowed to make amends. 
16|85|an-Nahl: The Bee|And when those who did wrong behold the doom, it will not be made light  for them, nor will they be reprieved. 
16|86|an-Nahl: The Bee|And when those who ascribed partners to Allah behold those partners of  theirs, they will say: Our Lord! these are our partners unto whom we used to cry  instead of Thee. But they will fling to them the saying: Lo! ye verily are liars! 
16|87|an-Nahl: The Bee|And they proffer unto Allah submission on that day, and all that they used to  invent hath failed them. 
16|88|an-Nahl: The Bee|For those who disbelieve and debar (men) from the way of Allah, We add  doom to doom because they wrought corruption, 
16|89|an-Nahl: The Bee|And (bethink you of) the day when We raise in every nation a witness  against them of their own folk, and We bring thee (Muhammad) as a witness against  these. And We reveal the Scripture unto thee as an exposition of all things, and a  guidance and a mercy and good tidings for those who have surrendered (to Allah). 
16|90|an-Nahl: The Bee|Lo! Allah enjoineth justice and kindness, and giving to kinsfolk, and  forbiddeth lewdness and abomination and wickedness. He exhorteth you in order that  ye may take heed. 
16|91|an-Nahl: The Bee|Fulfil the covenant of Allah when ye have covenanted, and break not your  oaths after the asseveration of them, and after ye have made Allah surety over you.  Lo! Allah knoweth what ye do. 
16|92|an-Nahl: The Bee|And be not like unto her who unravelleth the thread, after she hath made it  strong, to thin filaments, making your oaths a deceit between you because of a nation  being more numerous than (another) nation. Allah only trieth you thereby, and He  verily will explain to you on the Day of Resurrection that wherein ye differed. 
16|93|an-Nahl: The Bee|Had Allah willed He could have made you (all) one nation, but He sendeth  whom He will astray and guideth whom He will, and ye will indeed be asked of what  ye used to do. 
16|94|an-Nahl: The Bee|Make not your oaths a deceit between you, lest a foot should slip after being  firmly planted and ye should taste evil forasmuch as ye debarred (men) from the way  of Allah, and yours should be an awful doom. 
16|95|an-Nahl: The Bee|And purchase not a small gain at the price of Allah's covenant. Lo! that  which Allah hath is better for you, if ye did but know. 
16|96|an-Nahl: The Bee|That which ye have wasteth away, and that which Allah hath remaineth. And  verily We shall pay those who are steadfast a recompense in proportion to the best of  what they used to do. 
16|97|an-Nahl: The Bee|Whosoever doeth right, whether male or female, and is a believer, him verily  we shall quicken with good life, and We shall pay them a recompense in proportion to  the best of what they used to do. 
16|98|an-Nahl: The Bee|And when thou recitest the Qur'an, seek refuge in Allah from Satan the  outcast. 
16|99|an-Nahl: The Bee|Lo! he hath no power over those who believe and put trust in their Lord. 
16|100|an-Nahl: The Bee|His power is only over those who make a friend of him, and those who  ascribe partners unto Him (Allah). 
16|101|an-Nahl: The Bee|And when We put a revelation in place of (another) revelation, - and Allah  knoweth best what He revealeth - they say: Lo! thou art but inventing. Most of them  know not. 
16|102|an-Nahl: The Bee|Say: The holy Spirit hath delivered it from thy Lord with truth, that it may  confirm (the faith of) those who believe, and as guidance and good tidings for those  who have surrendered (to Allah). 
16|103|an-Nahl: The Bee|And We know well that they say: Only a man teacheth him. The speech of  him at whom they falsely hint is outlandish, and this is clear Arabic speech. 
16|104|an-Nahl: The Bee|Lo! those who disbelieve the revelations of Allah, Allah guideth them not  and theirs will be a painful doom. 
16|105|an-Nahl: The Bee|Only they invent falsehood who believe not Allah's revelations, and (only)  they are the liars. 
16|106|an-Nahl: The Bee|Whoso disbelieveth in Allah after his belief - save him who is forced thereto  and whose heart is still content with the Faith - but whoso findeth ease in disbelief:  On them is wrath from Allah. Theirs will be an awful doom. 
16|107|an-Nahl: The Bee|That is because they have chosen the life of the world rather than the  Hereafter, and because Allah guideth not the disbelieving folk. 
16|108|an-Nahl: The Bee|Such are they whose hearts and ears and eyes Allah hath sealed. And such  are the heedless. 
16|109|an-Nahl: The Bee|Assuredly in the Hereafter they are the losers. 
16|110|an-Nahl: The Bee|Then lo! thy Lord - for those who became fugitives after they had been  persecuted, and then fought and were steadfast - lo! thy Lord afterward is (for them)  indeed Forgiving, Merciful. 
16|111|an-Nahl: The Bee|On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul  will be repaid what it did, and they will not be wronged. 
16|112|an-Nahl: The Bee|Allah coineth a similitude: a township that dwelt secure and well content, its  provision coming to it in abundance from every side, but it disbelieved in Allah's  favours, so Allah made it experience the garb of dearth and fear because of what they  used to do. 
16|113|an-Nahl: The Bee|And verily there had come unto them a messenger from among them, but  they had denied him, and so the torment seized them while they were wrong-doers. 
16|114|an-Nahl: The Bee|So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah hath provided for you, and  thank the bounty of your Lord if it is Him ye serve. 
16|115|an-Nahl: The Bee|He hath forbidden for you only carrion and blood and swineflesh and that  which hath been immolated in the name of any other than Allah; but he who is driven  thereto, neither craving nor transgressing, lo! then Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
16|116|an-Nahl: The Bee|And speak not, concerning that which your own tongues qualify (as clean or  unclean), the falsehood: "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so that ye invent a lie  against Allah. Lo! those who invent a lie against Allah will not succeed. 
16|117|an-Nahl: The Bee|A brief enjoyment (will be theirs); and theirs a painful doom. 
16|118|an-Nahl: The Bee|And unto those who are Jews We have forbidden that which We have  already related unto thee. And We wronged them not, but they were wont to wrong  themselves. 
16|119|an-Nahl: The Bee|Then lo! thy Lord - for those who do evil in ignorance and afterward repent  and amend - lo! (for them) thy Lord is afterward indeed Forgiving, Merciful. 
16|120|an-Nahl: The Bee|Lo! Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, by nature upright, and he was  not of the idolaters; 
16|121|an-Nahl: The Bee|Thankful for His bounties; He chose him and He guided him unto a straight  path. 
16|122|an-Nahl: The Bee|And We gave him good in the world, and in the Hereafter he is among the  righteous. 
16|123|an-Nahl: The Bee|And afterward We inspired thee (Muhammad, saying): Follow the religion of  Abraham, as one by nature upright. He was not of the idolaters. 
16|124|an-Nahl: The Bee|The Sabbath was appointed only for those who differed concerning it, and lo!  thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that  wherein they used to differ. 
16|125|an-Nahl: The Bee|Call unto the way of thy Lord with wisdom and fair exhortation, and reason  with them in the better way. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from  His way, and He is Best Aware of those who go aright. 
16|126|an-Nahl: The Bee|If ye punish, then punish with the like of that wherewith ye were afflicted.  But if ye endure patiently, verily it is better for the patient. 
16|127|an-Nahl: The Bee|Endure thou patiently (O Muhammad). Thine endurance is only by (the help  of) Allah. Grieve not for them, and be not in distress because of that which they  devise. 
16|128|an-Nahl: The Bee|Lo! Allah is with those who keep their duty unto Him and those who are  doers of good. 
17|1|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Glorified be He Who carried His servant by night from the Inviolable Place  of Worship to the Far distant place of worship the neighbourhood whereof We have  blessed, that We might show him of Our tokens! Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the  Seer. 
17|2|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|We gave unto Moses the Scripture, and We appointed it a guidance for the  children of Israel, saying: Choose no guardian beside Me. 
17|3|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(They were) the seed of those whom We carried (in the ship) along with  Noah. Lo! he was a grateful slave. 
17|4|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And We decreed for the Children of Israel in the Scripture: Ye verily will  work corruption in the earth twice, and ye will become great tyrants. 
17|5|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|So when the time for the first of the two came, We roused against you slaves  of Ours of great might who ravaged (your) country, and it was a threat performed. 
17|6|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Then we gave you once again your turn against them, and We aided you with  wealth and children and made you more in soldiery. 
17|7|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(Saying): If ye do good, ye do good for your own souls, and if ye do evil, it is  for them (in like manner). So, when the time for the second (of the judgments) came  (We roused against you others of Our slaves) to ravage you, and to enter the Temple  even as they entered it the first time, and to lay waste all that they conquered with an  utter wasting. 
17|8|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|It may be that your Lord will have mercy on you, but if ye repeat (the crime)  We shall repeat (the punishment), and We have appointed hell a dungeon for the  disbelievers. 
17|9|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Lo! this Qur'an guideth unto that which is straightest, and giveth tidings unto  the believers who do good works that theirs will be a great reward. 
17|10|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And that those who believe not in the Hereafter, for them We have prepared  a painful doom. 
17|11|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Man prayeth for evil as he prayeth for good; for man was ever hasty. 
17|12|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And We appoint the night and the day two portents. Then We make dark the  portent of the night, and We make the portent of the day sight-giving, that ye may  seek bounty from your Lord, and that ye may know the computation of the years, and  the reckoning; and everything have We expounded with a clear expounding. 
17|13|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And every man's augury have We fastened to his own neck, and We shall  bring forth for him on the Day of Resurrection a book which he will find wide open. 
17|14|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(And it will be said unto him): Read thy Book. Thy soul sufficeth as reckoner  against thee this day. 
17|15|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Whosoever goeth right, it is only for (the good of) his own soul that he goeth  right, and whosoever erreth, erreth only to its hurt. No laden soul can bear another's  load, We never punish until we have sent a messenger. 
17|16|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And when We would destroy a township We send commandment to its folk  who live at ease, and afterward they commit abomination therein, and so the Word (of  doom) hath effect for it, and we annihilate it with complete annihilation. 
17|17|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|How many generations have We destroyed since Noah! And Allah sufficeth  as Knower and Beholder of the sins of His slaves. 
17|18|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Whoso desireth that (life) which hasteneth away, We hasten for him therein  what We will for whom We please. And afterward We have appointed for him hell;  he will endure the heat thereof, condemned, rejected. 
17|19|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And whoso desireth the Hereafter and striveth for it with the effort necessary,  being a believer; for such, their effort findeth favour (with their Lord). 
17|20|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Each do We supply, both these and those, from the bounty of thy Lord. And  the bounty of thy Lord can never be walled up. 
17|21|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|See how We prefer one of them above another, and verily the Hereafter will  be greater in degrees and greater in preferment. 
17|22|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Set not up with Allah any other god (O man) lest thou sit down reproved,  forsaken. 
17|23|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Thy Lord hath decreed, that ye worship none save Him, and (that ye show)  kindness to parents. If one of them or both of them attain old age with thee, say not  "Fie" unto them nor repulse them, but speak unto them a gracious word. 
17|24|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And lower unto them the wing of submission through mercy, and say: My  Lord! Have mercy on them both as they did care for me when I was little. 
17|25|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Your Lord is Best Aware of what is in your minds. If ye are righteous, then  lo! He was ever Forgiving unto those who turn (unto Him). 
17|26|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Give the kinsman his due, and the needy, and the wayfarer, and squander not  (thy wealth) in wantonness. 
17|27|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Lo! the squanderers were ever brothers of the devils, and the devil was ever  an ingrate to his Lord. 
17|28|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|But if thou turn away from them, seeking mercy from thy Lord, for which  thou hopest, then speak unto them a reasonable word. 
17|29|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And let not thy hand be chained to thy neck nor open it with a complete  opening, lest thou sit down rebuked, denuded. 
17|30|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Lo! thy Lord enlargeth the provision for whom He will, and straiteneth (it for  whom He will). Lo, He was ever Knower, Seer of His slaves. 
17|31|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Slay not your children, fearing a fall to poverty, We shall provide for them  and for you. Lo! the slaying of them is great sin. 
17|32|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And come not near unto adultery. Lo! it is an abomination and an evil way. 
17|33|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And slay not the life which Allah hath forbidden save with right. Whoso is  slain wrongfully, We have given power unto his heir, but let him not commit excess  in slaying. Lo! he will be helped. 
17|34|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Come not near the wealth of the orphan save with that which is better till he  come to strength; and keep the covenant. Lo! of the covenant it will be asked. 
17|35|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Fill the measure when ye measure, and weigh with a right balance; that is  meet, and better in the end. 
17|36|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(O man), follow not that whereof thou hast no knowledge. Lo! the hearing  and the sight and the heart - of each of these it will be asked. 
17|37|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And walk not in the earth exultant. Lo! thou canst not rend the earth, nor  canst thou stretch to the height of the hills. 
17|38|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|The evil of all that is hateful in the sight of thy Lord. 
17|39|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|This is (part) of that wisdom wherewith thy Lord hath inspired thee (O  Muhammad). And set not up with Allah any other god, lest thou be cast into hell,  reproved, abandoned. 
17|40|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Hath your Lord then distinguished you (O men of Makka) by giving you  sons, and hath chosen for Himself females from among the angels ? Lo! verily ye  speak an awful word! 
17|41|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|We verily have displayed (Our warnings) in this Qur'an that they may take  heed, but it increaseth them in naught save aversion. 
17|42|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): If there were other gods along with  Him, as they say, then had they sought a way against the Lord of the Throne. 
17|43|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Glorified is He, and High Exalted above what they say! 
17|44|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|The seven heavens and the earth and all that is therein praise Him, and there  is not a thing but hymneth His praise; but ye understand not their praise. Lo! He is  ever Clement, Forgiving. 
17|45|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And when thou recitest the Qur'an we place between thee and those who  believe not in the Hereafter a hidden barrier; 
17|46|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And We place upon their hearts veils lest they should understand it, and in  their ears a deafness; and when thou makest mention of thy Lord alone in the Qur'an,  they turn their backs in aversion. 
17|47|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|We are Best Aware of what they wish to hear when they give ear to thee and  when they take secret counsel, when the evil-doers say: Ye follow but a man  bewitched. 
17|48|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|See what similitudes they coin for thee, and thus are all astray, and cannot  find a road! 
17|49|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And they say: When we are bones and fragments, shall we forsooth, be  raised up as a new creation ? 
17|50|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: Be ye stones or iron 
17|51|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Or some created thing that is yet greater in your thoughts! Then they will  say: Who shall bring us back (to life). Say: He Who created you at the first. Then will  they shake their heads at thee, and say: When will it be ? Say: It will perhaps be soon; 
17|52|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|A day when He will call you and ye will answer with His praise, and ye will  think that ye have tarried but a little while. 
17|53|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Tell My bondmen to speak that which is kindlier. Lo! the devil soweth  discord among them. Lo! the devil is for man an open foe. 
17|54|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Your Lord is Best Aware of you. If He will, He will have mercy on you, or if  He will, He will punish you. We have not sent thee (O Muhammad) as a warden over  them. 
17|55|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And thy Lord is Best Aware of all who are in the heavens and the earth. And  we preferred some of the prophets above others, and unto David We gave the Psalms. 
17|56|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: Cry unto those (saints and angels) whom ye assume (to be gods) beside  Him, yet they have no power to rid you of misfortune nor to change. 
17|57|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Those unto whom they cry seek the way of approach to their Lord, which of  them shall be the nearest; they hope for His mercy and they fear His doom. Lo! the  doom of thy Lord is to be shunned. 
17|58|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|There is not a township but We shall destroy it ere the Day of Resurrection,  or punish it with dire punishment. That is set forth in the Book (of Our decrees). 
17|59|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Naught hindereth Us from sending portents save that the folk of old denied  them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel - a clear portent save to warn. 
17|60|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And (it was a warning) when we told thee: Lo! thy Lord encompasseth  mankind, and We appointed the sight which We showed thee as an ordeal for  mankind, and (likewise) the Accursed Tree in the Qur'an. We warn them, but it  increaseth them in naught save gross impiety. 
17|61|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And when We said unto the angels: Fall down prostrate before Adam and  they fell prostrate all save Iblis, he said: Shall I fall prostrate before that which Thou  hast created of clay ? 
17|62|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|He said: Seest Thou this (creature) whom Thou hast honoured above me, if  Thou give me grace until the Day of Resurrection I verily will seize his seed, save but  a few. 
17|63|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|He said: Go, and whosoever of them followeth thee - lo! hell will be your  payment, ample payment. 
17|64|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And excite any of them whom thou canst with thy voice, and urge thy horse  and foot against them, and be a partner in their wealth and children, and promise  them. Satan promiseth them only to deceive. 
17|65|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Lo! My (faithful) bondmen - over them thou hast no power, and thy Lord  sufficeth as (their) guardian. 
17|66|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(O mankind), your Lord is He Who driveth for you the ship upon the sea that  ye may seek of His bounty. Lo! He was ever Merciful toward you. 
17|67|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And when harm toucheth you upon the sea, all unto whom ye cry (for  succour) fail save Him (alone), but when He bringeth you safe to land, ye turn away,  for man was ever thankless. 
17|68|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Feel ye then secure that He will not cause a slope of the land to engulf you,  or send a sand-storm upon you, and then ye will find that ye have no protector ? 
17|69|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Or feel ye secure that He will not return you to that (plight) a second time,  and send against you a hurricane of wind and drown you for your thanklessness, and  then ye will not find therein that ye have any avenger against Us ? 
17|70|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Verily we have honoured the Children of Adam. We carry them on the land  and the sea, and have made provision of good things for them, and have preferred  them above many of those whom We created with a marked preferment. 
17|71|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|On the day when We shall summon all men with their record, whoso is given  his book in his right hand - such will read their book and they will not be wronged a  shred. 
17|72|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Whoso is blind here will be blind in the Hereafter, and yet further from the  road. 
17|73|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And they indeed strove hard to beguile thee (Muhammad) away from that  wherewith We have inspired thee, that thou shouldst invent other than it against Us;  and then would they have accepted thee as a friend. 
17|74|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And if We had not made thee wholly firm thou mightest almost have inclined  unto them a little. 
17|75|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Then had we made thee taste a double (punishment) of living and a double  (punishment) of dying, then hadst thou found no helper against Us. 
17|76|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And they indeed wished to scare thee from the land that they might drive  thee forth from thence, and then they would have stayed (there) but a little after thee. 
17|77|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(Such was Our) method in the case of those whom We sent before thee (to  mankind), and thou wilt not find for Our method aught of power to change. 
17|78|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Establish worship at the going down of the sun until the dark of night, and  (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn. Lo! (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn is ever  witnessed. 
17|79|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And some part of the night awake for it, a largess for thee. It may be that thy  Lord will raise thee to a praised estate. 
17|80|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And say: My Lord! Cause me to come in with a firm incoming and to go out  with a firm outgoing. And give me from Thy presence a sustaining Power. 
17|81|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And say: Truth hath come and falsehood hath vanished away. Lo! falsehood  is ever bound to vanish. 
17|82|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And We reveal of the Qur'an that which is a healing and a mercy for  believers though it increase the evil-doers in naught save ruin. 
17|83|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And when We make life pleasant unto man, he turneth away and is averse;  and when ill toucheth him he is in despair. 
17|84|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: Each one doth according to his rule of conduct, and thy Lord is Best  Aware of him whose way is right. 
17|85|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|They are asking thee concerning the Spirit. Say: The Spirit is by command of  my Lord, and of knowledge ye have been vouchsafed but little. 
17|86|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And if We willed We could withdraw that which We have revealed unto  thee, then wouldst thou find no guardian for thee against Us in respect thereof. 
17|87|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|(It is naught) save mercy from thy Lord. Lo! His kindness unto thee was ever  great. 
17|88|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: Verily, though mankind and the jinn should assemble to produce the  like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like thereof though they were helpers  one of another. 
17|89|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And verily We have displayed for mankind in this Qur'an all kind of  similitudes, but most of mankind refuse aught save disbelief. 
17|90|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And they say: We will not put faith in thee till thou cause a spring to gush  forth from the earth for us; 
17|91|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Or thou have a garden of date-palms and grapes, and cause rivers to gush  forth therein abundantly; 
17|92|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Or thou cause the heaven to fall upon us piecemeal, as thou hast pretended,  or bring Allah and the angels as a warrant; 
17|93|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Or thou have a house of gold; or thou ascend up into heaven, and even then  we will put no faith in thine ascension till thou bring down for us a book that we can  read. Say (O Muhammad): My Lord be Glorified! Am I aught save a mortal  messenger ? 
17|94|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And naught prevented mankind from believing when the guidance came unto  them save that they said: Hath Allah sent a mortal as (His) messenger ? 
17|95|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: If there were in the earth angels walking secure, We had sent down for  them from heaven an angel as messenger. 
17|96|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: Allah sufficeth for a witness between me and you. Lo! He is Knower,  Seer of His slaves. 
17|97|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And he whom Allah guideth, he is led aright; while, as for him whom He  sendeth astray, for them thou wilt find no protecting friends beside Him, and We shall  assemble them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb and deaf; their  habitation will be hell; whenever it abateth, We increase the flame for them. 
17|98|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|That is their reward because they disbelieved Our revelations and said: When  we are bones and fragments shall we, forsooth, be raised up as a new creation ? 
17|99|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Have they not seen that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth is Able  to create the like of them, and hath appointed for them an end whereof there is no  doubt ? But the wrong-doers refuse aught save disbelief. 
17|100|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say (unto them): If ye possessed the treasures of the mercy of my Lord, ye  would surely hold them back for fear of spending, for man was ever grudging. 
17|101|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And verily We gave unto Moses nine tokens, clear proofs (of Allah's  Sovereignty). Do but ask the Children of Israel how he came unto them, then Pharaoh  said unto him: Lo! I deem thee one bewitched, O Moses. 
17|102|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|He said: In truth thou knowest that none sent down these (portents) save the  Lord of the heavens and the earth as proofs, and lo! (for my part) I deem thee lost, O  Pharaoh. 
17|103|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And he wished to scare them from the land, but We drowned him and those  with him, all together. 
17|104|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And We said unto the Children of Israel after him: Dwell in the land; but  when the promise of the Hereafter cometh to pass We shall bring you as a crowd  gathered out of various nations. 
17|105|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|With truth have We sent it down, and with truth hath it descended. And We  have sent thee as naught else save a bearer of good tidings and a warner. 
17|106|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And (it is) a Qur'an that We have divided, that thou mayst recite it unto  mankind at intervals, and We have revealed it by (successive) revelation. 
17|107|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say: Believe therein or believe not, lo! those who were given knowledge  before it, when it is read unto them, fall down prostrate on their faces, adoring,

17|109|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|They fall down on their faces, weeping, and it increaseth humility in them. 
17|110|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|Say (unto mankind): Cry unto Allah, or cry unto the Beneficent, unto  whichsoever ye cry (it is the same). His are the most beautiful names. And thou  (Muhammad), be not loud-voiced in thy worship nor yet silent therein, but follow a  way between. 
17|111|bani Isra'il: The Israelites|And say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath not taken unto Himself a son, and  Who hath no partner in the Sovereignty, nor hath He any protecting friend through  dependence. And magnify Him with all magnificence. 
18|1|al-Kahf: The Cave|Praise be to Allah Who hath revealed the Scripture unto His slave, and hath  not placed therein any crookedness, 
18|2|al-Kahf: The Cave|(But hath made it) straight, to give warning of stern punishment from Him,  and to bring unto the believers who do good works the news that theirs will be a fair  reward, 
18|3|al-Kahf: The Cave|Wherein they will abide for ever; 
18|4|al-Kahf: The Cave|And to warn those who say: Allah hath chosen a son, 
18|5|al-Kahf: The Cave|(A thing) whereof they have no knowledge, nor (had) their fathers, Dreadful  is the word that cometh out of their mouths. They speak naught but a lie. 
18|6|al-Kahf: The Cave|Yet it may be, if they believe not in this statement, that thou (Muhammad)  wilt torment thy soul with grief over their footsteps. 
18|7|al-Kahf: The Cave|Lo! We have placed all that is on the earth as an ornament thereof that We  may try them: which of them is best in conduct. 
18|8|al-Kahf: The Cave|And lo! We shall make all that is thereon a barren mound. 
18|9|al-Kahf: The Cave|Or deemest thou that the People of the Cave and the Inscription are a wonder  among Our portents ? 
18|10|al-Kahf: The Cave|When the young men fled for refuge to the Cave and said: Our Lord! Give us  mercy from Thy presence, and shape for us right conduct in our plight. 
18|11|al-Kahf: The Cave|Then We sealed up their hearing in the Cave for a number of years. 
18|12|al-Kahf: The Cave|And afterward We raised them up that We might know which of the two  parties would best calculate the time that they had tarried. 
18|13|al-Kahf: The Cave|We narrate unto thee their story with truth. Lo! they were young men who  believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance. 
18|14|al-Kahf: The Cave|And We made firm their hearts when they stood forth and said: Our Lord is  the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We cry unto no God beside Him, for then  should we utter an enormity. 
18|15|al-Kahf: The Cave|These, our people, have chosen (other) gods beside Him though they bring  no clear warrant (vouchsafed) to them. And who doth greater wrong than he who  inventeth a lie concerning Allah ? 
18|16|al-Kahf: The Cave|And when ye withdraw from them and that which they worship except Allah,  then seek refuge in the Cave; your Lord will spread for you of His mercy and will  prepare for you a pillow in your plight. 
18|17|al-Kahf: The Cave|And thou mightest have seen the sun when it rose move away from their  cave to the right, and when it set go past them on the left, and they were in the cleft  thereof. That was (one) of the portents of Allah. He whom Allah guideth, he indeed is  led aright, and he whom He sendeth astray, for him thou wilt not find a guiding  friend. 
18|18|al-Kahf: The Cave|And thou wouldst have deemed them waking though they were asleep, and  We caused them to turn over to the right and the left, and their dog stretching out his  paws on the threshold. If thou hadst observed them closely thou hadst assuredly  turned away from them in flight, and hadst been filled with awe of them. 
18|19|al-Kahf: The Cave|And in like manner We awakened them that they might question one another.  A speaker from among them said: How long have ye tarried ? They said: We have   tarried a day or some part of a day, (Others) said: Your Lord best knoweth what ye  have tarried. Now send one of you with this your silver coin unto the city, and let him  see what food is purest there and bring you a supply thereof. Let him be courteous  and let no man know of you. 
18|20|al-Kahf: The Cave|For they, if they should come to know of you, will stone you or turn you  back to their religion; then ye will never prosper. 
18|21|al-Kahf: The Cave|And in like manner We disclosed them (to the people of the city) that they  might know that the promise of Allah is true, and that, as for the Hour, there is no  doubt concerning it. When (the people of the city) disputed of their case among  themselves, they said: Build over them a building; their Lord knoweth best  concerning them. Those who won their point said: We verily shall build a place of  worship over them. 
18|22|al-Kahf: The Cave|(Some) will say: They were three, their dog the fourth, and (some) say: Five,  their dog the sixth, guessing at random; and (some) say: Seven, and their dog the  eighth. Say (O Muhammad): My Lord is Best Aware of their number. None knoweth  them save a few. So contend not concerning them except with an outward contending,  and ask not any of them to pronounce concerning them. 
18|23|al-Kahf: The Cave|And say not of anything: Lo! I shall do that tomorrow, 
18|24|al-Kahf: The Cave|Except if Allah will. And remember thy Lord when thou forgettest, and say:  It may be that my Lord guideth me unto a nearer way of truth than this. 
18|25|al-Kahf: The Cave|And (it is said) they tarried in their Cave three hundred years and add nine. 
18|26|al-Kahf: The Cave|Say: Allah is Best Aware how long they tarried. His is the Invisible of the  heavens and the earth. How clear of sight is He and keen of hearing! They have no  protecting friend beside Him, and He maketh none to share in His government. 
18|27|al-Kahf: The Cave|And recite that which hath been revealed unto thee of the Scripture of thy  Lord. There is none who can change His words, and thou wilt find no refuge beside  Him. 
18|28|al-Kahf: The Cave|Restrain thyself along with those who cry unto their Lord at morn and  evening, seeking His Countenance; and let not thine eyes overlook them, desiring the  pomp of the life of the world; and obey not him whose heart We have made heedless  of Our remembrance, who followeth his own lust and whose case hath been  abandoned. 
18|29|al-Kahf: The Cave|Say: (It is) the truth from the Lord of you (all). Then whosoever will, let him  believe, and whosoever will, let him disbelieve. Lo! We have prepared for  disbelievers Fire. Its tent encloseth them. If they ask for showers, they will be  showered with water like to molten lead which burneth the faces. Calamitous the  drink and ill the resting-place! 
18|30|al-Kahf: The Cave|Lo! as for those who believe and do good works - Lo! We suffer not the  reward of one whose work is goodly to be lost. 
18|31|al-Kahf: The Cave|As for such, theirs will be Gardens of Eden, wherein rivers flow beneath  them; therein they will be given armlets of gold and will wear green robes of finest  silk and gold embroidery, reclining upon throne therein. Blest the reward, and fair the  resting-place! 
18|32|al-Kahf: The Cave|Coin for them a similitude: Two men, unto one of whom We had assigned  two gardens of grapes, and We had surrounded both with date-palms and had put  between them tillage. 
18|33|al-Kahf: The Cave|Each of the gardens gave its fruit and withheld naught thereof. And We  caused a river to gush forth therein. 
18|34|al-Kahf: The Cave|And he had fruit. And he said unto his comrade, when he spake with him: I  am more than thee in wealth, and stronger in respect of men. 
18|35|al-Kahf: The Cave|And he went into his garden, while he (thus) wronged himself. He said: I  think not that all this will ever perish. 
18|36|al-Kahf: The Cave|I think not that the Hour will ever come, and if indeed I am brought back  unto my Lord I surely shall find better than this as a resort. 
18|37|al-Kahf: The Cave|His comrade, when he (thus) spake with him, exclaimed: Disbelievest thou in  Him Who created thee of dust, then of a drop (of seed), and then fashioned thee a man  ? 
18|38|al-Kahf: The Cave|But He is Allah, my Lord, and I ascribe unto my Lord no partner. 
18|39|al-Kahf: The Cave|If only, when thou enteredst thy garden, thou hadst said: That which Allah  willeth (will come to pass)! There is no strength save in Allah! Though thou seest me  as less than thee in wealth and children, 
18|40|al-Kahf: The Cave|Yet it may be that my Lord will give me better than thy garden, and will send  on it a bolt from heaven, and some morning it will be a smooth hillside, 
18|41|al-Kahf: The Cave|Or some morning the water thereof will be lost in the earth so that thou canst  not make search for it. 
18|42|al-Kahf: The Cave|And his fruit was beset (with destruction). Then began he to wring his hands  for all that he had spent upon it, when (now) it was all ruined on its trellises, and to  say: Would that I had ascribed no partner to my Lord! 
18|43|al-Kahf: The Cave|And he had no troop of men to help him as against Allah, nor could he save  himself. 
18|44|al-Kahf: The Cave|In this case is protection only from Allah, the True, He is Best for reward,  and best for consequence. 
18|45|al-Kahf: The Cave|And coin for them the similitude of the life of the world as water which We  send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingleth with it and then  becometh dry twigs that the winds scatter. Allah is able to do all things. 
18|46|al-Kahf: The Cave|Wealth and children are an ornament of the life of the world. But the good  deeds which endure are better in thy Lord's sight for reward, and better in respect of  hope. 
18|47|al-Kahf: The Cave|And (bethink you of) the Day when we remove the hills and ye see the earth  emerging, and We gather them together so as to leave not one of them behind. 
18|48|al-Kahf: The Cave|And they are set before thy Lord in ranks (and it is said unto them): Now  verily have ye come unto Us as We created you at the first. But ye thought that We  had set no tryst for you. 
18|49|al-Kahf: The Cave|And the Book is placed, and thou seest the guilty fearful of that which is  therein, and they say: What kind of a Book is this that leaveth not a small thing nor a  great thing but hath counted it! And they find all that they did confronting them, and  thy Lord wrongeth no-one. 
18|50|al-Kahf: The Cave|And (remember) when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam,  and they fell prostrate, all save Iblis. He was of the jinn, so he rebelled against his  Lord's command. Will ye choose him and his seed for your protecting friends instead  of Me, when they are an enemy unto you ? Calamitous is the exchange for evil-doers. 
18|51|al-Kahf: The Cave|I made them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor  their own creation; nor choose I misleaders for (My) helpers. 
18|52|al-Kahf: The Cave|And (be mindful of) the Day when He will say: Call those partners of Mine  whom ye pretended. Then they will cry unto them, but they will not hear their prayer,  and We shall set a gulf of doom between them. 
18|53|al-Kahf: The Cave|And the guilty behold the Fire and know that they are about to fall therein,  and they find no way of escape thence. 
18|54|al-Kahf: The Cave|And verily We have displayed for mankind in this Qur'an all manner of  similitudes, but man is more than anything contentious. 
18|55|al-Kahf: The Cave|And naught hindereth mankind from believing when the guidance cometh  unto them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord unless (it be that they wish) that  the judgment of the men of old should come upon them or (that) they should be  confronted with the Doom. 
18|56|al-Kahf: The Cave|We send not the messengers save as bearers of good news and warners.  Those who disbelieve contend with falsehood in order to refute the Truth thereby.  And they take Our revelations and that wherewith they are threatened as a jest. 
18|57|al-Kahf: The Cave|And who doth greater wrong than he who hath been reminded of the  revelations of his Lord, yet turneth away from them and forgetteth what his hands  send forward (to the Judgment) ? Lo! on their hearts We have placed coverings so  that they understand not, and in their ears a deafness. And though thou call them to  the guidance, in that case they can never be led aright. 
18|58|al-Kahf: The Cave|Thy Lord is the Forgiver, Full of Mercy. If He took them to task (now) for  what they earn, He would hasten on the doom for them; but theirs is an appointed  term from which they will find no escape. 
18|59|al-Kahf: The Cave|And (all) those townships! We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We  appointed a fixed time for their destruction. 
18|60|al-Kahf: The Cave|And when Moses said unto his servant: I will not give up until I reach the  point where the two rivers meet, though I march on for ages. 
18|61|al-Kahf: The Cave|And when they reached the point where the two met, they forgot their fish,  and it took its way into the waters, being free. 
18|62|al-Kahf: The Cave|And when they had gone further, he said unto his servant: Bring us our  breakfast. Verily we have found fatigue in this our journey. 
18|63|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: Didst thou see, when we took refuge on the rock, and I forgot the  fish - and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention it - it took its way into the  waters by a marvel. 
18|64|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: This is that which we have been seeking. So they retraced their steps  again. 
18|65|al-Kahf: The Cave|Then found they one of Our slaves, unto whom We had given mercy from  Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our presence. 
18|66|al-Kahf: The Cave|Moses said unto him: May I follow thee, to the end that thou mayst teach me  right conduct of that which thou hast been taught ? 
18|67|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: Lo! thou canst not bear with me. 
18|68|al-Kahf: The Cave|How canst thou bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any  knowledge ? 
18|69|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: Allah willing, thou shalt find me patient and I shall not in aught  gainsay thee. 
18|70|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: Well, if thou go with me, ask me not concerning aught till I myself  make mention of it unto thee. 
18|71|al-Kahf: The Cave|So they twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a hole therein.  (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole therein to drown the folk thereof ? Thou verily  hast done a dreadful thing. 
18|72|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me ? 
18|73|al-Kahf: The Cave|(Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot, and be not hard upon me  for my fault. 
18|74|al-Kahf: The Cave|So they twain journeyed on till, when they met a lad, he slew him. (Moses)  said: What! Hast thou slain an innocent soul who hath slain no man ? Verily thou hast  done a horrid thing. 
18|75|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me ? 
18|76|al-Kahf: The Cave|(Moses) said: If I ask thee after this concerning aught, keep not company  with me. Thou hast received an excuse from me. 
18|77|al-Kahf: The Cave|So they twain journeyed on till, when they came unto the folk of a certain  township, they asked its folk for food, but they refused to make them guests. And  they found therein a wall upon the point of falling into ruin, and he repaired it.  (Moses) said: If thou hadst wished, thou couldst have taken payment for it. 
18|78|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: This is the parting between thee and me! I will announce unto thee  the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear with patience. 
18|79|al-Kahf: The Cave|As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the river, and I wished  to mar it, for there was a king behind them who is taking every ship by force. 
18|80|al-Kahf: The Cave|And as for the lad, his parents were believers and we feared lest he should  oppress them by rebellion and disbelief. 
18|81|al-Kahf: The Cave|And we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in  purity and nearer to mercy. 
18|82|al-Kahf: The Cave|And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was  beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father had been righteous, and thy  Lord intended that they should come to their full strength and should bring forth their  treasure as a mercy from their Lord; and I did it not upon my own command. Such is  the interpretation of that wherewith thou couldst not bear. 
18|83|al-Kahf: The Cave|They will ask thee of Dhu'l-Qarneyn. Say: I shall recite unto you a  remembrance of him. 
18|84|al-Kahf: The Cave|Lo! We made him strong in the land and gave him unto every thing a road. 
18|85|al-Kahf: The Cave|And he followed a road 
18|86|al-Kahf: The Cave|Till, when he reached the setting-place of the sun, he found it setting in a  muddy spring, and found a people thereabout. We said: O Dhu'l-Qarneyn! Either  punish or show them kindness. 
18|87|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: As for him who doeth wrong, we shall punish him, and then he will  be brought back unto his Lord, Who will punish him with awful punishment! 
18|88|al-Kahf: The Cave|But as for him who believeth and doeth right, good will be his reward, and  We shall speak unto him a mild command. 
18|89|al-Kahf: The Cave|Then he followed a road 
18|90|al-Kahf: The Cave|Till, when he reached the rising-place of the sun, he found it rising on a  people for whom We had appointed no shelter therefrom. 
18|91|al-Kahf: The Cave|So (it was). And We knew all concerning him. 
18|92|al-Kahf: The Cave|Then he followed a road 
18|93|al-Kahf: The Cave|Till, when he came between the two mountains, he found upon their hither  side a folk that scarce could understand a saying. 
18|94|al-Kahf: The Cave|They said: O Dhu'l-Qarneyn! Lo! Gog and Magog are spoiling the land. So  may we pay thee tribute on condition that thou set a barrier between us and them ? 
18|95|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: That wherein my Lord hath established me is better (than your  tribute). Do but help me with strength (of men), I will set between you and them a  bank. 
18|96|al-Kahf: The Cave|Give me pieces of iron - till, when he had levelled up (the gap) between the  cliffs, he said: Blow! - till, when he had made it a fire, he said: Bring me molten  copper to pour thereon. 
18|97|al-Kahf: The Cave|And (Gog and Magog) were not able to surmount, nor could they pierce (it). 
18|98|al-Kahf: The Cave|He said: This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord  cometh to pass, He will lay it low, for the promise of my Lord is true. 
18|99|al-Kahf: The Cave|And on that day we shall let some of them surge against others, and the  Trumpet will be blown. Then We shall gather them together in one gathering. 
18|100|al-Kahf: The Cave|On that day we shall present hell to the disbelievers, plain to view, 
18|101|al-Kahf: The Cave|Those whose eyes were hoodwinked from My reminder, and who could not  bear to hear. 
18|102|al-Kahf: The Cave|Do the disbelievers reckon that they can choose My bondmen as protecting  friends beside Me ? Lo! We have prepared hell as a welcome for the disbelievers. 
18|103|al-Kahf: The Cave|Say: Shall We inform you who will be the greatest losers by their works ? 
18|104|al-Kahf: The Cave|Those whose effort goeth astray in the life of the world, and yet they reckon  that they do good work. 
18|105|al-Kahf: The Cave|Those are they who disbelieve in the revelations of their Lord and in the  meeting with Him. Therefor their works are vain, and on the Day of Resurrection We  assign no weight to them. 
18|106|al-Kahf: The Cave|That is their reward: hell, because they disbelieved, and made a jest of Our  revelations and Our messengers. 
18|107|al-Kahf: The Cave|Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs are the Gardens of Paradise  for welcome, 
18|108|al-Kahf: The Cave|Wherein they will abide, with no desire to be removed from thence. 
18|109|al-Kahf: The Cave|Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily the sea  would be used up before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even though We  brought the like thereof to help. 
18|110|al-Kahf: The Cave|Say: I am only a mortal like you. My Lord inspireth in me that your God is  only One God. And whoever hopeth for the meeting with his Lord, let him do  righteous work, and make none sharer of the worship due unto his Lord. 
19|1|Maryam: Mary|Kaf. Ha. Ya. A'in. Sad. 
19|2|Maryam: Mary|A mention of the mercy of thy Lord unto His servant Zachariah. 
19|3|Maryam: Mary|When he cried unto his Lord a cry in secret, 
19|4|Maryam: Mary|Saying: My Lord! Lo! the bones of me wax feeble and my head is shining  with grey hair, and I have never been unblest in prayer to Thee, my Lord. 
19|5|Maryam: Mary|Lo! I fear my kinsfolk after me, since my wife is barren. Oh, give me from  Thy presence a successor 
19|6|Maryam: Mary|Who shall inherit of me and inherit (also) of the house of Jacob. And make  him, my Lord, acceptable (unto Thee).
