19|7|Maryam: Mary|(It was said unto him): O Zachariah! Lo! We bring thee tidings of a son  whose name is John; we have given the same name to none before (him). 
19|8|Maryam: Mary|He said: My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren and I have  reached infirm old age ? 
19|9|Maryam: Mary|He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me, even as I created  thee before, when thou wast naught. 
19|10|Maryam: Mary|He said: My Lord! Appoint for me some token. He said: Thy token is that  thou, with no bodily defect, shalt not speak unto mankind three nights. 
19|11|Maryam: Mary|Then he came forth unto his people from the sanctuary, and signified to  them: Glorify your Lord at break of day and fall of night. 
19|12|Maryam: Mary|(And it was said unto his son): O John! Hold fast the Scripture. And we gave  him wisdom when a child, 
19|13|Maryam: Mary|And compassion from Our presence, and purity; and he was devout, 
19|14|Maryam: Mary|And dutiful toward his parents. And he was not arrogant, rebellious. 
19|15|Maryam: Mary|Peace on him the day he was born, and the day he dieth and the day he shall  be raised alive! 
19|16|Maryam: Mary|And make mention of Mary in the Scripture, when she had withdrawn from  her people to a chamber looking East, 
19|17|Maryam: Mary|And had chosen seclusion from them. Then We sent unto her Our Spirit and  it assumed for her the likeness of a perfect man. 
19|18|Maryam: Mary|She said: Lo! I seek refuge in the Beneficent One from thee, if thou art God- fearing. 
19|19|Maryam: Mary|He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on thee a  faultless son. 
19|20|Maryam: Mary|She said: How can I have a son when no mortal hath touched me, neither  have I been unchaste ? 
19|21|Maryam: Mary|He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me. And (it will be)  that We may make of him a revelation for mankind and a mercy from Us, and it is a  thing ordained. 
19|22|Maryam: Mary|And she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a far place. 
19|23|Maryam: Mary|And the pangs of childbirth drove her unto the trunk of the palm-tree. She  said: Oh, would that I had died ere this and had become a thing of naught, forgotten! 
19|24|Maryam: Mary|Then (one) cried unto her from below her, saying: Grieve not! Thy Lord hath  placed a rivulet beneath thee, 
19|25|Maryam: Mary|And shake the trunk of the palm-tree toward thee, thou wilt cause ripe dates  to fall upon thee. 
19|26|Maryam: Mary|So eat and drink and be consoled. And if thou meetest any mortal, say: Lo! I  have vowed a fast unto the Beneficent, and may not speak this day to any mortal. 
19|27|Maryam: Mary|Then she brought him to her own folk, carrying him. They said: O Mary!  Thou hast come with an amazing thing. 
19|28|Maryam: Mary|O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a wicked man nor was thy mother a  harlot. 
19|29|Maryam: Mary|Then she pointed to him. They said: How can we talk to one who is in the  cradle, a young boy ? 
19|30|Maryam: Mary|He spake: Lo! I am the slave of Allah. He hath given me the Scripture and  hath appointed me a Prophet, 
19|31|Maryam: Mary|And hath made me blessed wheresoever I may be, and hath enjoined upon  me prayer and almsgiving so long as I remain alive, 
19|32|Maryam: Mary|And (hath made me) dutiful toward her who bore me, and hath not made me  arrogant, unblest. 
19|33|Maryam: Mary|Peace on me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be  raised alive! 
19|34|Maryam: Mary|Such was Jesus, son of Mary: (this is) a statement of the truth concerning  which they doubt. 
19|35|Maryam: Mary|It befitteth not (the Majesty of) Allah that He should take unto Himself a son.  Glory be to Him! When He decreeth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is. 
19|36|Maryam: Mary|And lo! Allah is my Lord and your Lord. So serve Him. That is the right  path. 
19|37|Maryam: Mary|The sects among them differ: but woe unto the disbelievers from the meeting  of an awful Day. 
19|38|Maryam: Mary|See and hear them on the Day they come unto Us! yet the evil-doers are to- day in error manifest. 
19|39|Maryam: Mary|And warn them of the Day of anguish when the case hath been decided. Now  they are in a state of carelessness, and they believe not. 
19|40|Maryam: Mary|Lo! We, only We, inherit the earth and all who are thereon, and unto Us they  are returned. 
19|41|Maryam: Mary|And make mention (O Muhammad) in the Scripture of Abraham. Lo! he was  a saint, a prophet. 
19|42|Maryam: Mary|When he said unto his father: O my father! Why worshippest thou that which  heareth not nor seeth, nor can in aught avail thee ? 
19|43|Maryam: Mary|O my father! Lo! there hath come unto me of knowledge that which came  not unto thee. So follow me, and I will lead thee on a right path. 
19|44|Maryam: Mary|O my father! Serve not the devil. Lo! the devil is a rebel unto the Beneficent. 
19|45|Maryam: Mary|O my father! Lo! I fear lest a punishment from the Beneficent overtake thee  so that thou become a comrade of the devil. 
19|46|Maryam: Mary|He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham ? If thou cease not, I shall  surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while! 
19|47|Maryam: Mary|He said: Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee. Lo!  He was ever gracious unto me. 
19|48|Maryam: Mary|I shall withdraw from you and that unto which ye pray beside Allah, and I  shall pray unto my Lord. It may be that, in prayer unto my Lord, I shall not be  unblest. 
19|49|Maryam: Mary|So, when he had withdrawn from them and that which they were  worshipping beside Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob. Each of them We made a  prophet. 
19|50|Maryam: Mary|And we gave them of Our mercy, and assigned to them a high and true  renown. 
19|51|Maryam: Mary|And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen, and he was  a messenger (of Allah), a prophet. 
19|52|Maryam: Mary|We called him from the right slope of the Mount, and brought him nigh in  communion. 
19|53|Maryam: Mary|And We bestowed upon him of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet  (likewise). 
19|54|Maryam: Mary|And make mention in the Scripture of Ishmael. Lo! he was a keeper of his  promise, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet. 
19|55|Maryam: Mary|He enjoined upon his people worship and almsgiving, and was acceptable in  the sight of his Lord. 
19|56|Maryam: Mary|And make mention in the Scripture of Idris. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet; 
19|57|Maryam: Mary|And We raised him to high station. 
19|58|Maryam: Mary|These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of  the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the  seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose.  When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down,  adoring and weeping. 
19|59|Maryam: Mary|Now there hath succeeded them a later generation whom have ruined  worship and have followed lusts. But they will meet deception. 
19|60|Maryam: Mary|Save him who shall repent and believe and do right. Such will enter the  Garden, and they will not be wronged in aught - 
19|61|Maryam: Mary|Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent hath promised to His slaves in the  unseen. Lo! His promise is ever sure of fulfilment - 
19|62|Maryam: Mary|They hear therein no idle talk, but only Peace; and therein they have food for  morn and evening. 
19|63|Maryam: Mary|Such is the Garden which We cause the devout among Our bondmen to  inherit. 
19|64|Maryam: Mary|We (angels) come not down save by commandment of thy Lord. Unto Him  belongeth all that is before us and all that is behind us and all that is between those  two, and thy Lord was never forgetful - 
19|65|Maryam: Mary|Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them! Therefor,  worship thou Him and be thou steadfast in His service. Knowest thou one that can be  named along with Him ? 
19|66|Maryam: Mary|And man saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth alive ? 
19|67|Maryam: Mary|Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was naught ? 
19|68|Maryam: Mary|And, by thy Lord, verily We shall assemble them and the devils, then We  shall bring them, crouching, around hell. 
19|69|Maryam: Mary|Then We shall pluck out from every sect whichever of them was most  stubborn in rebellion to the Beneficent. 
19|70|Maryam: Mary|And surely We are Best Aware of those most worthy to be burned therein. 
19|71|Maryam: Mary|There is not one of you but shall approach it. That is a fixed ordinance of thy  Lord. 
19|72|Maryam: Mary|Then We shall rescue those who kept from evil, and leave the evil-doers  crouching there. 
19|73|Maryam: Mary|And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, those who disbelieve  say unto those who believe: Which of the two parties (yours or ours) is better in  position, and more imposing as an army ? 
19|74|Maryam: Mary|How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were more  imposing in respect of gear and outward seeming! 
19|75|Maryam: Mary|Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will verily prolong his span  of life until, when they behold that which they were promised, whether it be  punishment (in the world), or the Hour (of doom), they will know who is worse in  position and who is weaker as an army. 
19|76|Maryam: Mary|Allah increaseth in right guidance those who walk aright, and the good deeds  which endure are better in thy Lord's sight for reward, and better for resort. 
19|77|Maryam: Mary|Hast thou seen him who disbelieveth in Our revelations and saith: Assuredly  I shall be given wealth and children ? 
19|78|Maryam: Mary|Hath he perused the Unseen, or hath he made a pact with the Beneficent ? 
19|79|Maryam: Mary|Nay, but We shall record that which he saith and prolong for him a span of  torment. 
19|80|Maryam: Mary|And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he will come unto  Us, alone (without his wealth and children). 
19|81|Maryam: Mary|And they have chosen (other) gods beside Allah that they may be a power for  them. 
19|82|Maryam: Mary|Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and become opponents unto  them. 
19|83|Maryam: Mary|Seest thou not that We have set the devils on the disbelievers to confound  them with confusion ? 
19|84|Maryam: Mary|So make no haste against them (O Muhammad). We do but number unto  them a sum (of days). 
19|85|Maryam: Mary|On the day when We shall gather the righteous unto the Beneficent, a goodly  company. 
19|86|Maryam: Mary|And drive the guilty unto hell, a weary herd, 
19|87|Maryam: Mary|They will have no power of intercession, save him who hath made a  covenant with his Lord. 
19|88|Maryam: Mary|And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son. 
19|89|Maryam: Mary|Assuredly ye utter a disastrous thing 
19|90|Maryam: Mary|Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split asunder and the  mountains fall in ruins, 
19|91|Maryam: Mary|That ye ascribe unto the Beneficent a son, 
19|92|Maryam: Mary|When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He should  choose a son. 
19|93|Maryam: Mary|There is none in the heavens and the earth but cometh unto the Beneficent as  a slave. 
19|94|Maryam: Mary|Verily He knoweth them and numbereth them with (right) numbering. 
19|95|Maryam: Mary|And each one of them will come unto Him on the Day of Resurrection,  alone. 
19|96|Maryam: Mary|Lo! those who believe and do good works, the Beneficent will appoint for  them love. 
19|97|Maryam: Mary|And We make (this Scripture) easy in thy tongue, (O Muhammad) only that  thou mayst bear good tidings therewith unto those who ward off (evil), and warn  therewith the froward folk. 
19|98|Maryam: Mary|And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Canst thou  (Muhammad) see a single man of them, or hear from them the slightest sound ? 
20|1|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Ta. Ha. 
20|2|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|We have not revealed unto thee (Muhammad) this Qur'an that thou shouldst  be distressed, 
20|3|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|But as a reminder unto him who feareth, 
20|4|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens, 
20|5|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne. 
20|6|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the  earth, and whatsoever is between them, and whatsoever is beneath the sod. 
20|7|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And if thou speakest aloud, then lo! He knoweth the secret (thought) and  (that which is yet) more hidden. 
20|8|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Allah! There is no God save Him. His are the most beautiful names. 
20|9|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Hath there come unto thee the story of Moses ? 
20|10|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|When he saw a fire and said unto his folk: Lo! Wait! I see a fire afar off.  Peradventure I may bring you a brand therefrom or may find guidance at the fire. 
20|11|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And when he reached it, he was called by name: O Moses! 
20|12|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord, So take off thy shoes, for lo! thou art in the holy  valley of Tuwa. 
20|13|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And I have chosen thee, so hearken unto that which is inspired. 
20|14|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! I, even I, am Allah, There is no God save Me. So serve Me and establish  worship for My remembrance. 
20|15|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! the Hour is surely coming. But I will to keep it hidden, that every soul  may be rewarded for that which it striveth (to achieve). 
20|16|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Therefor, let not him turn thee aside from (the thought of) it who believeth  not therein but followeth his own desire, lest thou perish. 
20|17|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses ? 
20|18|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: This is my staff whereon I lean, and wherewith I bear down  branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses. 
20|19|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Cast it down, O Moses! 
20|20|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|So he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent, gliding. 
20|21|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Grasp it and fear not. We shall return it to its former state. 
20|22|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And thrust thy hand within thine armpit, it will come forth white without  hurt. (That will be) another token. 
20|23|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|That We may show thee (some) of Our greater portents, 
20|24|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds). 
20|25|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Moses) said: My Lord! relieve my mind 
20|26|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And ease my task for me; 
20|27|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And loose a knot from my tongue, 
20|28|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|That they may understand my saying. 
20|29|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Appoint for me a henchman from my folk, 
20|30|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Aaron, my brother. 
20|31|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Confirm my strength with him 
20|32|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And let him share my task, 
20|33|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|That we may glorify Thee much 
20|34|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And much remember Thee. 
20|35|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! Thou art ever Seeing us. 
20|36|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Thou art granted thy request, O Moses. 
20|37|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And indeed, another time, already We have shown thee favour, 
20|38|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|When we inspired in thy mother that which is inspired, 
20|39|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Saying: Throw him into the ark, and throw it into the river, then the river  shall throw it on to the bank, and there an enemy to Me and an enemy to him shall  take him. And I endued thee with love from Me that thou mightest be trained  according to My will, 
20|40|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|When thy sister went and said: Shall I show you one who will nurse him ?  and we restored thee to thy mother that her eyes might be refreshed and might not  sorrow. And thou didst kill a man and We delivered thee from great distress, and tried  thee with a heavy trial. And thou didst tarry years among the folk of Midian. Then  camest thou (hither) by (My) providence, O Moses, 
20|41|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And I have attached thee to Myself. 
20|42|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Go, thou and thy brother, with My tokens, and be not faint in remembrance  of Me. 
20|43|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds). 
20|44|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And speak unto him a gentle word, that peradventure he may heed or fear. 
20|45|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They said: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with us or that  he may play the tyrant. 
20|46|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Fear not. Lo! I am with you twain, Hearing and Seeing. 
20|47|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|So go ye unto him and say: Lo! we are two messengers of thy Lord. So let  the children of Israel go with us, and torment them not. We bring thee a token from  thy Lord. And peace will be for him who followeth right guidance. 
20|48|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! it hath been revealed unto us that the doom will be for him who denieth  and turneth away. 
20|49|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses ? 
20|50|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Our Lord is He Who gave unto everything its nature, then guided it  aright. 
20|51|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: What then is the state of the generations of old ? 
20|52|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord  neither erreth nor forgetteth, 
20|53|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Who hath appointed the earth as a bed and hath threaded roads for you  therein and hath sent down water from the sky and thereby We have brought forth  divers kinds of vegetation, 
20|54|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Saying): Eat ye and feed your cattle. Lo! herein verily are portents for men  of thought. 
20|55|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Thereof We created you, and thereunto We return you, and thence We bring  you forth a second time. 
20|56|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And We verily did show him all Our tokens, but he denied them and refused. 
20|57|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Hast come to drive us out from our land by thy magic, O Moses ? 
20|58|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|But we surely can produce for thee magic the like thereof; so appoint a tryst  between us and you, which neither we nor thou shall fail to keep, at a place  convenient (to us both). 
20|59|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Moses) said: Your tryst shall be the day of the feast, and let the people  assemble when the sun hath risen high. 
20|60|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the appointed  tryst). 
20|61|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He  extirpate you by some punishment. He who lieth faileth miserably. 
20|62|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then they debated one with another what they must do, and they kept their  counsel secret. 
20|63|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They said: Lo! these are two wizards who would drive you out from your  country by their magic, and destroy your best traditions; 
20|64|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|So arrange your plan, and come in battle line. Whoso is uppermost this day  will be indeed successful. 
20|65|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They said: O Moses! Either throw first, or let us be the first to throw ? 
20|66|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Nay, do ye throw! Then lo! their cords and their staves, by their  magic, appeared to him as though they ran. 
20|67|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And Moses conceived a fear in his mind. 
20|68|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|We said: Fear not! Lo! thou art the higher. 
20|69|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Throw that which is in thy right hand! It will eat up that which they have  made. Lo! that which they have made is but a wizard's artifice, and a wizard shall not  be successful to whatever point (of skill) he may attain. 
20|70|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We believe in the  Lord of Aaron and Moses. 
20|71|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he is your  chief who taught you magic. Now surely I shall cut off your hands and your feet  alternately, and I shall crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and ye shall know for  certain which of us hath sterner and more lasting punishment. 
20|72|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They said: We choose thee not above the clear proofs that have come unto  us, and above Him Who created us. So decree what thou wilt decree. Thou wilt end  for us only this life of the world. 
20|73|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! we believe in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the magic  unto which thou didst force us. Allah is better and more lasting. 
20|74|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Lo! whoso cometh guilty unto his Lord, verily for him is hell. There he will  neither die nor live. 
20|75|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|But whoso cometh unto Him a believer, having done good works, for such  are the high stations; 
20|76|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for  ever. That is the reward of him who groweth. 
20|77|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night and  strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to be overtaken, neither being afraid  (of the sea). 
20|78|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then Pharaoh followed them with his hosts and there covered them that  which did cover them of the sea. 
20|79|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And Pharaoh led his folk astray, he did not guide them. 
20|80|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and we made a  covenant with you on the holy mountain's side, and sent down on you the manna and  the quails, 
20|81|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Saying): Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you, and  transgress not in respect thereof lest My wrath come upon you: and he on whom My  wrath cometh, he is lost indeed. 
20|82|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And lo! verily I am Forgiving toward him who repenteth and believeth and  doeth good, and afterward walketh aright. 
20|83|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And (it was said): What hath made thee hasten from thy folk, O Moses ? 
20|84|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: They are close upon my track. I hastened unto Thee, my Lord, that  Thou mightest be well pleased. 
20|85|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Lo! We have tried thy folk in thine absence, and As-Samiri hath  misled them. 
20|86|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then Moses went back unto his folk, angry and sad. He said: O my people!  Hath not your Lord promised you a fair promise ? Did the time appointed then appear  too long for you, or did ye wish that wrath from your Lord should come upon you,  that ye broke tryst with me ? 
20|87|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They said: We broke not tryst with thee of our own will, but we were laden  with burdens of ornaments of the folk, then cast them (in the fire), for thus As-Samiri  proposed. 
20|88|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then he produced for them a calf, of saffron hue, which gave forth a lowing  sound. And they cried: This is your god and the god of Moses, but he hath forgotten. 
20|89|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|See they not, then, that it returneth no saying unto them and possesseth for  them neither hurt nor use ? 
20|90|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And Aaron indeed had told them beforehand: O my people! Ye are but being  seduced therewith, for lo! your Lord is the Beneficent, so follow me and obey my  order. 
20|91|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They said: We shall by no means cease to be its votaries till Moses return  unto us. 
20|92|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He (Moses) said: O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see them  gone astray, 
20|93|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|That thou followedst me not ? Hast thou then disobeyed my order ? 
20|94|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: O son of my mother! Clutch not my beard nor my head! I feared lest  thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among the Children of Israel, and hast  not waited for my word. 
20|95|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Moses) said: And what hast thou to say, O Samiri ? 
20|96|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: I perceived what they perceive not, so I seized a handful from the  footsteps of the messenger, and then threw it in. Thus my soul commended to me. 
20|97|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|(Moses) said: Then go! and lo! in this life it is for thee to say: Touch me not!  and lo! there is for thee a tryst thou canst not break. Now look upon thy god of which  thou hast remained a votary. Verily we will burn it and will scatter its dust over the  sea. 
20|98|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Your God is only Allah, than Whom there is no other God. He embraceth all  things in His knowledge. 
20|99|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Thus relate We unto thee (Muhammad) some tidings of that which happened  of old, and We have given thee from Our presence a reminder. 
20|100|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Whoso turneth away from it, he verily will bear a burden on the Day of  Resurrection, 
20|101|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Abiding under it - an evil burden for them on the Day of Resurrection, 
20|102|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|The day when the Trumpet is blown. On that day we assemble the guilty  white-eyed (with terror), 
20|103|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Murmuring among themselves: Ye have tarried but ten (days). 
20|104|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|We are Best Aware of what they utter when their best in conduct say: Ye  have tarried but a day. 
20|105|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|They will ask thee of the mountains (on that day). Say: My Lord will break  them into scattered dust. 
20|106|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And leave it as an empty plain, 
20|107|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Wherein thou seest neither curve nor ruggedness. 
20|108|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|On that day they follow the summoner who deceiveth not, and voices are  hushed for the Beneficent, and thou hearest but a faint murmur. 
20|109|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|On that day no intercession availeth save (that of) him unto whom the  Beneficent hath given leave and whose word He accepteth. 
20|110|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He knoweth (all) that is before them and (all) that is behind them, while they  cannot compass it in knowledge. 
20|111|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And faces humble themselves before the Living, the Eternal. And he who  beareth (a burden of) wrongdoing is indeed a failure (on that day). 
20|112|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And he who hath done some good works, being a believer, he feareth not  injustice nor begrudging (of his wage). 
20|113|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Thus we have revealed it as a Lecture in Arabic, and have displayed therein  certain threats, that peradventure they may keep from evil or that it may cause them to  take heed. 
20|114|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then exalted be Allah, the True King! And hasten not (O Muhammad) with  the Qur'an ere its revelation hath been perfected unto thee, and say: My Lord!  Increase me in knowledge. 
20|115|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot, and We  found no constancy in him. 
20|116|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, they fell  prostrate (all) save Iblis; he refused. 
20|117|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Therefor we said: O Adam! This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so  let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil. 
20|118|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|It is (vouchsafed) unto thee that thou hungerest not therein nor art naked, 
20|119|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And that thou thirstest not therein nor art exposed to the sun's heat. 
20|120|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|But the devil whispered to him, saying: O Adam! Shall I show thee the tree  of immortality and power that wasteth not away ? 
20|121|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then they twain ate thereof, so that their shame became apparent unto them,  and they began to hide by heaping on themselves some of the leaves of the Garden.  And Adam disobeyed his Lord, so went astray. 
20|122|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him. 
20|123|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He said: Go down hence, both of you, one of you a foe unto the other. But  when there come unto you from Me a guidance, then whoso followeth My guidance,  he will not go astray nor come to grief. 
20|124|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|But he who turneth away from remembrance of Me, his will be a narrow life,  and I shall bring him blind to the assembly on the Day of Resurrection. 
20|125|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He will say: My Lord! Wherefor hast Thou gathered me (hither) blind, when  I was wont to see ? 
20|126|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|He will say: So (it must be). Our revelations came unto thee but thou didst  forget them. In like manner thou art forgotten this Day. 
20|127|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Thus do We reward him who is prodigal and believeth not the revelations of  his Lord; and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be sterner and more lasting. 
20|128|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Is it not a guidance for them (to know) how many a generation We destroyed  before them, amid whose dwellings they walk ? Lo! therein verily are signs for men  of thought. 
20|129|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord, and a term  already fixed, the judgment would have been inevitable (in this world). 
20|130|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Therefor (O Muhammad), bear with what they say, and celebrate the praise  of thy Lord ere the rising of the sun and ere the going down thereof. And glorify Him  some hours of the night and at the two ends of the day, that thou mayst find  acceptance. 
20|131|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs  among them to enjoy, the flower of the life of the world, that We may try them  thereby. The provision of thy Lord is better and more lasting. 
20|132|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And enjoin upon thy people worship, and be constant therein. We ask not of  thee a provision: We provided for thee. And the sequel is for righteousness. 
20|133|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And they say: If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord! Hath there  not come unto them the proof of what is in the former scriptures ? 
20|134|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|And if we had destroyed them with some punishment before it, they would  assuredly have said: Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent unto us a messenger, so that  we might have followed Thy revelations before we were (thus) humbled and  disgraced! 
20|135|Ta Ha: Ta Ha|Say: Each is awaiting; so await ye! Ye will come to know who are the  owners of the path of equity, and who is right. 
21|1|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind, while they turn away in  heedlessness. 
21|2|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Never cometh there unto them a new reminder from their Lord but they listen  to it while they play, 
21|3|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|With hearts preoccupied. And they confer in secret. The wrong-doers say: Is  this other than a mortal like you ? Will ye then succumb to magic when ye see (it) ? 
21|4|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He saith: My Lord knoweth what is spoken in the heaven and the earth. He is  the Hearer, the Knower. 
21|5|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Nay, say they, (these are but) muddled dreams; nay, he hath but invented it;  nay, he is but a poet. Let him bring us a portent even as those of old (who were God's  messengers) were sent (with portents). 
21|6|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Not a township believed of those which We destroyed before them (though  We sent them portents): would they then believe ? 
21|7|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men, whom We  inspired. Ask the followers of the Reminder if ye know not ? 
21|8|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|We gave them not bodies that would not eat food, nor were they immortals. 
21|9|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then we fulfilled the promise unto them. So we delivered them and whom  We would, and We destroyed the prodigals. 
21|10|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Now We have revealed unto you a Scripture wherein is your Reminder. Have  ye then no sense ? 
21|11|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|How many a community that dealt unjustly have We shattered, and raised up  after them another folk! 
21|12|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And, when they felt Our might, behold them fleeing from it! 
21|13|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|(But it was said unto them): Flee not, but return to that (existence) which  emasculated you and to your dwellings, that ye may be questioned. 
21|14|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They cried: Alas for us! we were wrong-doers. 
21|15|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And this their crying ceased not till We made them as reaped corn, extinct. 
21|16|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in play. 
21|17|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|If We had wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in Our presence  - if We ever did. 
21|18|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Nay, but We hurl the true against the false, and it doth break its head and lo!  it vanisheth. And yours will be woe for that which ye ascribe (unto Him). 
21|19|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those  who dwell in His presence are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they weary; 
21|20|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They glorify (Him) night and day; they flag not. 
21|21|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Or have they chosen gods from the earth who raise the dead ? 
21|22|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|If there were therein gods beside Allah, then verily both (the heavens and the  earth) had been disordered. Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the Throne, from all that  they ascribe (unto Him). 
21|23|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He will not be questioned as to that which He doeth, but they will be  questioned. 
21|24|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Or have they chosen other gods beside Him ? say: Bring your proof (of their  godhead). This is the Reminder of those with me and those before me, but most of  them know not the Truth and so they are averse. 
21|25|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We sent no messenger before thee but We inspired him, (saying): There  is no God save Me (Allah), so worship Me. 
21|26|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son. Be He  Glorified! Nay, but (those whom they call sons) are honoured slaves; 
21|27|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command. 
21|28|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot  intercede except for him whom He accepteth, and they quake for awe of Him. 
21|29|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And one of them who should say: Lo! I am a god beside Him, that one We  should repay with hell. Thus We Repay wrong-doers. 
21|30|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the earth were of  one piece, then We parted them, and we made every living thing of water ? Will they  not then believe ? 
21|31|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We have placed in the earth firm hills lest it quake with them, and We  have placed therein ravines as roads that haply they may find their way. 
21|32|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And we have made the sky a roof withheld (from them). Yet they turn away  from its portents. 
21|33|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And He it is Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon.  They float, each in an orbit. 
21|34|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|We appointed immortality for no mortal before thee. What! if thou diest, can  they be immortal! 
21|35|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Every soul must taste of death, and We try you with evil and with good, for  ordeal. And unto Us ye will be returned. 
21|36|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And when those who disbelieve behold thee, they but choose thee out for  mockery, (saying): Is this he who maketh mention of your gods ? And they would  deny all mention of the Beneficent. 
21|37|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Man is made of haste. I shall show you My portents, but ask Me not to  hasten. 
21|38|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And they say: When will this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful ? 
21|39|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not be able to  drive off the fire from their faces and from their backs, and they will not be helped! 
21|40|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Nay, but it will come upon them unawares so that it will stupefy them, and  they will be unable to repel it, neither will they be reprieved. 
21|41|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Messengers before thee, indeed, were mocked, but that whereat they mocked  surrounded those who scoffed at them. 
21|42|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Say: Who guardeth you in the night or in the day from the Beneficent ? Nay,  but they turn away from mention of their Lord! 
21|43|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Or have they gods who can shield them from Us ? They cannot help  themselves nor can they be defended from Us. 
21|44|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Nay, but We gave these and their fathers ease until life grew long for them.  See they not how we aim to the land, reducing it of its outlying parts ? Can they then  be the victors ? 
21|45|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I warn you only by the Inspiration. But  the deaf hear not the call when they are warned. 
21|46|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And if a breath of thy Lord's punishment were to touch them, they assuredly  would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers. 
21|47|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We set a just balance for the Day of Resurrection so that no soul is  wronged in aught. Though it be of the weight of a grain of mustard seed, We bring it.  And We suffice for reckoners. 
21|48|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) and  a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil, 
21|49|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Those who fear their Lord in secret and who dread the Hour (of doom). 
21|50|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|This is a blessed Reminder that we have revealed: Will ye then reject it ? 
21|51|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware  of him, 
21|52|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images unto which  ye pay devotion ? 
21|53|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them. 
21|54|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error. 
21|55|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester ? 
21|56|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who  created them; and I am of those who testify unto that. 
21|57|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone away and  turned your backs. 
21|58|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them, that haply  they might have recourse to it. 
21|59|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They said: Who hath done this to our gods ? Surely it must be some evil- doer. 
21|60|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham. 
21|61|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may  testify. 
21|62|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham ? 
21|63|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can  speak. 
21|64|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers. 
21|65|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that  these speak not. 
21|66|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot profit you at all,  nor harm you ? 
21|67|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then no sense ? 
21|68|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing. 
21|69|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham, 
21|70|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And they wished to set a snare for him, but We made them the greater losers. 
21|71|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We rescued him and Lot (and brought them) to the land which We have  blessed for (all) peoples. 
21|72|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and Jacob as a grandson. Each of them  We made righteous. 
21|73|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We made them chiefs who guide by Our command, and We inspired in  them the doing of good deeds and the right establishment of worship and the giving of  alms, and they were worshippers of Us (alone). 
21|74|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And unto Lot we gave judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him from  the community that did abominations. Lo! they were folk of evil, lewd. 
21|75|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We brought him in unto Our mercy. Lo! he was of the righteous. 
21|76|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And Noah, when he cried of old, We heard his prayer and saved him and his  household from the great affliction. 
21|77|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And delivered him from the people who denied Our revelations. Lo! they  were folk of evil, therefor did We drown them all. 
21|78|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field,  when people's sheep had strayed and browsed therein by night; and We were  witnesses to their judgment. 
21|79|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We made Solomon to understand (the case); and unto each of them We  gave judgment and knowledge. And we subdued the hills and the birds to hymn (His)  praise along with David. We were the doers (thereof). 
21|80|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We taught him the art of making garments (of mail) to protect you in  your daring. Are ye then thankful ? 
21|81|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And unto Solomon (We subdued) the wind in its raging. It set by his  command toward the land which We had blessed. And of everything We are Aware. 
21|82|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And of the evil ones (subdued We unto him) some who dived (for pearls) for  him and did other work, and We were warders unto them. 
21|83|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And Job, when he cried unto his Lord, (saying): Lo! adversity afflicteth me,  and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy. 
21|84|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then We heard his prayer and removed that adversity from which he  suffered, and We gave him his household (that he had lost) and the like thereof along  with them, a mercy from Our store, and a remembrance for the worshippers; 
21|85|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And (mention) Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhu'l-Kifl. All were of the steadfast. 
21|86|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And We brought them in unto Our mercy. Lo! they are among the righteous. 
21|87|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And (mention) Dhu'n-Nun, when he went off in anger and deemed that We  had no power over him, but he cried out in the darkness, saying: There is no God save  Thee. Be Thou Glorified! Lo! I have been a wrong-doer. 
21|88|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then we heard his prayer and saved him from the anguish. Thus we save  believers. 
21|89|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And Zachariah, when he cried unto his Lord: My Lord! Leave me not  childless, though Thou art the Best of inheritors. 
21|90|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then We heard his prayer, and bestowed upon him John, and adjusted his  wife (to bear a child) for him. Lo! they used to vie one with the other in good deeds,  and they cried unto Us in longing and in fear, and were submissive unto Us. 
21|91|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something) of Our  Spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples. 
21|92|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Lo! this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me. 
21|93|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And they have broken their religion (into fragments) among them, (yet) all  are returning unto Us. 
21|94|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Then whoso doeth some good works and is a believer, there will be no  rejection of his effort. Lo! We record (it) for him. 
21|95|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And there is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed: that they  shall not return. 
21|96|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they hasten out of every  mound, 
21|97|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And the True Promise draweth nigh; then behold them, staring wide (in  terror), the eyes of those who disbelieve! (They say): Alas for us! We (lived) in  forgetfulness of this. Ah, but we were wrong-doers! 
21|98|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Lo! ye (idolaters) and that which ye worship beside Allah are fuel of hell.  Thereunto ye will come. 
21|99|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|If these had been gods they would not have come thither, but all will abide  therein. 
21|100|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Therein wailing is their portion, and therein they hear not. 
21|101|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Lo! those unto whom kindness hath gone forth before from Us, they will be  far removed from thence. 
21|102|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|They will not hear the slightest sound thereof, while they abide in that which  their souls desire. 
21|103|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|The Supreme Horror will not grieve them, and the angels will welcome  them, (saying): This is your Day which ye were promised; 
21|104|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|The Day when We shall roll up the heavens as a recorder rolleth up a written  scroll. As We began the first creation, We shall repeat it. (It is) a promise (binding)  upon Us. Lo! We are to perform it. 
21|105|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And verily we have written in the Scripture, after the Reminder: My  righteous slaves will inherit the earth: 
21|106|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Lo! there is a plain statement for folk who are devout. 
21|107|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|We sent thee not save as a mercy for the peoples. 
21|108|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Say: It is only inspired in me that your God is One God. Will ye then  surrender (unto Him) ? 
21|109|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|But if they are averse, then say: I have warned you all alike, although I know  not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised. 
21|110|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|Lo! He knoweth that which is said openly, and that which ye conceal. 
21|111|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|And I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and enjoyment for a  while. 
21|112|al-Anbiya': The Prophets|He saith: My Lord! Judge Thou with truth. Our Lord is the Beneficent,  Whose help is to be implored against that which ye ascribe (unto Him). 
22|1|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|O mankind! Fear your Lord. Lo! the earthquake of the Hour (of Doom) is a  tremendous thing. 
22|2|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|On the day when ye behold it, every nursing mother will forget her nursling  and every pregnant one will be delivered of her burden, and thou (Muhammad) wilt  see mankind as drunken, yet they will not be drunken, but the Doom of Allah will be  strong (upon them). 
22|3|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Among mankind is he who disputeth concerning Allah without knowledge,  and followeth each froward devil; 
22|4|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|For him it is decreed that whoso taketh him for friend, he verily will mislead  him and will guide him to the punishment of the Flame. 
22|5|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|O mankind! if ye are in doubt concerning the Resurrection, then lo! We have  created you from dust, then from a drop of seed, then from a clot, then from a little  lump of flesh shapely and shapeless, that We may make (it) clear for you. And We  cause what We will to remain in the wombs for an appointed time, and afterward We  bring you forth as infants, then (give you growth) that ye attain your full strength.  And among you there is he who dieth (young), and among you there is he who is  brought back to the most abject time of life, so that, after knowledge, he knoweth  naught. And thou (Muhammad) seest the earth barren, but when We send down water  thereon, it doth thrill and swell and put forth every lovely kind (of growth). 
22|6|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That is because Allah, He is the Truth and because He quickeneth the dead,  and because He is Able to do all things; 
22|7|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And because the Hour will come, there is no doubt thereof; and because  Allah will raise those who are in the graves. 
22|8|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And among mankind is he who disputeth concerning Allah without  knowledge or guidance or a scripture giving light, 
22|9|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Turning away in pride to beguile (men) from the way of Allah. For him in  this world is ignominy, and on the Day of Resurrection We make him taste the doom  of burning. 
22|10|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|(And unto him it will be said): This is for that which thy two hands have sent  before, and because Allah is no oppressor of His slaves. 
22|11|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And among mankind is he who worshippeth Allah upon a narrow marge so  that if good befalleth him he is content therewith, but if a trial befalleth him, he falleth  away utterly. He loseth both the world and the Hereafter. That is the sheer loss. 
22|12|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|He calleth, beside Allah, unto that which hurteth him not nor benefiteth him.  That is the far error. 
22|13|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|He calleth unto him whose harm is nearer than his benefit; verily an evil  patron and verily an evil friend! 
22|14|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Lo! Allah causeth those who believe and do good works to enter Gardens  underneath which rivers flow. Lo! Allah doth what He intendeth. 
22|15|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Whoso is wont to think (through envy) that Allah will not give him  (Muhammad) victory in the world and the Hereafter (and is enraged at the thought of  his victory), let him stretch a rope up to the roof (of his dwelling), and let him hang  himself. Then let him see whether his strategy dispelleth that whereat he rageth!. 
22|16|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Thus We reveal it as plain revelations, and verily Allah guideth whom He  will. 
22|17|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Lo! those who believe (this revelation), and those who are Jews, and the  Sabaeans and the Christians and the Magians and the idolaters - Lo! Allah will decide  between them on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! Allah is Witness over all things. 
22|18|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Hast thou not seen that unto Allah payeth adoration whosoever is in the  heavens and whosoever is in the earth, and the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and  the hills, and the trees, and the beasts, and many of mankind, while there are many  unto whom the doom is justly due. He whom Allah scorneth, there is none to give  him honour. Lo! Allah doeth what He will. 
22|19|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|These twain (the believers and the disbelievers) are two opponents who  contend concerning their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, garments of fire will  be cut out for them; boiling fluid will be poured down on their heads, 
22|20|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Whereby that which is in their bellies, and their skins too, will be melted; 
22|21|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And for them are hooked rods of iron. 
22|22|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Whenever, in their anguish, they would go forth from thence they are driven  back therein and (it is said unto them): Taste the doom of burning. 
22|23|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Lo! Allah will cause those who believe and do good works to enter Gardens  underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be allowed armlets of gold, and  pearls, and their raiment therein will be silk. 
22|24|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|They are guided unto gentle speech; they are guided unto the path of the  Glorious One. 
22|25|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Lo! those who disbelieve and bar (men) from the way of Allah and from the  Inviolable Place of Worship, which We have appointed for mankind together, the  dweller therein and the nomad: whosoever seeketh wrongful partiality therein, him  We shall cause to taste a painful doom. 
22|26|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And (remember) when We prepared for Abraham the place of the (holy)  House, saying: Ascribe thou no thing as partner unto Me, and purify My House for  those who make the round (thereof) and those who stand and those who bow and  make prostration. 
22|27|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And proclaim unto mankind the pilgrimage. They will come unto thee on  foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every deep ravine, 
22|28|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That they may witness things that are of benefit to them, and mention the  name of Allah on appointed days over the beast of cattle that He hath bestowed upon  them. Then eat thereof and feed therewith the poor unfortunate. 
22|29|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Then let them make an end of their unkemptness and pay their vows and go  around the ancient House. 
22|30|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That (is the command). And whoso magnifieth the sacred things of Allah, it  will be well for him in the sight of his Lord. The cattle are lawful unto you save that  which hath been told you. So shun the filth of idols, and shun lying speech, 
22|31|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Turning unto Allah (only), not ascribing partners unto Him; for whoso  ascribeth partners unto Allah, it is as if he had fallen from the sky and the birds had  snatched him or the wind had blown him to a far-off place. 
22|32|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That (is the command). And whoso magnifieth the offerings consecrated to  Allah, it surely is from devotion of the hearts, 
22|33|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Therein are benefits for you for an appointed term; and afterward they are  brought for sacrifice unto the ancient House. 
22|34|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And for every nation have We appointed a ritual, that they may mention the  name of Allah over the beast of cattle that He hath given them for food; and your God  is One God, therefor surrender unto Him. And give good tidings (O Muhammad) to  the humble, 
22|35|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Whose hearts fear when Allah is mentioned, and the patient of whatever may  befall them, and those who establish worship and who spend of that We have  bestowed on them. 
22|36|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And the camels! We have appointed them among the ceremonies of Allah.  Therein ye have much good. So mention the name of Allah over them when they are  drawn up in lines. Then when their flanks fall (dead), eat thereof and feed the beggar  and the suppliant. Thus have We made them subject unto you, that haply ye may give  thanks. 
22|37|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Their flesh and their food reach not Allah, but the devotion from you  reacheth Him. Thus have We made them subject unto you that ye may magnify Allah  that He hath guided you. And give good tidings (O Muhammad) to the good. 
22|38|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Lo! Allah defendeth those who are true. Lo! Allah loveth not each  treacherous ingrate. 
22|39|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Sanction is given unto those who fight because they have been wronged; and  Allah is indeed Able to give them victory; 
22|40|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Those who have been driven from their homes unjustly only because they  said: Our Lord is Allah - For had it not been for Allah's repelling some men by means  of others, cloisters and churches and oratories and mosques, wherein the name of  Allah is oft mentioned, would assuredly have been pulled down. Verily Allah helpeth  one who helpeth Him. Lo! Allah is Strong, Almighty - 
22|41|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Those who, if We give them power in the land, establish worship and pay the  poor-due and enjoin kindness and forbid iniquity. And Allah's is the sequel of events. 
22|42|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|If they deny thee (Muhammad), even so the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of)  A'ad and Thamud, before thee, denied (Our messengers); 
22|43|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And the folk of Abraham and the folk of Lot; 
22|44|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|(And) the dwellers in Midian. And Moses was denied; but I indulged the  disbelievers a long while, then I seized them, and how (terrible) was My abhorrence! 
22|45|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|How many a township have We destroyed while it was sinful, so that it lieth  (to this day) in ruins, and (how many) a deserted well and lofty tower! 
22|46|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Have they not travelled in the land, and have they hearts wherewith to feel  and ears wherewith to hear ? For indeed it is not the eyes that grow blind, but it is the  hearts, which are within the bosoms, that grow blind. 
22|47|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And they will bid thee hasten on the Doom, and Allah faileth not His  promise, but lo! a Day with Allah is as a thousand years of what ye reckon. 
22|48|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And how many a township did I suffer long though it was sinful! Then I  grasped it. Unto Me is the return. 
22|49|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Say: O mankind! I am only a plain warner unto you. 
22|50|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Those who believe and do good works, for them is pardon and a rich  provision; 
22|51|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|While those who strive to thwart Our revelations, such are rightful owners of  the Fire. 
22|52|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Never sent We a messenger or a prophet before thee but when He recited (the  message) Satan proposed (opposition) in respect of that which he recited thereof. But  Allah abolisheth that which Satan proposeth. Then Allah establisheth His revelations.  Allah is Knower, Wise; 
22|53|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That He may make that which the devil proposeth a temptation for those in  whose hearts is a disease, and those whose hearts are hardened - Lo! the evil-doers are  in open schism - 
22|54|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And that those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth  from thy Lord, so that they may believe therein and their hearts may submit humbly  unto Him. Lo! Allah verily is guiding those who believe unto a right path. 
22|55|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt thereof until the Hour  come upon them unawares, or there come unto them the doom of a disastrous day. 
22|56|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|The Sovereignty on that day will be Allah's, He will judge between them.  Then those who believed and did good works will be in Gardens of Delight, 
22|57|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|While those who disbelieved and denied Our revelations, for them will be a  shameful doom. 
22|58|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Those who fled their homes for the cause of Allah and then were slain or  died, Allah verily will provide for them a good provision. Lo! Allah, He verily is Best  of all who make provision. 
22|59|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Assuredly He will cause them to enter by an entry that they will love. Lo!  Allah verily is Knower, Indulgent. 
22|60|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That (is so). And whoso hath retaliated with the like of that which he was  made to suffer and then hath (again) been wronged, Allah will succour him. Lo! Allah  verily is Mild, Forgiving. 
22|61|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That is because Allah maketh the night to pass into the day and maketh the  day to pass into the night, and because Allah is Hearer, Seer. 
22|62|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|That is because Allah, He is the True, and that whereon they call instead of  Him, it is the false, and because Allah, He is the High, the Great. 
22|63|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Seest thou not how Allah sendeth down water from the sky and then the  earth becometh green upon the morrow ? Lo! Allah is Subtile, Aware. 
22|64|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Unto Him belongeth all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Lo!  Allah, He verily is the Absolute, the Owner of Praise. 
22|65|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Hast thou not seen how Allah hath made all that is in the earth subservient  unto you ? And the ship runneth upon the sea by His command, and He holdeth back  the heaven from falling on the earth unless by His leave. Lo! Allah is, for mankind,  Full of Pity, Merciful. 
22|66|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And He it is Who gave you life, then He will cause you to die, and then will  give you life (again). Lo! man is verily an ingrate. 
22|67|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Unto each nation have We given sacred rites which they are to perform; so  let them not dispute with thee of the matter, but summon thou unto thy Lord. Lo! thou  indeed followest right guidance. 
22|68|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And if they wrangle with thee, say: Allah is Best Aware of what ye do. 
22|69|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that  wherein ye used to differ. 
22|70|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Hast thou not known that Allah knoweth all that is in the heaven and the  earth ? Lo! it is in a record. Lo! that is easy for Allah. 
22|71|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And they worship instead of Allah that for which He hath sent down no  warrant, and that whereof they have no knowledge. For evil-doers there is no helper. 
22|72|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And when Our revelations are recited unto them, thou knowest the denial in  the faces of those who disbelieve; they all but attack those who recite Our revelations  unto them. Say: Shall I proclaim unto you worse than that ? The Fire! Allah hath  promised it for those who disbelieve. A hapless journey's end! 
22|73|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|O mankind! A similitude is coined, so pay ye heed to it: Lo! those on whom  ye call beside Allah will never create a fly though they combine together for the  purpose. And if the fly took something from them, they could not rescue it from it. So  weak are (both) the seeker and the sought! 
22|74|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|They measure not Allah His rightful measure. Lo! Allah is Strong, Almighty. 
22|75|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|Allah chooseth from the angels messengers, and (also) from mankind. Lo!  Allah is Hearer, Seer. 
22|76|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|He knoweth all that is before them and all that is behind them, and unto  Allah all things are returned. 
22|77|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|O ye who believe! Bow down and prostrate yourselves, and worship your  Lord, and do good, that haply ye may prosper. 
22|78|al-Hajj: The Pilgrimage|And strive for Allah with the endeavour which is His right. He hath chosen  you and hath not laid upon you in religion any hardship; the faith of your father  Abraham (is yours). He hath named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture),  that the messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses  against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor-due, and hold fast to Allah. He is  your Protecting friend. A blessed Patron and a blessed Helper! 
23|1|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Successful indeed are the believers 
23|2|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Who are humble in their prayers, 
23|3|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And who shun vain conversation, 
23|4|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And who are payers of the poor-due; 
23|5|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And who guard their modesty - 
23|6|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Save from their wives or the (slaves) that their right hands possess, for then  they are not blameworthy, 
23|7|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|But whoso craveth beyond that, such are transgressors - 
23|8|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And who are shepherds of their pledge and their covenant, 
23|9|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And who pay heed to their prayers. 
23|10|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|These are the heirs 
23|11|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Who will inherit paradise. There they will abide. 
23|12|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Verily We created man from a product of wet earth; 
23|13|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then placed him as a drop (of seed) in a safe lodging; 
23|14|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then fashioned We the drop a clot, then fashioned We the clot a little lump,  then fashioned We the little lump bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, and then  produced it as another creation. So blessed be Allah, the Best of creators! 
23|15|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then lo! after that ye surely die. 
23|16|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection ye are raised (again). 
23|17|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And We have created above you seven paths, and We are never unmindful of  creation. 
23|18|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And we send down from the sky water in measure, and We give it lodging in  the earth, and lo! We are Able to withdraw it. 
23|19|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then We produce for you therewith gardens of date-palms and grapes,  wherein is much fruit for you and whereof ye eat; 
23|20|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And a tree that springeth forth from Mount Sinai that groweth oil and relish  for the eaters. 
23|21|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And lo! in the cattle there is verily a lesson for you. We give you to drink of  that which is in their bellies, and many uses have ye in them, and of them do ye eat; 
23|22|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And on them and on the ship ye are carried. 
23|23|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people! Serve  Allah. Ye have no other God save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil) ? 
23|24|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|But the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: This is only a mortal  like you who would make himself superior to you. Had Allah willed, He surely could  have sent down angels. We heard not of this in the case of our fathers of old. 
23|25|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He is only a man in whom is a madness, so watch him for a while. 
23|26|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me. 
23|27|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and Our  inspiration. Then, when Our command cometh and the oven gusheth water, introduce  therein of every (kind) two spouses, and thy household save him thereof against  whom the Word hath already gone forth. And plead not with Me on behalf of those  who have done wrong. Lo! they will be drowned. 
23|28|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And when thou art on board the ship, thou and whoso is with thee, then say:  Praise be to Allah Who hath saved us from the wrongdoing folk! 
23|29|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And say: My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for Thou art  Best of all who bring to land. 
23|30|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Lo! herein verily are portents, for lo! We are ever putting (mankind) to the  test. 
23|31|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then, after them, We brought forth another generation; 
23|32|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And we sent among them a messenger of their own, saying: Serve Allah, Ye  have no other God save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil) ? 
23|33|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the  Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life of the world, said: This is only a  mortal like you, who eateth of that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink. 
23|34|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|If ye were to obey a mortal like yourselves, then, lo! ye surely would be  losers. 
23|35|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Doth he promise you that you, when ye are dead and have become dust and  bones, will (again) be brought forth ? 
23|36|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised! 
23|37|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live, and we shall  not be raised (again). 
23|38|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He is only a man who hath invented a lie about Allah. We are not going to  put faith in him. 
23|39|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me. 
23|40|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He said: In a little while they surely will become repentant. 
23|41|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully, and We made them like as  wreckage (that a torrent hurleth). A far removal for wrongdoing folk! 
23|42|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then after them We brought forth other generations. 
23|43|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|No nation can outstrip its term, nor yet postpone it. 
23|44|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then We sent our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger  came unto a nation they denied him; so We caused them to follow one another (to  disaster) and We made them bywords. A far removal for folk who believe not! 
23|45|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a clear  warrant 
23|46|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they scorned (them) and they were despotic  folk. 
23|47|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves, and whose  folk are servile unto us ? 
23|48|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|So they denied them, and became of those who were destroyed. 
23|49|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go aright. 
23|50|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And We made the son of Mary and his mother a portent, and We gave them  refuge on a height, a place of flocks and watersprings. 
23|51|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|O ye messengers! Eat of the good things, and do right. Lo! I am Aware of  what ye do. 
23|52|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And lo! this your religion is one religion and I am your Lord, so keep your  duty unto Me. 
23|53|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects, each  group rejoicing in its tenets. 
23|54|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|So leave them in their error till a time. 
23|55|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Think they that in the wealth and sons wherewith We provide them 
23|56|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|We hasten unto them with good things ? Nay, but they perceive not. 
23|57|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Lo! those who go in awe for fear of their Lord. 
23|58|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord, 
23|59|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord, 
23|60|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And those who give that which they give with hearts afraid because they are  about to return unto their Lord, 
23|61|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|These race for the good things, and they shall win them in the race. 
23|62|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And we task not any soul beyond its scope, and with Us is a Record which  speaketh the truth, and they will not be wronged. 
23|63|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Nay, but their hearts are in ignorance of this (Qur'an), and they have other  works, besides, which they are doing; 
23|64|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment, behold! they  supplicate. 
23|65|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Supplicate not this day! Assuredly ye will not be helped by Us. 
23|66|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|My revelations were recited unto you, but ye used to turn back on your heels, 
23|67|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|In scorn thereof. Nightly did ye rave together. 
23|68|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Have they not pondered the Word, or hath that come unto them which came  not unto their fathers of old ? 
23|69|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Or know they not their messenger, and so reject him ? 
23|70|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Or say they: There is a madness in him ? Nay, but he bringeth them the  Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth. 
23|71|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And if the Truth had followed their desires, verily the heavens and the earth  and whosoever is therein had been corrupted. Nay, We have brought them their  Reminder, but from their Reminder they now turn away. 
23|72|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Or dost thou ask of them (O Muhammad) any tribute ? But the bounty of thy  Lord is better, for He is Best of all who make provision. 
23|73|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a straight path. 
23|74|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And lo! those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed astray from the  path. 
23|75|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Though We had mercy on them and relieved them of the harm afflicting  them, they still would wander blindly on in their contumacy. 
23|76|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Already have We grasped them with punishment, but they humble not  themselves unto their Lord, nor do they pray, 
23|77|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment, behold! they  are aghast thereat. 
23|78|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He it is Who hath created for you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give  ye! 
23|79|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And He it is Who hath sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him ye will  be gathered. 
23|80|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And He it is Who giveth life and causeth death, and His is the difference of  night and day. Have ye then no sense ? 
23|81|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old; 
23|82|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|They say: When we are dead and have become (mere) dust and bones, shall  we then, forsooth, be raised again ? 
23|83|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this is naught but  fables of the men of old. 
23|84|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Say: Unto Whom (belongeth) the earth and whosoever is therein, if ye have  knowledge ? 
23|85|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|They will say: Unto Allah. Say: Will ye not then remember ? 
23|86|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Say: Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Tremendous Throne  ? 
23|87|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: Will ye not then keep  duty (unto Him) ? 
23|88|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Say: In Whose hand is the dominion over all things and He protecteth, while  against Him there is no protection, if ye have knowledge ? 
23|89|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: How then are ye  bewitched ? 
23|90|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Nay, but We have brought them the Truth, and lo! they are liars. 
23|91|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Allah hath not chosen any son, nor is there any god along with Him; else  would each god have assuredly championed that which he created, and some of them  would assuredly have overcome others. Glorified be Allah above all that they allege. 
23|92|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! and Exalted be He over all that they  ascribe as partners (unto Him)! 
23|93|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Say: My Lord! If Thou shouldst show me that which they are promised. 
23|94|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|My Lord! then set me not among the wrongdoing folk. 
23|95|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And verily We are Able to show thee that which We have promised them. 
23|96|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Repel evil with that which is better. We are Best Aware of that which they  allege. 
23|97|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And say: My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from suggestions of the evil ones, 
23|98|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And I seek refuge in Thee, my Lord, lest they be present with me, 
23|99|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord! Send me  back, 
23|100|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|That I may do right in that which I have left behind! But nay! It is but a word  that he speaketh; and behind them is a barrier until the day when they are raised. 
23|101|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And when the trumpet is blown there will be no kinship among them that  day, nor will they ask of one another. 
23|102|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Then those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful. 
23|103|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And those whose scales are light are those who lose their souls, in hell  abiding. 
23|104|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|The fire burneth their faces, and they are glum therein. 
23|105|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|(It will be said): Were not My revelations recited unto you, and then ye used  to deny them ? 
23|106|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|They will say: Our Lord! Our evil fortune conquered us, and we were erring  folk. 
23|107|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Our Lord! Oh, bring us forth from hence! If we return (to evil) then indeed  we shall be wrong-doers. 
23|108|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He saith: Begone therein, and speak not unto Me. 
23|109|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Lo! there was a party of My slaves who said: Our Lord! We believe, therefor  forgive us and have mercy on us for Thou art Best of all who show mercy; 
23|110|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|But ye chose them for a laughing-stock until they caused you to forget  remembrance of Me, while ye laughed at them. 
23|111|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Lo! I have rewarded them this day forasmuch as they were steadfast in that  they, even they, are the triumphant. 
23|112|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He will say: How long tarried ye in the earth, counting by years ? 
23|113|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|They will say: We tarried by a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep  count! 
23|114|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He will say: Ye tarried but a little if ye only knew. 
23|115|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Deemed ye then that We had created you for naught, and that ye would not  be returned unto Us ? 
23|116|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|Now Allah be Exalted, the True King! There is no God save Him, the Lord  of the Throne of Grace. 
23|117|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|He who crieth unto any other god along with Allah hath no proof thereof. His  reckoning is only with his Lord. Lo! disbelievers will not be successful. 
23|118|al-Mu'minun: The Believers|And (O Muhammad) say: My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for Thou art  Best of all who show mercy. 
24|1|an-Nur: The Light|(Here is) a surah which We have revealed and enjoined, and wherein We  have revealed plain tokens, that haply ye may take heed. 
24|2|an-Nur: The Light|The adulterer and the adulteress, scourge ye each one of them (with) a  hundred stripes. And let not pity for the twain withhold you from obedience to Allah,  if ye believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a party of believers witness their  punishment. 
24|3|an-Nur: The Light|The adulterer shall not marry save an adulteress or an idolatress, and the  adulteress none shall marry save an adulterer or an idolater. All that is forbidden unto  believers. 
24|4|an-Nur: The Light|And those who accuse honourable women but bring not four witnesses,  scourge them (with) eighty stripes and never (afterward) accept their testimony - They  indeed are evil-doers - 
24|5|an-Nur: The Light|Save those who afterward repent and make amends. (For such) lo! Allah is  Forgiving, Merciful. 
24|6|an-Nur: The Light|As for those who accuse their wives but have no witnesses except  themselves; let the testimony of one of them be four testimonies, (swearing) by Allah  that he is of those who speak the truth; 
24|7|an-Nur: The Light|And yet a fifth, invoking the curse of Allah on him if he is of those who lie. 
24|8|an-Nur: The Light|And it shall avert the punishment from her if she bear witness before Allah  four times that the thing he saith is indeed false, 
24|9|an-Nur: The Light|And a fifth (time) that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he speaketh truth. 
24|10|an-Nur: The Light|And had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, and that  Allah is Clement, Wise, (ye had been undone). 
24|11|an-Nur: The Light|Lo! they who spread the slander are a gang among you. Deem it not a bad  thing for you; nay, it is good for you. Unto every man of them (will be paid) that  which he hath earned of the sin; and as for him among them who had the greater share  therein, his will be an awful doom. 
24|12|an-Nur: The Light|Why did not the believers, men and women, when ye heard it, think good of  their own own folk, and say: It is a manifest untruth ? 
24|13|an-Nur: The Light|Why did they not produce four witnesses ? Since they produce not witnesses,  they verily are liars in the sight of Allah. 
24|14|an-Nur: The Light|Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you in the world  and the Hereafter an awful doom had overtaken you for that whereof ye murmured. 
24|15|an-Nur: The Light|When ye welcomed it with your tongues, and uttered with your mouths that  whereof ye had no knowledge, ye counted it a trifle. In the sight of Allah it is very  great. 
24|16|an-Nur: The Light|Wherefor, when ye heard it, said ye not: It is not for us to speak of this.  Glory be to Thee (O Allah)! This is awful calumny.
