24|17|an-Nur: The Light|Allah admonisheth you that ye repeat not the like thereof ever, if ye are (in  truth) believers. 
24|18|an-Nur: The Light|And He expoundeth unto you the revelations. Allah is Knower, Wise. 
24|19|an-Nur: The Light|Lo! those who love that slander should be spread concerning those who  believe, theirs will be a painful punishment in the world and the Hereafter. Allah  knoweth. Ye know not. 
24|20|an-Nur: The Light|Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, and that Allah  is Clement, Merciful, (ye had been undone). 
24|21|an-Nur: The Light|O ye who believe! Follow not the footsteps of the devil. Unto whomsoever  followeth the footsteps of the devil, lo! he commandeth filthiness and wrong. Had it  not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you, not one of you would ever  have grown pure. But Allah causeth whom He will to grow. And Allah is Hearer,  Knower. 
24|22|an-Nur: The Light|And let not those who possess dignity and ease among you swear not to give  to the near of kin and to the needy, and to fugitives for the cause of Allah. Let them  forgive and show indulgence. Yearn ye not that Allah may forgive you ? Allah is  Forgiving, Merciful. 
24|23|an-Nur: The Light|Lo! as for those who traduce virtuous, believing women (who are) careless,  cursed are they in the world and the Hereafter. Theirs will be an awful doom 
24|24|an-Nur: The Light|On the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet testify against  them as to what they used to do, 
24|25|an-Nur: The Light|On that day Allah will pay them their just due, and they will know that Allah,  He is the Manifest Truth. 
24|26|an-Nur: The Light|Vile women are for vile men, and vile men for vile women. Good women are  for good men, and good men for good women; such are innocent of that which people  say: For them is pardon and a bountiful provision. 
24|27|an-Nur: The Light|O ye who believe! Enter not houses other than your own without first  announcing your presence and invoking peace upon the folk thereof. That is better for  you, that ye may be heedful. 
24|28|an-Nur: The Light|And if ye find no-one therein, still enter not until permission hath been given.  And if it be said unto you: Go away again, then go away, for it is purer for you. Allah  knoweth what ye do. 
24|29|an-Nur: The Light|(It is) no sin for you to enter uninhabited houses wherein is comfort for you.  Allah knoweth what ye proclaim and what ye hide. 
24|30|an-Nur: The Light|Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and be modest. That is purer for  them. Lo! Allah is aware of what they do. 
24|31|an-Nur: The Light|And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and be modest, and to  display of their adornment only that which is apparent, and to draw their veils over  their bosoms, and not to reveal their adornment save to their own husbands or fathers  or husbands' fathers, or their sons or their husbands' sons, or their brothers or their  brothers' sons or sisters' sons, or their women, or their slaves, or male attendants who  lack vigour, or children who know naught of women's nakedness. And let them not  stamp their feet so as to reveal what they hide of their adornment. And turn unto  Allah together, O believers, in order that ye may succeed. 
24|32|an-Nur: The Light|And marry such of you as are solitary and the pious of your slaves and maid- servants. If they be poor, Allah will enrich them of His bounty. Allah is of ample  means, Aware. 
24|33|an-Nur: The Light|And let those who cannot find a match keep chaste till Allah give them  independence by His grace. And such of your slaves as seek a writing (of  emancipation), write it for them if ye are aware of aught of good in them, and bestow  upon them of the wealth of Allah which He hath bestowed upon you. Force not your  slave-girls to whoredom that ye may seek enjoyment of the life of the world, if they  would preserve their chastity. And if one force them, then (unto them), after their  compulsion, lo! Allah will be Forgiving, Merciful. 
24|34|an-Nur: The Light|And verily We have sent down for you revelations that make plain, and the  example of those who passed away before you. An admonition unto those who ward  off (evil). 
24|35|an-Nur: The Light|Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The similitude of His light is  as a niche wherein is a lamp. The lamp is in a glass. The glass is as it were a shining  star. (This lamp is) kindled from a blessed tree, an olive neither of the East nor of the  West, whose oil would almost glow forth (of itself) though no fire touched it. Light  upon light. Allah guideth unto His light whom He will. And Allah speaketh to  mankind in allegories, for Allah is Knower of all things. 
24|36|an-Nur: The Light|(This lamp is found) in houses which Allah hath allowed to be exalted and  that His name shall be remembered therein. Therein do offer praise to Him at morn  and evening. 
24|37|an-Nur: The Light|Men whom neither merchandise nor sale beguileth from remembrance of  Allah and constancy in prayer and paying to the poor their due; who fear a day when  hearts and eyeballs will be overturned; 
24|38|an-Nur: The Light|That Allah may reward them with the best of what they did, and increase  reward for them of His bounty. Allah giveth blessings without stint to whom He will. 
24|39|an-Nur: The Light|As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are as a mirage in a desert. The  thirsty one supposeth it to be water till he cometh unto it and findeth it naught, and  findeth, in the place thereof, Allah Who payeth him his due; and Allah is swift at  reckoning. 
24|40|an-Nur: The Light|Or as darkness on a vast, abysmal sea. There covereth him a wave, above  which is a wave, above which is a cloud. Layer upon layer of darkness. When he  holdeth out his hand he scarce can see it. And he for whom Allah hath not appointed  light, for him there is no light. 
24|41|an-Nur: The Light|Hast thou not seen that Allah, He it is Whom all who are in the heavens and  the earth praise, and the birds in their flight ? Of each He knoweth verily the worship  and the praise; and Allah is Aware of what they do. 
24|42|an-Nur: The Light|And unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and  unto Allah is the journeying. 
24|43|an-Nur: The Light|Hast thou not seen how Allah wafteth the clouds, then gathereth them, then  maketh them layers, and thou seest the rain come forth from between them; He  sendeth down from the heaven mountains wherein is hail, and smiteth therewith  whom He will, and averteth it from whom He will. The flashing of His lightning all  but snatcheth away the sight. 
24|44|an-Nur: The Light|Allah causeth the revolution of the day and the night. Lo! herein is indeed a  lesson for those who see. 
24|45|an-Nur: The Light|Allah hath created every animal of water. Of them is (a kind) that goeth upon  its belly and (a kind) that goeth upon two legs and (a kind) that goeth upon four.  Allah createth what He will. Lo! Allah is Able to do all things. 
24|46|an-Nur: The Light|Verily We have sent down revelations and explained them. Allah guideth  whom He will unto a straight path. 
24|47|an-Nur: The Light|And they say: We believe in Allah and the messenger, and we obey; then  after that a faction of them turn away. Such are not believers. 
24|48|an-Nur: The Light|And when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them,  lo! a faction of them are averse; 
24|49|an-Nur: The Light|But if right had been with them they would have come unto him willingly. 
24|50|an-Nur: The Light|Is there in their hearts a disease, or have they doubts, or fear they lest Allah  and His messenger should wrong them in judgment ? Nay, but such are evil-doers. 
24|51|an-Nur: The Light|The saying of (all true) believers when they appeal unto Allah and His  messenger to judge between them is only that they say: We hear and we obey. And  such are the successful. 
24|52|an-Nur: The Light|He who obeyeth Allah and His messenger, and feareth Allah, and keepeth  duty (unto Him): such indeed are the victorious. 
24|53|an-Nur: The Light|They swear by Allah solemnly that, if thou order them, they will go forth.  Say: Swear not; known obedience (is better). Lo! Allah is Informed of what ye do. 
24|54|an-Nur: The Light|Say: Obey Allah and obey the messenger. But if ye turn away, then (it is) for  him (to do) only that wherewith he hath been charged, and for you (to do) only that  wherewith ye have been charged. If ye obey him, ye will go aright. But the messenger  hath no other charge than to convey (the message) plainly. 
24|55|an-Nur: The Light|Allah hath promised such of you as believe and do good work that He will  surely make them to succeed (the present rulers) in the earth even as He caused those  who were before them to succeed (others); and that He will surely establish for them  their religion which He hath approved for them, and will give them in exchange  safety after their fear. They serve Me. They ascribe no thing as partner unto Me.  Those who disbelieve henceforth, they are the miscreants. 
24|56|an-Nur: The Light|Establish worship and pay the poor-due and obey the messenger, that haply  ye may find mercy. 
24|57|an-Nur: The Light|Think not that the disbelievers can escape in the land. Fire will be their home  - a hapless journey's end! 
24|58|an-Nur: The Light|O ye who believe! Let your slaves, and those of you who have not come to  puberty, ask leave of you at three times (before they come into your presence): Before  the prayer of dawn, and when ye lay aside your raiment for the heat of noon, and after  the prayer of night. Three times of privacy for you. It is no sin for them or for you at  other times, when some of you go round attendant upon others (if they come into your  presence without leave). Thus Allah maketh clear the revelations for you. Allah is  Knower, Wise. 
24|59|an-Nur: The Light|And when the children among you come to puberty then let them ask leave  even as those before them used to ask it. Thus Allah maketh clear His revelations for  you. Allah is Knower, Wise. 
24|60|an-Nur: The Light|As for women past child-bearing, who have no hope of marriage, it is no sin  for them if they discard their (outer) clothing in such a way as not to show adornment.  But to refrain is better for them. Allah is Hearer, Knower. 
24|61|an-Nur: The Light|No blame is there upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor any blame  upon the sick nor on yourselves if ye eat from your houses, or the houses of your  fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of  your sisters, or the houses of your fathers' brothers, or the houses of your fathers'  sisters, or the houses of your mothers' brothers, or the houses of your mothers' sisters,  or (from that) whereof ye hold the keys, or (from the house) of a friend. No sin shall it  be for you whether ye eat together or apart. But when ye enter houses, salute one  another with a greeting from Allah, blessed and sweet. Thus Allah maketh clear His  revelations for you, that haply ye may understand. 
24|62|an-Nur: The Light|They only are the true believers who believe in Allah and His messenger  and, when they are with him on some common errand, go not away until they have  asked leave of him. Lo! those who ask leave of thee, those are they who believe in  Allah and His messenger. So, if they ask thy leave for some affair of theirs, give leave  to whom thou wilt of them, and ask for them forgiveness of Allah. Lo! Allah is  Forgiving, Merciful. 
24|63|an-Nur: The Light|Make not the calling of the messenger among you as your calling one of  another. Allah knoweth those of you who steal away, hiding themselves. And let  those who conspire to evade orders beware lest grief or painful punishment befall  them. 
24|64|an-Nur: The Light|Lo! verily unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth.  He knoweth your condition. And (He knoweth) the Day when they are returned unto  Him so that He may inform them of what they did. Allah is Knower of all things. 
25|1|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Blessed is He Who hath revealed unto His slave the Criterion (of right and  wrong), that he may be a warner to the peoples. 
25|2|al-Furqan: The Criterion|He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, He  hath chosen no son nor hath He any partner in the Sovereignty. He hath created  everything and hath meted out for it a measure. 
25|3|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Yet they choose beside Him other gods who create naught but are themselves  created, and possess not hurt nor profit for themselves, and possess not death nor life,  nor power to raise the dead. 
25|4|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Those who disbelieve say: This is naught but a lie that he hath invented, and  other folk have helped him with it, so that they have produced a slander and a lie. 
25|5|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And they say: Fables of the men of old which he hath had written down so  that they are dictated to him morn and evening. 
25|6|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He who knoweth the secret of the heavens  and the earth hath revealed it. Lo! He ever is Forgiving, Merciful. 
25|7|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And they say: What aileth this messenger (of Allah) that he eateth food and  walketh in the markets ? Why is not an angel sent down unto him, to be a warner with  him. 
25|8|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Or (why is not) treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he not a  paradise from whence to eat ? And the evil-doers say: Ye are but following a man  bewitched. 
25|9|al-Furqan: The Criterion|See how they coin similitudes for thee, so that they are all astray and cannot  find a road! 
25|10|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all) that - Gardens  underneath which rivers flow  - and will assign thee mansions. 
25|11|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Nay, but they deny (the coming of) the Hour, and for those who deny (the  coming of) the Hour We have prepared a flame. 
25|12|al-Furqan: The Criterion|When it seeth them from afar, they hear the crackling and the roar thereof. 
25|13|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they  pray for destruction there. 
25|14|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many destructions! 
25|15|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Say: Is that (doom) better or the Garden of Immortality which is promised  unto those who ward off (evil) ? It will be their reward and journey's end. 
25|16|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy Lord a promise  that must be fulfilled. 
25|17|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And on the day when He will assemble them and that which they worship  instead of Allah and will say: Was it ye who misled these my slaves or did they  (themselves) wander from the way ? 
25|18|al-Furqan: The Criterion|They will say: Be Thou Glorified! it was not for us to choose any protecting  friends beside thee; but Thou didst give them and their fathers ease till they forgot the  warning and became lost folk. 
25|19|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Thus they will give you the lie regarding what ye say, then ye can neither  avert (the doom) nor obtain help. And whoso among you doeth wrong, We shall make  him taste great torment. 
25|20|al-Furqan: The Criterion|We never sent before thee any messengers but lo! they verily ate food and  walked in the markets. And We have appointed some of you a test for others: Will ye  be steadfast ? And thy Lord is ever Seer. 
25|21|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And those who look not for a meeting with Us say: Why are angels not sent  down unto us and (Why) do we not see our Lord! Assuredly they think too highly of  themselves and are scornful with great pride. 
25|22|al-Furqan: The Criterion|On the day when they behold the angels, on that day there will be no good  tidings for the guilty; and they will cry: A forbidding ban! 
25|23|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And We shall turn unto the work they did and make it scattered motes. 
25|24|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Those who have earned the Garden on that day will be better in their home  and happier in their place of noonday rest; 
25|25|al-Furqan: The Criterion|A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder and the angels  will be sent down, a grand descent. 
25|26|al-Furqan: The Criterion|The Sovereignty on that day will be the True (Sovereignty) belonging to the  Beneficent One, and it will be a hard day for disbelievers. 
25|27|al-Furqan: The Criterion|On the day when the wrong-doer gnaweth his hands, he will say: Ah, would  that I had chosen a way together with the messenger (of Allah)! 
25|28|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one for friend! 
25|29|al-Furqan: The Criterion|He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached me. Satan  was ever man's deserter in the hour of need. 
25|30|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And the messenger saith: O my Lord! Lo! mine own folk make this Qur'an of  no account. 
25|31|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Even so have We appointed unto every prophet an opponent from among the  guilty; but Allah sufficeth for a Guide and Helper. 
25|32|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And those who disbelieve say: Why is the Qur'an not revealed unto him all at  once ? (It is revealed) thus that We may strengthen thy heart therewith; and We have  arranged it in right order. 
25|33|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And they bring thee no similitude but We bring thee the Truth (as against it),  and better (than their similitude) as argument. 
25|34|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Those who will be gathered on their faces unto hell: such are worse in plight  and further from the right road. 
25|35|al-Furqan: The Criterion|We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his brother Aaron  as henchman. 
25|36|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Then We said: Go together unto the folk who have denied Our revelations.  Then We destroyed them, a complete destruction. 
25|37|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And Noah's folk, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and  made of them a portent for mankind. We have prepared a painful doom for evil-doers. 
25|38|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass, and many  generations in between. 
25|39|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Each (of them) We warned by examples, and each (of them) We brought to  utter ruin. 
25|40|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And indeed they have passed by the township whereon was rained the fatal  rain. Can it be that they have not seen it ? Nay, but they hope for no resurrection. 
25|41|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a jest  (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger ? 
25|42|al-Furqan: The Criterion|He would have led us far away from our gods if we had not been staunch to  them. They will know, when they behold the doom, who is more astray as to the road. 
25|43|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust ? Wouldst thou  then be guardian over him ? 
25|44|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand ? They are but as the  cattle - nay, but they are farther astray ? 
25|45|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade - And if He willed He  could have made it still - then We have made the sun its pilot; 
25|46|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Then We withdraw it unto Us, a gradual withdrawal ? 
25|47|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And He it is Who maketh night a covering for you, and sleep repose, and  maketh day a resurrection. 
25|48|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And He it is Who sendeth the winds, glad tidings heralding His mercy, and  We send down purifying water from the sky, 
25|49|al-Furqan: The Criterion|That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many beasts and  men that We have created to drink thereof. 
25|50|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And verily We have repeated it among them that they may remember, but  most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude. 
25|51|al-Furqan: The Criterion|If We willed, We could raise up a warner in every village. 
25|52|al-Furqan: The Criterion|So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith with a great  endeavour. 
25|53|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though they  meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and hath set a bar and a  forbidding ban between them. 
25|54|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And He it is Who hath created man from water, and hath appointed for him  kindred by blood and kindred by marriage; for thy Lord is ever Powerful. 
25|55|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Yet they worship instead of Allah that which can neither benefit them nor  hurt them. The disbeliever was ever a partisan against his Lord. 
25|56|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good tidings and  a warner. 
25|57|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may choose a way  unto his Lord. 
25|58|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And trust thou in the Living One Who dieth not, and hymn His praise. He  sufficeth as the Knower of His bondmen's sins, 
25|59|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six  Days, then He mounted the Throne. The Beneficent! Ask anyone informed  concerning Him! 
25|60|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And when it is said unto them: Adore the Beneficent! they say: And what is  the Beneficent ? Are we to adore whatever thou (Muhammad) biddest us ? And it  increaseth aversion in them. 
25|61|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Blessed be He Who hath placed in the heaven mansions of the stars, and hath  placed therein a great lamp and a moon giving light! 
25|62|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And He it is Who hath appointed night and day in succession, for him who  desireth to remember, or desireth thankfulness. 
25|63|al-Furqan: The Criterion|The (faithful) slaves of the Beneficent are they who walk upon the earth  modestly, and when the foolish ones address them answer: Peace; 
25|64|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing, 
25|65|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And who say: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the doom  thereof is anguish; 
25|66|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Lo! it is wretched as abode and station; 
25|67|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor grudging; and  there is ever a firm station between the two; 
25|68|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And those who cry not unto any other god along with Allah, nor take the life  which Allah hath forbidden save in (course of) justice, nor commit adultery - and  whoso doeth this shall pay the penalty; 
25|69|al-Furqan: The Criterion|The doom will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will  abide therein disdained for ever; 
25|70|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Save him who repenteth and believeth and doth righteous work; as for such,  Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds. Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful. 
25|71|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And whosoever repenteth and doeth good, he verily repenteth toward Allah  with true repentance - 
25|72|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near senseless  play, pass by with dignity. 
25|73|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall  not deaf and blind thereat. 
25|74|al-Furqan: The Criterion|And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our  offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil). 
25|75|al-Furqan: The Criterion|They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were steadfast, and  they will meet therein with welcome and the ward of peace, 
25|76|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Abiding there for ever. Happy is it as abode and station! 
25|77|al-Furqan: The Criterion|Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): My Lord would not concern  Himself with you but for your prayer. But now ye have denied (the Truth), therefor  there will be judgment. 
26|1|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Ta. Sin. Mim. 
26|2|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain. 
26|3|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|It may be that thou tormentest thyself (O Muhammad) because they believe  not. 
26|4|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|If We will, We can send down on them from the sky a portent so that their  necks would remain bowed before it. 
26|5|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Never cometh there unto them a fresh reminder from the Beneficent One, but  they turn away from it. 
26|6|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Now they have denied (the Truth); but there will come unto them tidings of  that whereat they used to scoff. 
26|7|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Have they not seen the earth, how much of every fruitful kind We make to  grow therein ? 
26|8|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers. 
26|9|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|10|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And when thy Lord called Moses, saying: Go unto the wrongdoing folk, 
26|11|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil) ? 
26|12|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: My Lord! Lo! I fear that they will deny me, 
26|13|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I shall be embarrassed, and my tongue will not speak plainly, therefor  send for Aaron (to help me). 
26|14|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill me. 
26|15|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Nay, verily. So go ye twain with Our tokens. Lo! We shall be with  you, Hearing. 
26|16|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And come together unto Pharaoh and say: Lo! we bear a message of the Lord  of the Worlds, 
26|17|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Saying): Let the Children of Israel go with us. 
26|18|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said (unto Moses): Did we not rear thee among us as a child ? And  thou didst dwell many years of thy life among us, 
26|19|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And thou didst that thy deed which thou didst, and thou wast one of the  ingrates. 
26|20|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: I did it then, when I was of those who are astray. 
26|21|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then I fled from you when I feared you, and my Lord vouchsafed me a  command and appointed me (of the number) of those sent (by Him). 
26|22|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And this is the past favour wherewith thou reproachest me: that thou hast  enslaved the Children of Israel. 
26|23|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds ? 
26|24|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them,  if ye had but sure belief. 
26|25|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not ? 
26|26|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers. 
26|27|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a  madman! 
26|28|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Lord of the East and the West and all that is between them, if ye did  but understand. 
26|29|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly shall place  thee among the prisoners. 
26|30|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Even though I show thee something plain ? 
26|31|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful! 
26|32|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest, 
26|33|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white to the beholders. 
26|34|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo! this is verily a knowing  wizard, 
26|35|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Who would drive you out of your land by his magic. Now what counsel ye ? 
26|36|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: Put him off, (him) and his brother, and send into the cities  summoners 
26|37|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Who shall bring unto thee every knowing wizard. 
26|38|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So the wizards were gathered together at a set time on a day appointed. 
26|39|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And it was said unto the people: Are ye (also) gathering ? 
26|40|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards if they are the winners. 
26|41|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And when the wizards came they said unto Pharaoh: Will there surely be a  reward for us if we are the winners ? 
26|42|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Aye, and ye will then surely be of those brought near (to me). 
26|43|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Moses said unto them: Throw what ye are going to throw! 
26|44|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then they threw down their cords and their staves and said: By Pharaoh's  might, lo! we verily are the winners. 
26|45|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely  show. 
26|46|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And the wizards were flung prostrate, 
26|47|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds, 
26|48|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|The Lord of Moses and Aaron. 
26|49|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Pharaoh) said: Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he  doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know.  Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you  every one. 
26|50|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: It is no hurt, for lo! unto our Lord we shall return. 
26|51|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are  the first of the believers. 
26|52|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night, for ye will  be pursued. 
26|53|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners, 
26|54|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(Who said): Lo! these indeed are but a little troop, 
26|55|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! they are offenders against us. 
26|56|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! we are a ready host. 
26|57|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Thus did We take them away from gardens and watersprings, 
26|58|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And treasures and a fair estate. 
26|59|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Thus (were those things taken from them) and We caused the Children of  Israel to inherit them. 
26|60|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And they overtook them at sunrise. 
26|61|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are  indeed caught. 
26|62|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me. 
26|63|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted,  and each part was as a mountain vast. 
26|64|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then brought We near the others to that place. 
26|65|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And We saved Moses and those with him, every one; 
26|66|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And We drowned the others. 
26|67|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers. 
26|68|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|69|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Recite unto them the story of Abraham: 
26|70|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye ? 
26|71|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: We worship idols, and are ever devoted unto them. 
26|72|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: Do they hear you when ye cry ? 
26|73|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Or do they benefit or harm you ? 
26|74|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this wise. 
26|75|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: See now that which ye worship, 
26|76|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Ye and your forefathers! 
26|77|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! they are (all) an enemy unto me, save the Lord of the Worlds, 
26|78|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Who created me, and He doth guide me, 
26|79|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And Who feedeth me and watereth me. 
26|80|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And when I sicken, then He healeth me, 
26|81|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And Who causeth me to die, then giveth me life (again), 
26|82|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And Who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgment. 
26|83|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|My Lord! Vouchsafe me wisdom and unite me to the righteous. 
26|84|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And give unto me a good report in later generations. 
26|85|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight, 
26|86|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err. 
26|87|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And abase me not on the day when they are raised, 
26|88|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man) 
26|89|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart. 
26|90|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil). 
26|91|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And hell will appear plainly to the erring. 
26|92|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And it will be said unto them: Where is (all) that ye used to worship 
26|93|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Instead of Allah ? Can they help you or help themselves ? 
26|94|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then will they be hurled therein, they and the seducers 
26|95|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And the hosts of Iblis, together. 
26|96|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And they will say, when they are quarrelling therein: 
26|97|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest 
26|98|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds. 
26|99|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|It was but the guilty who misled us. 
26|100|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Now we have no intercessors 
26|101|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Nor any loving friend. 
26|102|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the believers! 
26|103|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers! 
26|104|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|105|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah), 
26|106|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil) ? 
26|107|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you, 
26|108|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me. 
26|109|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord  of the Worlds. 
26|110|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me. 
26|111|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: Shall we put faith in thee, when the lowest (of the people) follow  thee ? 
26|112|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in  the past) ? 
26|113|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! their reckoning is my Lord's concern, if ye but knew; 
26|114|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I am not (here) to repulse believers. 
26|115|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|I am only a plain warner. 
26|116|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: If thou cease not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be among those stoned  (to death). 
26|117|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: My Lord! Lo! my own folk deny me. 
26|118|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Therefor judge Thou between us, a (conclusive) judgment, and save me and  those believers who are with me. 
26|119|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship. 
26|120|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then afterward We drowned the others. 
26|121|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers. 
26|122|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo, thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

26|124|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|When their brother Hud said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil) ? 
26|125|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you, 
26|126|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So keep your duty to Allah and obey me. 
26|127|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord  of the Worlds. 
26|128|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Build ye on every high place a monument for vain delight ? 
26|129|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And seek ye out strongholds, that haply ye may last for ever ? 
26|130|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And if ye seize by force, seize ye as tyrants ?

26|132|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Keep your duty toward Him Who hath aided you with (the good things) that  ye know, 
26|133|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Hath aided you with cattle and sons. 
26|134|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And gardens and watersprings.

26|136|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: It is all one to us whether thou preachest or art not of those who  preach; 
26|137|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|This is but a fable of the men of old, 
26|138|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And we shall not be doomed. 
26|139|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And they denied him; therefor We destroyed them. Lo! herein is indeed a  portent, yet most of them are not believers. 
26|140|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|141|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)

26|145|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord  of the Worlds. 
26|146|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Will ye be left secure in that which is here before us, 
26|147|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|In gardens and watersprings. 
26|148|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And tilled fields and heavy-sheathed palm-trees, 
26|149|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful ? 
26|150|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Therefor keep your duty to Allah and obey me, 
26|151|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And obey not the command of the prodigal, 
26|152|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Who spread corruption in the earth, and reform not. 
26|153|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched; 
26|154|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Thou art but a mortal like us. So bring some token if thou art of the truthful. 
26|155|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: (Behold) this she-camel. She hath the right to drink (at the well),  and ye have the right to drink, (each) on an appointed day. 
26|156|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And touch her not with ill lest there come on you the retribution of an awful  day. 
26|157|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|But they hamstrung her, and then were penitent. 
26|158|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So the retribution came on them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of  them are not believers. 
26|159|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|160|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|The folk of Lot denied the messengers (of Allah),

26|164|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord  of the Worlds. 
26|165|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|What! Of all creatures do ye come unto the males, 
26|166|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And leave the wives your Lord created for you ? Nay, but ye are froward  folk. 
26|167|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: If thou cease not, O Lot, thou wilt soon be of the outcast. 
26|168|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: I am in truth of those who hate your conduct. 
26|169|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|My Lord! Save me and my household from what they do. 
26|170|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So We saved him and his household, every one, 
26|171|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Save an old woman among those who stayed behind. 
26|172|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then afterward We destroyed the others. 
26|173|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And We rained on them a rain. And dreadful is the rain of those who have  been warned. 
26|174|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers. 
26|175|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|176|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|The dwellers in the wood (of Midian) denied the messengers (of Allah), 
26|177|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|When Shu'eyb said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil) ? 
26|178|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you, 
26|179|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So keep your duty to Allah and obey me. 
26|180|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And I ask of you no wage for it; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of  the Worlds. 
26|181|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Give full measure, and be not of those who give less (than the due). 
26|182|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And weigh with the true balance. 
26|183|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Wrong not mankind in their goods, and do not evil, making mischief, in the  earth. 
26|184|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And keep your duty unto Him Who created you and the generations of the  men of old. 
26|185|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched; 
26|186|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Thou art but a mortal like us, and lo! we deem thee of the liars. 
26|187|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us, if thou art of the truthful. 
26|188|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|He said: My Lord is Best Aware of what ye do. 
26|189|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|But they denied him, so there came on them the retribution of the day of  gloom. Lo! it was the retribution of an awful day. 
26|190|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers. 
26|191|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|192|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! it is a revelation of the Lord of the Worlds, 
26|193|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Which the True Spirit hath brought down 
26|194|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Upon thy heart, that thou mayst be (one) of the warners, 
26|195|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|In plain Arabic speech. 
26|196|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lo! it is in the Scriptures of the men of old. 
26|197|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Is it not a token for them that the doctors of the Children of Israel know it ? 
26|198|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the Arabs, 
26|199|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it. 
26|200|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty. 
26|201|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They will not believe in it till they behold the painful doom, 
26|202|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|So that it will come upon them suddenly, when they perceive not. 
26|203|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Then they will say: Are we to be reprieved ? 
26|204|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Would they (now) hasten on Our doom ? 
26|205|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Hast thou then seen, if We content them for (long) years, 
26|206|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And then cometh that which they were promised, 
26|207|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|(How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them ? 
26|208|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And We destroyed no township but it had its warners 
26|209|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|For reminder, for We never were oppressors. 
26|210|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|The devils did not bring it down. 
26|211|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|It is not meet for them, nor is it in their power, 
26|212|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! verily they are banished from the hearing. 
26|213|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Therefor invoke not with Allah another god, lest thou be one of the doomed. 
26|214|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And warn thy tribe of near kindred, 
26|215|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And lower thy wing (in kindness) unto those believers who follow thee. 
26|216|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And if they (thy kinsfolk) disobey thee, say: Lo! I am innocent of what they  do. 
26|217|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And put thy trust in the Mighty, the Merciful. 
26|218|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Who seeth thee when thou standest up (to pray) 
26|219|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And (seeth) thine abasement among those who fall prostrate (in worship). 
26|220|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Knower. 
26|221|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend ? 
26|222|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They descend on every sinful, false one. 
26|223|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|They listen eagerly, but most of them are liars. 
26|224|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|As for poets, the erring follow them. 
26|225|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Hast thou not seen how they stray in every valley, 
26|226|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|And how they say that which they do not ? 
26|227|ash-Shu`ara': The Poets|Save those who believe and do good works, and remember Allah much, and  vindicate themselves after they have been wronged. Those who do wrong will come  to know by what a (great) reverse they will be overturned! 
27|1|an-Naml: The Ant|Ta. Sin. These are revelations of the Qur'an and a Scripture that maketh  plain; 
27|2|an-Naml: The Ant|A guidance and good tidings for believers 
27|3|an-Naml: The Ant|Who establish worship and pay the poor-due and are sure of the Hereafter. 
27|4|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their works  fairseeming unto them so that they are all astray. 
27|5|an-Naml: The Ant|Those are they for whom is the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter  they will be the greatest losers. 
27|6|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! as for thee (Muhammad), thou verily receivest the Qur'an from the  presence of One Wise, Aware. 
27|7|an-Naml: The Ant|(Remember) when Moses said unto his household: Lo! I spy afar off a fire; I  will bring you tidings thence, or bring to you a borrowed flame that ye may warm  yourselves. 
27|8|an-Naml: The Ant|But when he reached it, he was called, saying: Blessed is Whosoever is in the  fire and Whosoever is round about it! And Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the  Worlds! 
27|9|an-Naml: The Ant|O Moses! Lo! it is I, Allah, the Mighty, the Wise. 
27|10|an-Naml: The Ant|And throw down thy staff! But when he saw it writhing as it were a demon,  he turned to flee headlong; (but it was said unto him): O Moses! Fear not! the  emissaries fear not in My presence, 
27|11|an-Naml: The Ant|Save him who hath done wrong and afterward hath changed evil for good.  And lo! I am Forgiving, Merciful. 
27|12|an-Naml: The Ant|And put thy hand into the bosom of thy robe, it will come forth white but  unhurt. (This will be one) among nine tokens unto Pharaoh and his people Lo! they  were ever evil-living folk. 
27|13|an-Naml: The Ant|But when Our tokens came unto them, plain to see, they said: This is mere  magic, 
27|14|an-Naml: The Ant|And they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, for spite and  arrogance. Then see the nature of the consequence for the wrong-doers! 
27|15|an-Naml: The Ant|And We verily gave knowledge unto David and Solomon, and they said:  Praise be to Allah, Who hath preferred us above many of His believing slaves! 
27|16|an-Naml: The Ant|And Solomon was David's heir. And he said: O mankind! Lo! we have been  taught the language of birds, and have been given (abundance) of all things. This  surely is evident favour. 
27|17|an-Naml: The Ant|And there were gathered together unto Solomon his armies of the jinn and  humankind, and of the birds, and they were set in battle order; 
27|18|an-Naml: The Ant|Till, when they reached the Valley of the Ants, an ant exclaimed: O ants!  Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his armies crush you, unperceiving. 
27|19|an-Naml: The Ant|And (Solomon) smiled, laughing at her speech, and said: My Lord, arouse  me to be thankful for Thy favour wherewith Thou hast favoured me and my parents,  and to do good that shall be pleasing unto Thee, and include me in (the number of)  Thy righteous slaves. 
27|20|an-Naml: The Ant|And he sought among the birds and said: How is it that I see not the hoopoe,  or is he among the absent ? 
27|21|an-Naml: The Ant|I verily will punish him with hard punishment or I verily will slay him, or he  verily shall bring me a plain excuse. 
27|22|an-Naml: The Ant|But he was not long in coming, and he said: I have found out (a thing) that  thou apprehendest not, and I come unto thee from Sheba with sure tidings. 
27|23|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! I found a woman ruling over them, and she hath been given (abundance)  of all things, and hers is a mighty throne. 
27|24|an-Naml: The Ant|I found her and her people worshipping the sun instead of Allah; and Satan  maketh their works fairseeming unto them, and debarreth them from the way (of  Truth), so that they go not aright; 
27|25|an-Naml: The Ant|So that they worship not Allah, Who bringeth forth the hidden in the heavens  and the earth, and knoweth what ye hide and what ye proclaim, 
27|26|an-Naml: The Ant|Allah; there is no God save Him, the Lord of the Tremendous Throne. 
27|27|an-Naml: The Ant|(Solomon) said: We shall see whether thou speakest truth or whether thou art  of the liars. 
27|28|an-Naml: The Ant|Go with this my letter and throw it down unto them; then turn away and see  what (answer) they return, 
27|29|an-Naml: The Ant|(The Queen of Sheba) said (when she received the letter): O chieftains! Lo!  there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter. 
27|30|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! it is from Solomon, and lo! it is: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent,  the Merciful; 
27|31|an-Naml: The Ant|Exalt not yourselves against me, but come unto me as those who surrender. 
27|32|an-Naml: The Ant|She said: O chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case. I decide no case till ye  are present with me. 
27|33|an-Naml: The Ant|They said: We are lords of might and lords of great prowess, but it is for thee  to command; so consider what thou wilt command. 
27|34|an-Naml: The Ant|She said: Lo! kings, when they enter a township, ruin it and make the honour  of its people shame. Thus will they do. 
27|35|an-Naml: The Ant|But lo! I am going to send a present unto them, and to see with what  (answer) the messengers return. 
27|36|an-Naml: The Ant|So when (the envoy) came unto Solomon, (the King) said: What! Would ye  help me with wealth ? But that which Allah hath given me is better than that which  He hath given you. Nay it is ye (and not I) who exult in your gift. 
27|37|an-Naml: The Ant|Return unto them. We verily shall come unto them with hosts that they  cannot resist, and we shall drive them out from thence with shame, and they will be  abased. 
27|38|an-Naml: The Ant|He said: O chiefs! Which of you will bring me her throne before they come  unto me, surrendering ? 
27|39|an-Naml: The Ant|A stalwart of the jinn said: I will bring it thee before thou canst rise from thy  place. Lo! I verily am strong and trusty for such work. 
27|40|an-Naml: The Ant|One with whom was knowledge of the Scripture said: I will bring it thee  before thy gaze returneth unto thee. And when he saw it set in his presence,  (Solomon) said: This is of the bounty of my Lord, that He may try me whether I give  thanks or am ungrateful. Whosoever giveth thanks he only giveth thanks for (the good  of) his own soul; and whosoever is ungrateful (is ungrateful only to his own soul's  hurt). For lo! my Lord is Absolute in independence, Bountiful. 
27|41|an-Naml: The Ant|He said: Disguise her throne for her that we may see whether she will go  aright or be of those not rightly guided. 
27|42|an-Naml: The Ant|So, when she came, it was said (unto her): Is thy throne like this ? She said:  (It is) as though it were the very one. And (Solomon said): We were given the  knowledge before her and we had surrendered (to Allah). 
27|43|an-Naml: The Ant|And (all) that she was wont to worship instead of Allah hindered her, for she  came of disbelieving folk. 
27|44|an-Naml: The Ant|It was said unto her: Enter the hall. And when she saw it she deemed it a  pool and bared her legs. (Solomon) said: Lo! it is a hall, made smooth, of glass. She  said: My Lord! Lo! I have wronged myself, and I surrender with Solomon unto Allah,  the Lord of the Worlds. 
27|45|an-Naml: The Ant|And We verily sent unto Thamud their brother Salih, saying: Worship Allah.  And lo! they (then  became two parties quarrelling. 
27|46|an-Naml: The Ant|He said: O my people! Why will ye hasten on the evil rather than the good ?  Why will ye not ask pardon of Allah, that ye may receive mercy. 
27|47|an-Naml: The Ant|They said: We augur evil of thee and those with thee. He said: Your evil  augury is with Allah. Nay, but ye are folk that are being tested. 
27|48|an-Naml: The Ant|And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the land and  reformed not. 
27|49|an-Naml: The Ant|They said: Swear one to another by Allah that we verily will attack him and  his household by night, and afterward we will surely say unto his friend: We  witnessed not the destruction of his household. And lo! we are truthtellers. 
27|50|an-Naml: The Ant|So they plotted a plot: and We plotted a plot, while they perceived not. 
27|51|an-Naml: The Ant|Then see the nature of the consequence of their plotting, for lo! We destroyed  them and their people, every one. 
27|52|an-Naml: The Ant|See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they did wrong.  Lo! herein is indeed a portent for a people who have knowledge. 
27|53|an-Naml: The Ant|And we saved those who believed and used to ward off (evil). 
27|54|an-Naml: The Ant|And Lot! when he said unto his folk: Will ye commit abomination  knowingly ? 
27|55|an-Naml: The Ant|Must ye needs lust after men instead of women ? Nay, but ye are folk who  act senselessly. 
27|56|an-Naml: The Ant|But the answer of his folk was naught save that they said: Expel the  household of Lot from your township, for they (forsooth) are folk who would keep  clean! 
27|57|an-Naml: The Ant|Then We saved him and his household save his wife; We destined her to be  of those who stayed behind. 
27|58|an-Naml: The Ant|And We rained a rain upon them. Dreadful is the rain of those who have  been warned. 
27|59|an-Naml: The Ant|Say (O Muhammad): Praise be to Allah, and peace be on His slaves whom  He hath chosen! Is Allah best, or (all) that ye ascribe as partners (unto Him) ? 
27|60|an-Naml: The Ant|Is not He (best) Who created the heavens and the earth, and sendeth down for  you water from the sky wherewith We cause to spring forth joyous orchards, whose  trees it never hath been yours to cause to grow. Is there any God beside Allah ? Nay,  but they are folk who ascribe equals (unto Him)! 
27|61|an-Naml: The Ant|Is not He (best) Who made the earth a fixed abode, and placed rivers in the  folds thereof, and placed firm hills therein, and hath set a barrier between the two seas  ? Is there any God beside Allah ? Nay, but most of them know not! 
27|62|an-Naml: The Ant|Is not He (best) Who answereth the wronged one when he crieth unto Him  and removeth the evil, and hath made you viceroys of the earth ? Is there any God  beside Allah ? Little do they reflect! 
27|63|an-Naml: The Ant|Is not He (best) Who guideth you in the darkness of the land and the sea, He  Who sendeth the winds as heralds of His mercy ? Is there any God beside Allah ?  High Exalted be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)! 
27|64|an-Naml: The Ant|Is not He (best) Who produceth creation, then reproduceth it, and Who  provideth for you from the heaven and the earth ? Is there any God beside Allah ?  Say: Bring your proof, if ye are truthful! 
27|65|an-Naml: The Ant|Say (O Muhammad): None in the heavens and the earth knoweth the Unseen  save Allah; and they know not when they will be raised (again). 
27|66|an-Naml: The Ant|Nay, but doth their knowledge reach to the Hereafter ? Nay, for they are in  doubt concerning it. Nay, for they cannot see it. 
27|67|an-Naml: The Ant|Yet those who disbelieve say: When we have become dust like our fathers,  shall we verily be brought forth (again) ? 
27|68|an-Naml: The Ant|We were promised this, forsooth, we and our fathers. (All) this is naught but  fables of the men of old. 
27|69|an-Naml: The Ant|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Travel in the land and see the nature of the  sequel for the guilty! 
27|70|an-Naml: The Ant|And grieve thou not for them, nor be in distress because of what they plot  (against thee). 
27|71|an-Naml: The Ant|And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful ? 
27|72|an-Naml: The Ant|Say: It may be that a part of that which ye would hasten on is close behind  you. 
27|73|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! thy Lord is full of bounty for mankind, but most of them do not give  thanks. 
27|74|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! thy Lord knoweth surely all that their bosoms hide, and all that they  proclaim. 
27|75|an-Naml: The Ant|And there is nothing hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in a clear  Record. 
27|76|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! this Qur'an narrateth unto the Children of Israel most of that concerning  which they differ. 
27|77|an-Naml: The Ant|And lo! it is a guidance and a mercy for believers. 
27|78|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! thy Lord will judge between them of His wisdom, and He is the Mighty,  the Wise. 
27|79|an-Naml: The Ant|Therefor (O Muhammad) put thy trust in Allah, for thou (standest) on the  plain Truth. 
27|80|an-Naml: The Ant|Lo! thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to  hear the call when they have turned to flee; 
27|81|an-Naml: The Ant|Nor canst thou lead the blind out of their error. Thou canst make none to  hear, save those who believe Our revelations and who have surrendered. 
27|82|an-Naml: The Ant|And when the word is fulfilled concerning them, We shall bring forth a beast  of the earth to speak unto them because mankind had not faith in Our revelations. 
27|83|an-Naml: The Ant|And (remind them of) the Day when We shall gather out of every nation a  host of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be set in array; 
27|84|an-Naml: The Ant|Till, when they come (before their Lord), He will say: Did ye deny My  revelations when ye could not compass them in knowledge, or what was it that ye did  ? 
27|85|an-Naml: The Ant|And the Word will be fulfilled concerning them because they have done  wrong, and they will not speak. 
27|86|an-Naml: The Ant|Have they not seen how We have appointed the night that they may rest  therein, and the day sight-giving ? Lo! therein verily are portents for a people who  believe. 
27|87|an-Naml: The Ant|And (remind them of) the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, and all who  are in the heavens and the earth will start in fear, save him whom Allah willeth. And  all come unto Him, humbled. 
27|88|an-Naml: The Ant|And thou seest the hills thou deemest solid flying with the flight of clouds:  the doing of Allah Who perfecteth all things. Lo! He is Informed of what ye do. 
27|89|an-Naml: The Ant|Whoso bringeth a good deed will have better than its worth; and such are  safe from fear that Day. 
27|90|an-Naml: The Ant|And whoso bringeth an ill-deed, such will be flung down on their faces in the  Fire. Are ye rewarded aught save what ye did ? 
27|91|an-Naml: The Ant|(Say): I (Muhammad) am commanded only to serve the Lord of this land  which He hath hallowed, and unto Whom all things belong. And I am commanded to  be of those who surrender (unto Him), 
27|92|an-Naml: The Ant|And to recite the Qur'an. And whoso goeth right, goeth right only for (the  good of) his own soul; and as for him who goeth astray - (Unto him) say: Lo! I am  only a warner. 
27|93|an-Naml: The Ant|And say: Praise be to Allah Who will show you His portents so that ye shall  know them. And thy Lord is not unaware of what ye (mortals) do. 
28|1|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Ta. Sin. Mim. 
28|2|al-Qasas: The Narrative|These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain. 
28|3|al-Qasas: The Narrative|We narrate unto thee (somewhat) of the story of Moses and Pharaoh with  truth, for folk who believe. 
28|4|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Lo! Pharaoh exalted himself in the earth and made its people castes. A tribe  among them he oppressed, killing their sons and sparing their women. Lo! he was of  those who work corruption. 
28|5|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We desired to show favour unto those who were oppressed in the earth,  and to make them examples and to make them the inheritors, 
28|6|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And to establish them in the earth, and to show Pharaoh and Haman and their  hosts that which they feared from them. 
28|7|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We inspired the mother of Moses, saying: Suckle him and, when thou  fearest for him, then cast him into the river and fear not nor grieve. Lo! We shall  bring him back unto thee and shall make him (one) of Our messengers. 
28|8|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And the family of Pharaoh took him up, that he might become for them an  enemy and a sorrow, Lo! Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were ever sinning. 
28|9|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And the wife of Pharaoh said: (He will be) a consolation for me and for thee.  Kill him not. Peradventure he may be of use to us, or we may choose him for a son.  And they perceived not. 
28|10|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And the heart of the mother of Moses became void, and she would have  betrayed him if We had not fortified her heart, that she might be of the believers. 
28|11|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And she said unto his sister: Trace him. So she observed him from afar, and  they perceived not. 
28|12|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We had before forbidden foster-mothers for him, so she said: Shall I  show you a household who will rear him for you and take care of him ? 
28|13|al-Qasas: The Narrative|So We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not  grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them  know not. 
28|14|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when he reached his full strength and was ripe, We gave him wisdom  and knowledge. Thus do We reward the good. 
28|15|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And he entered the city at a time of carelessness of its folk, and he found  therein two men fighting, one of his own caste, and the other of his enemies; and he  who was of his caste asked him for help against him who was of his enemies. So  Moses struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: This is of the devil's doing.  Lo! he is an enemy, a mere misleader. 
28|16|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: My Lord! Lo! I have wronged my soul, so forgive me. Then He  forgave him. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful. 
28|17|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: My Lord! Forasmuch as Thou hast favoured me, I will nevermore  be a supporter of the guilty. 
28|18|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And morning found him in the city, fearing, vigilant, when behold! he who  had appealed to him the day before cried out to him for help. Moses said unto him:  Lo! thou art indeed a mere hothead. 
28|19|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when he would have fallen upon the man who was an enemy unto them  both, he said: O Moses! Wouldst thou kill me as thou didst kill a person yesterday.  Thou wouldst be nothing but a tyrant in the land, thou wouldst not be of the  reformers. 
28|20|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And a man came from the uttermost part of the city, running. He said: O  Moses! Lo! the chiefs take counsel against thee to slay thee; therefor escape. Lo! I am  of those who give thee good advice. 
28|21|al-Qasas: The Narrative|So he escaped from thence, fearing, vigilant. He said: My Lord! Deliver me  from the wrongdoing folk. 
28|22|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when he turned his face toward Midian, he said: Peradventure my Lord  will guide me in the right road. 
28|23|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when he came unto the water of Midian he found there a whole tribe of  men, watering. And he found apart from them two women keeping back (their  flocks). He said: What aileth you ? The two said: We cannot give (our flocks) to drink  till the shepherds return from the water; and our father is a very old man. 
28|24|al-Qasas: The Narrative|So he watered (their flock) for them. Then he turned aside into the shade, and  said: My Lord! I am needy of whatever good Thou sendest down for me. 
28|25|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Then there came unto him one of the two women, walking shyly. She said:  Lo! my father biddeth thee, that he may reward thee with a payment for that thou  didst water (the flock) for us. Then, when he came unto him and told him the (whole)  story, he said: Fear not! Thou hast escaped from the wrongdoing folk. 
28|26|al-Qasas: The Narrative|One of the two women said: O my father! Hire him! For the best (man) that  thou canst hire in the strong, the trustworthy. 
28|27|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: Lo! I fain would marry thee to one of these two daughters of mine  on condition that thou hirest thyself to me for (the term of) eight pilgrimages. Then if  thou completest ten it will be of thine own accord, for I would not make it hard for  thee. Allah willing, thou wilt find me of the righteous. 
28|28|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: That (is settled) between thee and me. Whichever of the two terms I  fulfil, there will be no injustice to me, and Allah is Surety over what we say. 
28|29|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Then, when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his  housefolk, he saw in the distance a fire and said unto his housefolk: Bide ye (here).  Lo! I see in the distance a fire; peradventure I shall bring you tidings thence, or a  brand from the fire that ye may warm yourselves. 
28|30|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when he reached it, he was called from the right side of the valley in the  blessed field, from the tree: O Moses! Lo! I, even I, am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds; 
28|31|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Throw down thy staff. And when he saw it writhing as it had been a demon,  he turned to flee headlong, (and it was said unto him): O Moses! Draw nigh and fear  not. Lo! thou art of those who are secure. 
28|32|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Thrust thy hand into the bosom of thy robe it will come forth white without  hurt. And guard thy heart from fear. Then these shall be two proofs from your Lord  unto Pharaoh and his chiefs. Lo! they are evil-living folk. 
28|33|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: My Lord! Lo! I killed a man among them and I fear that they will  kill me. 
28|34|al-Qasas: The Narrative|My brother Aaron is more eloquent than me in speech. Therefor send him  with me as a helper to confirm me. Lo! I fear that they will give the lie to me. 
28|35|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: We will strengthen thine arm with thy brother, and We will give  unto you both power so that they cannot reach you for Our portents. Ye twain, and  those who follow you, will be the winners. 
28|36|al-Qasas: The Narrative|But when Moses came unto them with Our clear tokens, they said: This is  naught but invented magic. We never heard of this among our fathers of old. 
28|37|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And Moses said: My Lord is Best Aware of him who bringeth guidance from  His presence, and whose will be the sequel of the Home (of bliss). Lo! wrong-doers  will not be successful. 
28|38|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And Pharaoh said: O chiefs! I know not that ye have a god other than me, so  kindle for me (a fire), O Haman, to bake the mud; and set up for me a lofty tower in  order that I may survey the God of Moses; and lo! I deem him of the liars. 
28|39|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And he and his hosts were haughty in the land without right, and deemed that  they would never be brought back to Us. 
28|40|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Therefor We seized him and his hosts, and abandoned them unto the sea.  Behold the nature of the consequence for evil-doers! 
28|41|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We made them patterns that invite unto the Fire, and on the Day of  Resurrection they will not be helped. 
28|42|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We made a curse to follow them in this world, and on the Day of  Resurrection they will be among the hateful. 
28|43|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We verily gave the Scripture unto Moses after We had destroyed the  generations of old: clear testimonies for mankind, and a guidance and a mercy, that  haply they might reflect. 
28|44|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And thou (Muhammad) wast not on the western side (of the Mount) when  We expounded unto Moses the commandment, and thou wast not among those  present; 
28|45|al-Qasas: The Narrative|But We brought forth generations, and their lives dragged on for them. And  thou wast not a dweller in Midian, reciting unto them Our revelations, but We kept  sending (messengers to men). 
28|46|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And thou was not beside the Mount when We did call; but (the knowledge of  it is) a mercy from thy Lord that thou mayst warn a folk unto whom no warner came  before thee, that haply they may give heed. 
28|47|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Otherwise, if disaster should afflict them because of that which their own  hands have sent before (them), they might say: Our Lord! Why sentest Thou no  messenger unto us, that we might have followed Thy revelations and been of the  believers ? 
28|48|al-Qasas: The Narrative|But when there came unto them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Why  is he not given the like of what was given unto Moses ? Did they not disbelieve in  that which was given unto Moses of old ? They say: Two magics that support each  other; and they say: Lo! in both we are disbelievers. 
28|49|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Then bring a scripture from the presence of  Allah that giveth clearer guidance than these two (that) I may follow it, if ye are  truthful. 
28|50|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And if they answer thee not, then know that what they follow is their lusts.  And who goeth farther astray than he who followeth his lust without guidance from  Allah. Lo! Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk. 
28|51|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And now verily We have caused the Word to reach them, that haply they  may give heed. 
28|52|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Those unto whom We gave the Scripture before it, they believe in it, 
28|53|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when it is recited unto them, they say: We believe in it. Lo! it is the  Truth from our Lord. Lo! even before it we were of those who surrender (unto Him). 
28|54|al-Qasas: The Narrative|These will be given their reward twice over, because they are steadfast and  repel evil with good, and spend of that wherewith We have provided them, 
28|55|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And when they hear vanity they withdraw from it and say: Unto us our  works and unto you your works. Peace be unto you! We desire not the ignorant. 
28|56|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Lo! thou (O Muhammad) guidest not whom thou lovest, but Allah guideth  whom He will. And He is Best Aware of those who walk aright. 
28|57|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And they say: If we were to follow the Guidance with thee we should be torn  out of our land. Have We not established for them a sure sanctuary, whereunto the  produce of all things is brought (in trade), a provision from Our presence ? But most  of them know not. 
28|58|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And how many a community have We destroyed that was thankless for its  means of livelihood! And yonder are their dwellings, which have not been inhabited  after them save a little. And We, even We, were the inheritors. 
28|59|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And never did thy Lord destroy the townships, till He had raised up in their  mother(-town) a messenger reciting unto them Our revelations. And never did We  destroy the townships unless the folk thereof were evil-doers. 
28|60|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And whatsoever ye have been given is a comfort of the life of the world and  an ornament thereof; and that which Allah hath is better and more lasting. Have ye  then no sense ? 
28|61|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Is he whom We have promised a fair promise which he will find (true) like  him whom We suffer to enjoy awhile the comfort of the life of the world, then on the  Day of Resurrection he will be of those arraigned ? 
28|62|al-Qasas: The Narrative|On the day when He will call unto them and say: Where are My partners  whom ye imagined ? 
28|63|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Those concerning whom the Word will have come true will say: Our Lord!  These are they whom we led astray. We led them astray even as we ourselves were  astray. We declare our innocence before Thee: us they never worshipped. 
28|64|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And it will be said: Cry unto your (so-called) partners (of Allah). And they  will cry unto them, and they will give no answer unto them, and they will see the  Doom. Ah, if they had but been guided! 
28|65|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And on the Day when He will call unto them and say: What answer gave ye  to the messengers ? 
28|66|al-Qasas: The Narrative|On that day (all) tidings will be dimmed for them, nor will they ask one of  another, 
28|67|al-Qasas: The Narrative|But as for him who shall repent and believe and do right, he haply may be  one of the successful. 
28|68|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Thy Lord bringeth to pass what He willeth and chooseth. They have never  any choice. Glorified be Allah and Exalted above all that they associate (with Him)! 
28|69|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And thy Lord knoweth what their breasts conceal, and what they publish. 
28|70|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And He is Allah; there is no God save Him. His is all praise in the former  and the latter (state), and His is the command, and unto Him ye will be brought back. 
28|71|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Say: Have ye thought, if Allah made night everlasting for you till the Day of  Resurrection, who is a god beside Allah who could bring you light ? Will ye not then  hear ? 
28|72|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Say: Have ye thought, if Allah made day everlasting for you till the Day of  Resurrection, who is a god beside Allah who could bring you night wherein ye rest ?  Will ye not then see ? 
28|73|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Of His mercy hath He appointed for you night and day, that therein ye may  rest, and that ye may seek His bounty, and that haply ye may be thankful. 
28|74|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And on the Day when He shall call unto them and say: Where are My  partners whom ye pretended ? 
28|75|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And We shall take out from every nation a witness and We shall say: Bring  your proof. Then they will know that Allah hath the Truth, and all that they invented  will have failed them. 
28|76|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Now Korah was of Moses' folk, but he oppressed them; and We gave him so  much treasure that the stores thereof would verily have been a burden for a troop of  mighty men. When his own folk said unto him: Exult not; lo! Allah loveth not the  exultant; 
28|77|al-Qasas: The Narrative|But seek the abode of the Hereafter in that which Allah hath given thee and  neglect not thy portion of the world, and be thou kind even as Allah hath been kind to  thee, and seek not corruption in the earth; lo! Allah loveth not corrupters, 
28|78|al-Qasas: The Narrative|He said: I have been given it only on account of knowledge I possess. Knew  he not that Allah had destroyed already of the generations before him men who were  mightier than him in strength and greater in respect of following ? The guilty are not  questioned of their sins. 
28|79|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Then went he forth before his people in his pomp. Those who were desirous  of the life of the world said: Ah, would that we had the like of what hath been given  unto Korah! Lo! he is lord of rare good fortune. 
28|80|al-Qasas: The Narrative|But those who had been given knowledge said: Woe unto you! The reward of  Allah for him who believeth and doeth right is better, and only the steadfast will  obtain it. 
28|81|al-Qasas: The Narrative|So We caused the earth to swallow him and his dwelling-place. Then he had  no host to help him against Allah, nor was he of those who can save themselves. 
28|82|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And morning found those who had coveted his place but yesterday crying:  Ah, welladay! Allah enlargeth the provision for whom He will of His slaves and  straiteneth it (for whom He will). If Allah had not been gracious unto us He would  have caused it to swallow us (also). Ah, welladay! the disbelievers never prosper. 
28|83|al-Qasas: The Narrative|As for that Abode of the Hereafter We assign it unto those who seek not  oppression in the earth, nor yet corruption. The sequel is for those who ward off  (evil). 
28|84|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Whoso bringeth a good deed, he will have better than the same; while as for  him who bringeth an ill-deed, those who do ill-deeds will be requited only what they  did. 
28|85|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Lo! He Who hath given thee the Qur'an for a law will surely bring thee home  again. Say: My Lord is Best Aware of him who bringeth guidance and him who is in  error manifest. 
28|86|al-Qasas: The Narrative|Thou hadst no hope that the Scripture would be inspired in thee; but it is a  mercy from thy Lord, so never be a helper to the disbelievers. 
28|87|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And let them not divert thee from the revelations of Allah after they have  been sent down unto thee; but call (mankind) unto thy Lord, and be not of those who  ascribe partners (unto Him). 
28|88|al-Qasas: The Narrative|And cry not unto any other god along with Allah. There is no God save Him.  Everything will perish save His countenance. His is the command, and unto Him ye  will be brought back. 
29|1|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Alif. Lam. Mim. 
29|2|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Do men imagine that they will be left (at ease) because they say, We believe,  and will not be tested with affliction ? 
29|3|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Lo! We tested those who were before you. Thus Allah knoweth those who  are sincere, and knoweth those who feign. 
29|4|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Or do those who do ill-deeds imagine that they can outstrip Us ? Evil (for  them) is that which they decide. 
29|5|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Whoso looketh forward to the meeting with Allah (let him know that) Allah's  reckoning is surely nigh, and He is the Hearer, the Knower. 
29|6|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|And whosoever striveth, striveth only for himself, for lo! Allah is altogether  Independent of (His) creatures. 
29|7|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|And as for those who believe and do good works, We shall remit from them  their evil deeds and shall repay them the best that they did. 
29|8|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|We have enjoined on man kindness to parents; but if they strive to make thee  join with Me that of which thou hast no knowledge, then obey them not. Unto Me is  your return and I shall tell you what ye used to do. 
29|9|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|And as for those who believe and do good works, We verily shall make them  enter in among the righteous. 
29|10|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Of mankind is he who saith: We believe in Allah, but, if he be made to suffer  for the sake of Allah, he mistaketh the persecution of mankind for Allah's  punishment; and then, if victory cometh from thy Lord, will say: Lo! we were with  you (all the while). Is not Allah Best Aware of what is in the bosoms of (His)  creatures ? 
29|11|al-`Ankabut: The Spider|Verily Allah knoweth those who believe, and verily He knoweth the  hypocrites.
