39|1|az-Zumar: The Companies|The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise. 
39|2|az-Zumar: The Companies|Lo! We have revealed the Scripture unto thee (Muhammad) with truth; so  worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only). 
39|3|az-Zumar: The Companies|Surely pure religion is for Allah only. And those who choose protecting  friends beside Him (say): We worship them only that they may bring us near unto  Allah. Lo! Allah will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Lo!  Allah guideth not him who is a liar, an ingrate. 
39|4|az-Zumar: The Companies|If Allah had willed to choose a son, He could have chosen what He would of  that which He hath created. Be He Glorified! He is Allah, the One, the Absolute. 
39|5|az-Zumar: The Companies|He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. He maketh night to  succeed day, and He maketh day to succeed night, and He constraineth the sun and  the moon to give service, each running on for an appointed term. Is not He the  Mighty, the Forgiver ? 
39|6|az-Zumar: The Companies|He created you from one being, then from that (being) He made its mate; and  He hath provided for you of cattle eight kinds. He created you in the wombs of your  mothers, creation after creation, in a threefold gloom. Such is Allah, your Lord. His is  the Sovereignty. There is no God save Him. How then are ye turned away ? 
39|7|az-Zumar: The Companies|If ye are thankless, yet Allah is Independent of you, though He is not pleased  with thanklessness for His bondmen; and if ye are thankful He is pleased therewith  for you. No laden soul will bear another's load. Then unto your Lord is your return;  and He will tell you what ye used to do. Lo! He knoweth what is in the breasts (of  men). 
39|8|az-Zumar: The Companies|And when some hurt toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning unto  Him (repentant). Then, when He granteth him a boon from Him he forgetteth that for  which he cried unto Him before, and setteth up rivals to Allah that he may beguile  (men) from his way. Say (O Muhammad, unto such an one): Take pleasure in thy  disbelief a while. Lo! thou art of the owners of the Fire. 
39|9|az-Zumar: The Companies|Is he who payeth adoration in the watches of the night, prostrate and  standing, bewaring of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (to be  accounted equal with a disbeliever) ? Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Are those who  know equal with those who know not ? But only men of understanding will pay heed. 
39|10|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: O My bondmen who believe! Observe your duty to your Lord. For  those who do good in this world there is good, and Allah's earth is spacious. Verily  the steadfast will be paid their wages without stint. 
39|11|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say (O Muhammad): Lo! I am commanded to worship Allah, making  religion pure for Him (only). 
39|12|az-Zumar: The Companies|And I am commanded to be the first of those who are muslims (surrender  unto Him). 
39|13|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: Lo! if I should disobey my Lord, I fear the doom of a tremendous Day. 
39|14|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: Allah I worship, making my religion pure for Him (only). 
39|15|az-Zumar: The Companies|Then worship what ye will beside Him. Say: The losers will be those who  lose themselves and their housefolk on the Day of Resurrection. Ah, that will be the  manifest loss! 
39|16|az-Zumar: The Companies|They have an awning of fire above them and beneath them a dais (of fire).  With this doth Allah appal His bondmen. O My bondmen, therefor fear Me! 
39|17|az-Zumar: The Companies|And those who put away false gods lest they should worship them and turn  to Allah in repentance, for them there are glad tidings. Therefor give good tidings (O  Muhammad) to My bondmen 
39|18|az-Zumar: The Companies|Who hear advice and follow the best thereof. Such are those whom Allah  guideth, and such are men of understanding. 
39|19|az-Zumar: The Companies|Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled (to be helped), and canst thou  (O Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire ? 
39|20|az-Zumar: The Companies|But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are lofty halls with  lofty halls above them, built (for them), beneath which rivers flow. (It is) a promise of  Allah. Allah faileth not His promise. 
39|21|az-Zumar: The Companies|Hast thou not seen how Allah hath sent down water from the sky and hath  caused it to penetrate the earth as watersprings, and afterward thereby produceth  crops of divers hues; and afterward they wither and thou seest them turn yellow; then  He maketh them chaff. Lo! herein verily is a reminder for men of understanding. 
39|22|az-Zumar: The Companies|Is he whose bosom Allah hath expanded for Al-Islam, so that he followeth a  light from his Lord, (as he who disbelieveth) ? Then woe unto those whose hearts are  hardened against remembrance of Allah. Such are in plain error. 
39|23|az-Zumar: The Companies|Allah hath (now) revealed the fairest of statements, a Scripture consistent,  (wherein promises of reward are) paired (with threats of punishment), whereat doth  creep the flesh of those who fear their Lord, so that their flesh and their hearts soften  to Allah's reminder. Such is Allah's guidance, wherewith He guideth whom He will.  And him whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide. 
39|24|az-Zumar: The Companies|Is he then, who will strike his face against the awful doom upon the Day of  Resurrection (as he who doeth right) ? And it will be said unto the wrong-doers: Taste  what ye used to earn. 
39|25|az-Zumar: The Companies|Those before them denied, and so the doom came on them whence they  knew not. 
39|26|az-Zumar: The Companies|Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world, and verily  the doom of the Hereafter will be greater if they did but know. 
39|27|az-Zumar: The Companies|And verily We have coined for mankind in this Qur'an all kinds of  similitudes, that haply they may reflect; 
39|28|az-Zumar: The Companies|A Lecture in Arabic, containing no crookedness, that haply they may ward  off (evil). 
39|29|az-Zumar: The Companies|Allah coineth a similitude: A man in relation to whom are several part- owners, quarrelling, and a man belonging wholly to one man. Are the two equal in  similitude ? Praise be to Allah! But most of them know not. 
39|30|az-Zumar: The Companies|Lo! thou wilt die, and lo! they will die; 
39|31|az-Zumar: The Companies|Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord ye will dispute. 
39|32|az-Zumar: The Companies|And who doth greater wrong than he who telleth a lie against Allah, and  denieth the truth when it reacheth him ? Will not the home of disbelievers be in hell ? 
39|33|az-Zumar: The Companies|And whoso bringeth the truth and believeth therein - Such are the dutiful. 
39|34|az-Zumar: The Companies|They shall have what they will of their Lord's bounty. That is the reward of  the good: 
39|35|az-Zumar: The Companies|That Allah will remit from them the worst of what they did, and will pay  them for reward the best they used to do. 
39|36|az-Zumar: The Companies|Will not Allah defend His slave ? Yet they would frighten thee with those  beside Him. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide. 
39|37|az-Zumar: The Companies|And he whom Allah guideth, for him there can be no misleader. Is not Allah  Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong) ? 
39|38|az-Zumar: The Companies|And verily, if thou shouldst ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth  ? they will say: Allah. Say: Bethink you then of those ye worship beside Allah, if  Allah willed some hurt for me, could they remove from me His hurt; or if He willed  some mercy for me, could they restrain His mercy ? Say: Allah is my all. In Him do  (all) the trusting put their trust. 
39|39|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: O my people! Act in your manner. Lo! I (too) am acting. Thus ye will  come to know 
39|40|az-Zumar: The Companies|Who it is unto whom cometh a doom that will abase him, and on whom there  falleth everlasting doom. 
39|41|az-Zumar: The Companies|Lo! We have revealed unto thee (Muhammad) the Scripture for mankind  with truth. Then whosoever goeth right it is for his soul, and whosoever strayeth,  strayeth only to its hurt. And thou art not a warder over them. 
39|42|az-Zumar: The Companies|Allah receiveth (men's) souls at the time of their death, and that (soul) which  dieth not (yet) in its sleep. He keepeth that (soul) for which He hath ordained death  and dismisseth the rest till an appointed term. Lo! herein verily are portents for people  who take thought. 
39|43|az-Zumar: The Companies|Or choose they intercessors other than Allah ? Say: What! Even though they  have power over nothing and have no intelligence ? 
39|44|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: Unto Allah belongeth all intercession. His is the Sovereignty of the  heavens and the earth. And afterward unto Him ye will be brought back. 
39|45|az-Zumar: The Companies|And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in  the Hereafter are repelled, and when those (whom they worship) beside Him are  mentioned, behold! they are glad. 
39|46|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of the Invisible  and the Visible! Thou wilt judge between Thy slaves concerning that wherein they  used to differ. 
39|47|az-Zumar: The Companies|And though those who do wrong possess all that is in the earth, and therewith  as much again, they verily will seek to ransom themselves therewith on the Day of  Resurrection from the awful doom; and there will appear unto them, from their Lord,  that wherewith they never reckoned. 
39|48|az-Zumar: The Companies|And the evils that they earned will appear unto them, and that whereat they  used to scoff will surround them. 
39|49|az-Zumar: The Companies|Now when hurt toucheth a man he crieth unto Us, and afterward when We  have granted him a boon from Us, he saith: Only by force of knowledge I obtained it.  Nay, but it is a test. But most of them know not. 
39|50|az-Zumar: The Companies|Those before them said it, yet (all) that they had earned availed them not; 
39|51|az-Zumar: The Companies|But the evils that they earned smote them; and such of these as do wrong, the  evils that they earn will smite them; they cannot escape. 
39|52|az-Zumar: The Companies|Know they not that Allah enlargeth providence for whom He will, and  straiteneth it (for whom He will). Lo! herein verily are portents for people who  believe. 
39|53|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say: O My slaves who have been prodigal to their own hurt! Despair not of  the mercy of Allah, Who forgiveth all sins. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful. 
39|54|az-Zumar: The Companies|Turn unto your Lord repentant, and surrender unto Him, before there come  unto you the doom, when ye cannot be helped. 
39|55|az-Zumar: The Companies|And follow the better (guidance) of that which is revealed unto you from  your Lord, before the doom cometh on you suddenly when ye know not, 
39|56|az-Zumar: The Companies|Lest any soul should say: Alas, my grief that I was unmindful of Allah, and I  was indeed among the scoffers! 
39|57|az-Zumar: The Companies|Or should say: If Allah had but guided me I should have been among the  dutiful! 
39|58|az-Zumar: The Companies|Or should say, when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a second chance  that I might be among the righteous! 
39|59|az-Zumar: The Companies|(But now the answer will be): Nay, for My revelations came unto thee, but  thou didst deny them and wast scornful and wast among the disbelievers. 
39|60|az-Zumar: The Companies|And on the Day of Resurrection thou (Muhammad) seest those who lied  concerning Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the home of the scorners in hell ? 
39|61|az-Zumar: The Companies|And Allah delivereth those who ward off (evil) because of their deserts. Evil  toucheth them not, nor do they grieve. 
39|62|az-Zumar: The Companies|Allah is Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things. 
39|63|az-Zumar: The Companies|His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, and they who disbelieve the  revelations of Allah - such are they who are the losers. 
39|64|az-Zumar: The Companies|Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other than  Allah ? O ye fools! 
39|65|az-Zumar: The Companies|And verily it hath been revealed unto thee as unto those before thee (saying):  If thou ascribe a partner to Allah thy work will fail and thou indeed wilt be among the  losers. 
39|66|az-Zumar: The Companies|Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful! 
39|67|az-Zumar: The Companies|And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed, when the  whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are rolled in  His right hand. Glorified is He and High Exalted from all that they ascribe as partner  (unto Him). 
39|68|az-Zumar: The Companies|And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are in  the earth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth. Then it is blown a second time,  and behold them standing waiting! 
39|69|az-Zumar: The Companies|And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is set up, and  the prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is judged between them with truth,  and they are not wronged. 
39|70|az-Zumar: The Companies|And each soul is paid in full for what it did. And He is Best Aware of what  they do. 
39|71|az-Zumar: The Companies|And those who disbelieve are driven unto hell in troops till, when they reach  it and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Came  there not unto you messengers of your own, reciting unto you the revelations of your  Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day ? they say: Yea, verily. But the  word of doom of disbelievers is fulfilled. 
39|72|az-Zumar: The Companies|It is said (unto them): Enter ye the gates of hell to dwell therein. Thus  hapless is the journey's end of the scorners. 
39|73|az-Zumar: The Companies|And those who keep their duty to their Lord are driven unto the Garden in  troops till, when they reach it, and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders  thereof say unto them: Peace be unto you! Ye are good, so enter ye (the Garden of  delight), to dwell therein; 
39|74|az-Zumar: The Companies|They say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath fulfilled His promise unto us and  hath made us inherit the land, sojourning in the Garden where we will! So bounteous  is the wage of workers. 
39|75|az-Zumar: The Companies|And thou (O Muhammad) seest the angels thronging round the Throne,  hymning the praises of their Lord. And they are judged aright. And it is said: Praise  be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds! 
40|1|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Ha. Mim. 
40|2|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Knower, 
40|3|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The Forgiver of sin, the Accepter of repentance, the Stern in punishment, the  Bountiful. There is no God save Him. Unto Him is the journeying. 
40|4|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|None argue concerning the revelations of Allah save those who disbelieve,  so let not their turn of fortune in the land deceive thee (O Muhammad). 
40|5|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The folk of Noah and the factions after them denied (their messengers)  before these, and every nation purposed to seize their messenger and argued falsely,  (thinking) thereby to refute the Truth. Then I seized them, and how (awful) was My  punishment. 
40|6|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Thus was the word of thy Lord concerning those who disbelieve fulfilled:  That they are owners of the Fire. 
40|7|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Those who bear the Throne, and all who are round about it, hymn the praises  of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who believe (saying):  Our Lord! Thou comprehendest all things in mercy and knowledge, therefor forgive  those who repent and follow Thy way. Ward off from them the punishment of hell. 
40|8|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Our Lord! And make them enter the Gardens of Eden which thou hast  promised them, with such of their fathers and their wives and their descendants as do  right. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Mighty, the Wise. 
40|9|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And ward off from them ill-deeds; and he from whom Thou wardest off ill- deeds that day, him verily hast Thou taken into mercy. That is the supreme triumph. 
40|10|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Lo! (on that day) those who disbelieve are informed by proclamation: Verily  Allah's abhorrence is more terrible than your abhorrence one of another, when ye  were called unto the faith but did refuse. 
40|11|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|They say: Our Lord! Twice hast Thou made us die, and twice hast Thou  made us live. Now we confess our sins. Is there any way to go out ? 
40|12|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|(It is said unto them): This is (your plight) because, when Allah only was  invoked, ye disbelieved, but when some partner was ascribed to Him ye were  believing. But the command belongeth only to Allah, the Sublime, the Majestic. 
40|13|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|He it is Who showeth you His portents, and sendeth down for you provision  from the sky. None payeth heed save him who turneth (unto Him) repentant. 
40|14|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Therefor (O believers) pray unto Allah, making religion pure for Him (only),  however much the disbelievers be averse - 
40|15|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The Exalter of Ranks, the Lord of the Throne. He causeth the Spirit of His  command upon whom He will of His slaves, that He may warn of the Day of  Meeting, 
40|16|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The day when they come forth, nothing of them being hidden from Allah.  Whose is the Sovereignty this day ? It is Allah's, the One, the Almighty. 
40|17|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|This day is each soul requited that which it hath earned; no wrong (is done)  this day. Lo! Allah is swift at reckoning. 
40|18|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Warn them (O Muhammad) of the Day of the approaching (doom), when the  hearts will be choking the throats, (when) there will be no friend for the wrong-doers,  nor any intercessor who will be heard. 
40|19|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|He knoweth the traitor of the eyes, and that which the bosoms hide. 
40|20|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Allah judgeth with truth, while those to whom they cry instead of Him judge  not at all. Lo! Allah, He is the Hearer, the Seer. 
40|21|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for  those who disbelieved before them ? They were mightier than these in power and (in  the) traces (which they left behind them) in the earth. Yet Allah seized them for their  sins, and they had no protector from Allah. 
40|22|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|That was because their messengers kept bringing them clear proofs (of  Allah's Sovereignty) but they disbelieved; so Allah seized them. Lo! He is Strong,  severe in punishment. 
40|23|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant 
40|24|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Unto Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they said: A lying sorcerer! 
40|25|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And when he brought them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Slay the  sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women. But the plot of  disbelievers is in naught but error. 
40|26|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto his Lord.  Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he will cause confusion in the land. 
40|27|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Moses said: Lo! I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every scorner  who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning. 
40|28|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And a believing man of Pharaoh's family, who hid his faith, said: Would ye  kill a man because he saith: My Lord is Allah, and hath brought you clear proofs from  your Lord ? If he is lying, then his lie is upon him; and if he is truthful, then some of  that wherewith he threateneth you will strike you. Lo! Allah guideth not one who is a  prodigal, a liar. 
40|29|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|O my people! Yours is the kingdom to-day, ye being uppermost in the land.  But who would save us from the wrath of Allah should it reach us ? Pharaoh said: I  do but show you what I think, and I do but guide you to wise policy. 
40|30|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And he who believed said: O my people! Lo! I fear for you a fate like that of  the factions (of old); 
40|31|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|A plight like that of Noah's folk, and A'ad and Thamud, and those after them,  and Allah willeth no injustice for (His) slaves. 
40|32|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And, O my people! Lo! I fear for you a Day of Summoning, 
40|33|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|A day when ye will turn to flee, having no preserver from Allah: and he  whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide. 
40|34|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And verily Joseph brought you of old clear proofs, yet ye ceased not to be in  doubt concerning what he brought you till, when he died, ye said: Allah will not send  any messenger after him. Thus Allah deceiveth him who is a prodigal, a doubter. 
40|35|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without any warrant  that hath come unto them, it is greatly hateful in the sight of Allah and in the sight of  those who believe. Thus doth Allah print on every arrogant, disdainful heart. 
40|36|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And Pharaoh said: O Haman! Build for me a tower that haply I may reach  the roads, 
40|37|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The roads of the heavens, and may look upon the God of Moses, though  verily I think him a liar. Thus was the evil that he did made fairseeming unto Pharaoh,  and he was debarred from the (right) way. The plot of Pharaoh ended but in ruin. 
40|38|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And he who believed said: O my people! Follow me. I will show you the  way of right conduct. 
40|39|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|O my people! Lo! this life of the world is but a passing comfort, and lo! the  Hereafter, that is the enduring home. 
40|40|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Whoso doeth an ill-deed, he will be repaid the like thereof, while whoso  doeth right, whether male or female, and is a believer, (all) such will enter the  Garden, where they will be nourished without stint. 
40|41|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And, O my people! What aileth me that I call you unto deliverance when ye  call me unto the Fire ? 
40|42|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Ye call me to disbelieve in Allah and ascribe unto Him as partners that  whereof I have no knowledge, while I call you unto the Mighty, the Forgiver. 
40|43|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Assuredly that whereunto ye call me hath no claim in the world or in the  Hereafter, and our return will be unto Allah, and the prodigals will be owners of the  Fire. 
40|44|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And ye will remember what I say unto you. I confide my cause unto Allah.  Lo! Allah is Seer of (His) slaves. 
40|45|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|So Allah warded off from him the evils which they plotted, while a dreadful  doom encompassed Pharaoh's folk, 
40|46|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The Fire; they are exposed to it morning and evening; and on the day when  the Hour upriseth (it is said): Cause Pharaoh's folk to enter the most awful doom. 
40|47|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And when they wrangle in the Fire, the weak say unto those who were proud:  Lo! we were a following unto you; will ye therefor rid us of a portion of the Fire ? 
40|48|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Those who were proud say: Lo! we are all (together) herein. Lo! Allah hath  judged between (His) slaves. 
40|49|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And those in the Fire say unto the guards of hell: Entreat your Lord that He  relieve us of a day of the torment. 
40|50|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|They say: Came not your messengers unto you with clear proofs ? They say:  Yea, verily. They say: Then do ye pray, although the prayer of disbelievers is in vain. 
40|51|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Lo! We verily do help Our messengers, and those who believe, in the life of  the world and on the day when the witnesses arise, 
40|52|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|The day when their excuse availeth not the evil-doers, and theirs is the curse,  and theirs the ill abode. 
40|53|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And We verily gave Moses the guidance, and We caused the Children of  Israel to inherit the Scripture, 
40|54|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|A guide and a reminder for men of understanding. 
40|55|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Then have patience (O Muhammad). Lo! the promise of Allah is true. And  ask forgiveness of thy sin, and hymn the praise of thy Lord at fall of night and in the  early hours. 
40|56|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Lo! those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without a warrant  having come unto them, there is naught else in their breasts save pride which they  will never attain. So take thou refuge in Allah. Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the  Seer. 
40|57|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the  creation of mankind; but most of mankind know not. 
40|58|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And the blind man and the seer are not equal, neither are those who believe  and do good works (equal with) the evil-doer. Little do ye reflect! 
40|59|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Lo! the Hour is surely coming, there is no doubt thereof; yet most of  mankind believe not. 
40|60|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And your Lord hath said: Pray unto Me and I will hear your prayer. Lo!  those who scorn My service, they will enter hell, disgraced. 
40|61|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Allah it is Who hath appointed for you night that ye may rest therein, and  day for seeing. Lo! Allah is a Lord of bounty for mankind, yet most of mankind give  not thanks. 
40|62|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Such is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things, There is no God save  Him. How then are ye perverted ? 
40|63|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Thus are they perverted who deny the revelations of Allah. 
40|64|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Allah it is Who appointed for you the earth for a dwelling-place and the sky  for a canopy, and fashioned you and perfected your shapes, and hath provided you  with good things. Such is Allah, your Lord. Then blessed be Allah, the Lord of the  Worlds! 
40|65|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|He is the Living One. There is no God save Him. So pray unto Him, making  religion pure for Him (only). Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds! 
40|66|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Say (O Muhammad): I am forbidden to worship those unto whom ye cry  beside Allah since there have come unto me clear proofs from my Lord, and I am  commanded to surrender to the Lord of the Worlds. 
40|67|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|He it is Who created you from dust, then from a drop (of seed) then from a  clot, then bringeth you forth as a child, then (ordaineth) that ye attain full strength and  afterward that ye become old men - though some among you die before - and that ye  reach an appointed term, that haply ye may understand. 
40|68|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|He it is Who quickeneth and giveth death. When He ordaineth a thing, He  saith unto it only: Be! and it is. 
40|69|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Hast thou not seen those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah,  how they are turned away ? - 
40|70|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Those who deny the Scripture and that wherewith We send Our messengers.  But they will come to know, 
40|71|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|When carcans are about their necks and chains. They are dragged 
40|72|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Through boiling waters; then they are thrust into the Fire. 
40|73|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Then it is said unto them: Where are (all) that ye used to make partners (in  the Sovereignty) 
40|74|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Beside Allah ? They say: They have failed us; but we used not to pray to  anything before. Thus doth Allah send astray the disbelievers (in His guidance). 
40|75|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|(And it is said unto them): This is because ye exulted in the earth without  right, and because ye were petulant. 
40|76|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Enter ye the gates of hell, to dwell therein. Evil is the habitation of the  scornful. 
40|77|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Then have patience (O Muhammad). Lo! the promise of Allah is true. And  whether we let thee see a part of that which We promise them, or (whether) We cause  thee to die, still unto Us they will be brought back. 
40|78|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Verily We sent messengers before thee, among them those of whom We  have told thee, and some of whom We have not told thee; and it was not given to any  messenger that he should bring a portent save by Allah's leave, but when Allah's  commandment cometh (the cause) is judged aright, and the followers of vanity will  then be lost. 
40|79|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Allah it is Who hath appointed for you cattle, that ye may ride on some of  them, and eat of some - 
40|80|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|(Many) benefits ye have from them - and that ye may satisfy by their means  a need that is in your breasts, and may be borne upon them as upon the ship. 
40|81|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And He showeth you His tokens. Which, then, of the tokens of Allah do ye  deny ? 
40|82|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for  those before them ? They were more numerous than these, and mightier in power and  (in the) traces (which they left behind them) in the earth. But all that they used to earn  availed them not. 
40|83|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|And when their messengers brought them clear proofs (of Allah's  Sovereignty) they exulted in the knowledge they (themselves) possessed. And that  which they were wont to mock befell them. 
40|84|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|Then, when they saw Our doom, they said: We believe in Allah only and  reject (all) that we used to associate (with Him). 
40|85|al-Mu'min: The Forgiving One|But their faith could not avail them when they saw Our doom. This is Allah's  law which hath ever taken course for His bondmen. And then the disbelievers will be  ruined. 
41|1|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Ha. Mim. 
41|2|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|A revelation from the Beneficent, the Merciful, 
41|3|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|A Scripture whereof the verses are expounded, a Lecture in Arabic for  people who have knowledge, 
41|4|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Good tidings and a warning. But most of them turn away so that they hear  not. 
41|5|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And they say: Our hearts are protected from that unto which thou (O  Muhammad) callest us, and in our ears there is a deafness, and between us and thee  there is a veil. Act, then. Lo! we also shall be acting. 
41|6|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Say (unto them O Muhammad): I am only a mortal like you. It is inspired in  me that your God is One God, therefor take the straight path unto Him and seek  forgiveness of Him. And woe unto the idolaters, 
41|7|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Who give not the poor-due, and who are disbelievers in the Hereafter. 
41|8|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Lo! as for those who believe and do good works, for them is a reward  enduring. 
41|9|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Say (O Muhammad, unto the idolaters): Disbelieve ye verily in Him Who  created the earth in two Days, and ascribe ye unto Him rivals ? He (and none else) is  the Lord of the Worlds. 
41|10|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|He placed therein firm hills rising above it, and blessed it and measured  therein its sustenance in four Days, alike for (all) who ask; 
41|11|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Then turned He to the heaven when it was smoke, and said unto it and unto  the earth: Come both of you, willingly or loth. They said: We come, obedient. 
41|12|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Then He ordained them seven heavens in two Days and inspired in each  heaven its mandate; and We decked the nether heaven with lamps, and rendered it  inviolable. That is the measuring of the Mighty, the Knower. 
41|13|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|But if they turn away, then say: I warn you of a thunderbolt like the  thunderbolt (which fell of old upon the tribes) of A'ad and Thamud; 
41|14|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|When their messengers came unto them from before them and behind them,  saying: Worship none but Allah! they said: If our Lord had willed, He surely would  have sent down angels (unto us), so lo! we are disbelievers in that wherewith ye have  been sent. 
41|15|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|As for A'ad, they were arrogant in the land without right, and they said: Who  is mightier than us in power ? Could they not see that Allah Who created them, He  was mightier than them in power ? And they denied Our revelations. 
41|16|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Therefor We let loose on them a raging wind in evil days, that We might  make them taste the torment of disgrace in the life of the world. And verily the doom  of the Hereafter will be more shameful, and they will not be helped. 
41|17|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And as for Thamud, We gave them guidance, but they preferred blindness to  the guidance, so the bolt of the doom of humiliation overtook them because of what  they used to earn. 
41|18|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And We delivered those who believed and used to keep their duty to Allah. 
41|19|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And (make mention of) the day when the enemies of Allah are gathered unto  the Fire, they are driven on 
41|20|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Till, when they reach it, their ears and their eyes and their skins testify  against them as to what they used to do. 
41|21|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And they say unto their skins: Why testify ye against us ? They say: Allah  hath given us speech Who giveth speech to all things, and Who created you at the  first, and unto Whom ye are returned. 
41|22|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Ye did not hide yourselves lest your ears and your eyes and your skins  should testify against you, but ye deemed that Allah knew not much of what ye did. 
41|23|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|That, your thought which ye did think about your Lord, hath ruined you; and  ye find yourselves (this day) among the lost. 
41|24|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And though they are resigned, yet the Fire is still their home; and if they ask  for favour, yet they are not of those unto whom favour can be shown. 
41|25|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And We assigned them comrades (in the world), who made their present and  their past fairseeming unto them. And the Word concerning nations of the jinn and  humankind who passed away before them hath effect for them. Lo! they were ever  losers. 
41|26|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Those who disbelieve say: Heed not this Qur'an, and drown the hearing of it;  haply ye may conquer. 
41|27|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|But verily We shall cause those who disbelieve to taste an awful doom, and  verily We shall requite them the worst of what they used to do. 
41|28|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|That is the reward of Allah's enemies: the Fire. Therein is their immortal  home, payment forasmuch as they denied Our revelations. 
41|29|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And those who disbelieve will say: Our Lord! Show us those who beguiled  us of the jinn and humankind. We will place them underneath our feet that they may  be among the nethermost. 
41|30|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Lo! those who say: Our Lord is Allah, and afterward are upright, the angels  descend upon them, saying: Fear not nor grieve, but hear good tidings of the paradise  which ye are promised. 
41|31|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|We are your protecting friends in the life of the world and in the Hereafter.  There ye will have (all) that your souls desire, and there ye will have (all) for which  ye pray. 
41|32|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|A gift of welcome from One Forgiving, Merciful. 
41|33|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And who is better in speech than him who prayeth unto his Lord and doeth  right, and saith: Lo! I am of those who are muslims (surrender unto Him). 
41|34|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|The good deed and the evil deed are not alike. Repel the evil deed with one  which is better, then lo! he, between whom and thee there was enmity (will become)  as though he was a bosom friend. 
41|35|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|But none is granted it save those who are steadfast, and none is granted it  save the owner of great happiness. 
41|36|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And if a whisper from the devil reach thee (O Muhammad) then seek refuge  in Allah. Lo! He is the Hearer, the Knower. 
41|37|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And of His portents are the night and the day and the sun and the moon.  Adore not the sun not the moon; but adore Allah Who created them, if it is in truth  Him Whom ye worship. 
41|38|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|But if they are too proud - still those who are with thy Lord glorify Him  night and day, and tire not. 
41|39|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And of His portents (is this): that thou seest the earth lowly, but when We  send down water thereon it thrilleth and groweth. Lo! He Who quickeneth it is verily  the Quickener of the Dead. Lo! He is Able to do all things. 
41|40|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Lo! those who distort Our revelations are not hid from Us. Is he who is  hurled into the Fire better, or he who cometh secure on the Day of Resurrection ? Do  what ye will. Lo! He is Seer of what ye do. 
41|41|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Lo! those who disbelieve in the Reminder when it cometh unto them (are  guilty), for lo! it is an unassailable Scripture. 
41|42|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Falsehood cannot come at it from before it or from behind it. (It is) a  revelation from the Wise, the Owner of Praise. 
41|43|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Naught is said unto thee (Muhammad) save what was said unto the  messengers before thee. Lo! thy Lord is owner of forgiveness, and owner (also) of  dire punishment. 
41|44|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And if We had appointed it a Lecture in a foreign tongue they would  assuredly have said: If only its verses were expounded (so that we might understand)  ? What! A foreign tongue and an Arab ? - Say unto them (O Muhammad): For those  who believe it is a guidance and a healing; and as for those who disbelieve, there is a  deafness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. Such are called to from afar. 
41|45|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, but there hath been dispute  concerning it; and but for a Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord, it would  ere now have been judged between them; but lo! they are in hopeless doubt  concerning it. 
41|46|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Whoso doeth right it is for his soul, and whoso doeth wrong it is against it.  And thy Lord is not at all a tyrant to His slaves. 
41|47|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Unto Him is referred (all) knowledge of the Hour. And no fruits burst forth  from their sheaths, and no female carrieth or bringeth forth but with His knowledge.  And on the day when He calleth unto them: Where are now My partners ? they will  say: We confess unto Thee, not one of us is a witness (for them). 
41|48|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And those to whom they used to cry of old have failed them, and they  perceive they have no place of refuge. 
41|49|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Man tireth not of praying for good, and if ill toucheth him, then he is  disheartened, desperate. 
41|50|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|And verily, if We cause him to taste mercy after some hurt that hath touched  him, he will say: This is my own; and I deem not that the Hour will ever rise, and if I  am brought back to my Lord, I surely shall be better off with Him - But We verily  shall tell those who disbelieve (all) that they did, and We verily shall make them taste  hard punishment. 
41|51|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|When We show favour unto man, he withdraweth and turneth aside, but  when ill toucheth him then he aboundeth in prayer. 
41|52|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|Bethink you: If it is from Allah and ye reject it - Who is further astray than  one who is at open feud (with Allah) ? 
41|53|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|We shall show them Our portents on the horizons and within themselves  until it will be manifest unto them that it is the Truth. Doth not thy Lord suffice, since  He is Witness over all things ? 
41|54|Ha Mim Sajdah: Revelations Well Expounded|How! Are they still in doubt about the meeting with their Lord ? Lo! Is not  He surrounding all things ? 
42|1|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Ha. Mim. 
42|2|ash-Shura: The Counsel|A'in. Sin. Qaf. 
42|3|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Thus Allah the Mighty, the Knower inspireth thee (Muhammad) as (He  inspired) those before thee. 
42|4|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Unto Him belongeth all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and  He is the Sublime, the Tremendous. 
42|5|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Almost might the heavens above be rent asunder while the angels hymn the  praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on the earth. Lo! Allah, He is the  Forgiver, the Merciful. 
42|6|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And as for those who choose protecting friends beside Him, Allah is Warden  over them, and thou art in no wise a guardian over them. 
42|7|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And thus We have inspired in thee a Lecture in Arabic, that thou mayst warn  the mother-town and those around it, and mayst warn of a day of assembling whereof  there is no doubt. A host will be in the Garden, and a host of them in the Flame. 
42|8|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Had Allah willed, He could have made them one community, but Allah  bringeth whom He will into His mercy. And the wrong-doers have no friend nor  helper. 
42|9|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Or have they chosen protecting friends besides Him ? But Allah, He (alone)  is the Protecting Friend. He quickeneth the dead, and He is Able to do all things. 
42|10|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And in whatsoever ye differ, the verdict therein belongeth to Allah. Such is  my Lord, in Whom I put my trust, and unto Whom I turn. 
42|11|ash-Shura: The Counsel|The Creator of the heavens and the earth. He hath made for you pairs of  yourselves, and of the cattle also pairs, whereby He multiplieth you. Naught is as His  likeness; and He is the Hearer, the Seer. 
42|12|ash-Shura: The Counsel|His are the keys of the heavens and the earth. He enlargeth providence for  whom He will and straiteneth (it for whom He will). Lo! He is Knower of all things. 
42|13|ash-Shura: The Counsel|He hath ordained for you that religion which He commended unto Noah, and  that which We inspire in thee (Muhammad), and that which We commended unto  Abraham and Moses and Jesus, saying: Establish the religion, and be not divided  therein. Dreadful for the idolaters is that unto which thou callest them. Allah chooseth  for Himself whom He will, and guideth unto Himself him who turneth (toward Him). 
42|14|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And they were not divided until after the knowledge came unto them,  through rivalry among themselves; and had it not been for a Word that had already  gone forth from thy Lord for an appointed term, it surely had been judged between  them. And those who were made to inherit the Scripture after them are verily in  hopeless doubt concerning it. 
42|15|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Unto this, then, summon (O Muhammad). And be thou upright as thou art  commanded, and follow not their lusts, but say: I believe in whatever scripture Allah  hath sent down, and I am commanded to be just among you. Allah is our Lord and  your Lord. Unto us our works and unto you your works; no argument between us and  you. Allah will bring us together, and unto Him is the journeying. 
42|16|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And those who argue concerning Allah after He hath been acknowledged,  their argument hath no weight with their Lord, and wrath is upon them and theirs will  be an awful doom. 
42|17|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Allah it is Who hath revealed the Scripture with truth, and the Balance. How  canst thou know ? It may be that the Hour is nigh. 
42|18|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Those who believe not therein seek to hasten it, while those who believe are  fearful of it and know that it is the Truth. Are not they who dispute, in doubt  concerning the Hour, far astray ? 
42|19|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Allah is gracious unto His slaves. He provideth for whom He will. And He is  the Strong, the Mighty. 
42|20|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Whoso desireth the harvest of the Hereafter, We give him increase in its  harvest. And whoso desireth the harvest of the world, We give him thereof, and he  hath no portion in the Hereafter. 
42|21|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Or have they partners (of Allah) who have made lawful for them in religion  that which Allah allowed not ? And but for a decisive word (gone forth already), it  would have been judged between them. Lo! for wrong-doers is a painful doom. 
42|22|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Thou seest the wrong-doers fearful of that which they have earned, and it  will surely befall them, while those who believe and do good works (will be) in  flowering meadows of the Gardens, having what they wish from their Lord. This is  the great preferment. 
42|23|ash-Shura: The Counsel|This it is which Allah announceth unto His bondmen who believe and do  good works. Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee therefor, save  lovingkindness among kinsfolk. And whoso scoreth a good deed We add unto its  good for him. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Responsive. 
42|24|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Or say they: He hath invented a lie concerning Allah ? If Allah willed, He  could have sealed thy heart (against them). And Allah will wipe out the lie and will  vindicate the truth by His words. Lo! He is Aware of what is hidden in the breasts (of  men). 
42|25|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And He it is Who accepteth repentance from His bondmen, and pardoneth  the evil deeds, and knoweth what ye do, 
42|26|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And accepteth those who do good works, and giveth increase unto them of  His bounty. And as for disbelievers, theirs will be an awful doom. 
42|27|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And if Allah were to enlarge the provision for His slaves they would surely  rebel in the earth, but He sendeth down by measure as He willeth. Lo! He is  Informed, a Seer of His bondmen. 
42|28|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And He it is Who sendeth down the saving rain after they have despaired,  and spreadeth out His mercy. He is the Protecting Friend, the Praiseworthy. 
42|29|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And of His portents is the creation of the heaven and the earth, and of  whatever beasts He hath dispersed therein. And He is Able to gather them when He  will. 
42|30|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Whatever of misfortune striketh you, it is what your right hands have earned.  And He forgiveth much. 
42|31|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Ye cannot escape in the earth, for beside Allah ye have no protecting friend  nor any helper. 
42|32|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And of His portents are the ships, like banners on the sea; 
42|33|ash-Shura: The Counsel|If He will He calmeth the wind so that they keep still upon its surface - Lo!  herein verily are signs for every steadfast grateful (heart). - 
42|34|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Or He causeth them to perish on account of that which they have earned -  And He forgiveth much - 
42|35|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And that those who argue concerning Our revelations may know they have  no refuge. 
42|36|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Now whatever ye have been given is but a passing comfort for the life of the  world, and that which Allah hath is better and more lasting for those who believe and  put their trust in their Lord, 
42|37|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And those who shun the worst of sins and indecencies and, when they are  wroth, forgive, 
42|38|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And those who answer the call of their Lord and establish worship, and  whose affairs are a matter of counsel, and who spend of what We have bestowed on  them, 
42|39|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And those who, when great wrong is done to them, defend themselves, 
42|40|ash-Shura: The Counsel|The guerdon of an ill-deed is an ill the like thereof. But whosoever pardoneth  and amendeth, his wage is the affair of Allah. Lo! He loveth not wrong-doers. 
42|41|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And whoso defendeth himself after he hath suffered wrong - for such, there  is no way (of blame) against them. 
42|42|ash-Shura: The Counsel|The way (of blame) is only against those who oppress mankind, and  wrongfully rebel in the earth. For such there is a painful doom. 
42|43|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And verily whoso is patient and forgiveth - lo! that, verily, is (of) the  steadfast heart of things. 
42|44|ash-Shura: The Counsel|He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no protecting friend after  Him. And thou (Muhammad) wilt see the evil-doers when they see the doom, (how)  they say: Is there any way of return ? 
42|45|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And thou wilt see them exposed to (the Fire), made humble by disgrace, and  looking with veiled eyes. And those who believe will say: Lo! the (eternal) losers are  they who lose themselves and their housefolk on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! are not  the wrong-doers in perpetual torment ? 
42|46|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And they will have no protecting friends to help them instead of Allah. He  whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no road. 
42|47|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Answer the call of your Lord before there cometh unto you from Allah a Day  which there is no averting. Ye have no refuge on that Day, nor have a ye any (power  of) refusal. 
42|48|ash-Shura: The Counsel|But if they are averse, We have not sent thee as a warder over them. Thine is  only to convey (the message). And lo! when We cause man to taste of mercy from Us  he exulteth therefor. And if some evil striketh them because of that which their own  hands have sent before, then lo! man is an ingrate. 
42|49|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He  createth what He will. He bestoweth female (offspring) upon whom He will, and  bestoweth male (offspring) upon whom He will; 
42|50|ash-Shura: The Counsel|Or He mingleth them, males and females, and He maketh barren whom He  will. Lo! He is Knower, Powerful. 
42|51|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And it was not (vouchsafed) to any mortal that Allah should speak to him  unless (it be) by revelation or from behind a veil, or (that) He sendeth a messenger to  reveal what He will by His leave. Lo! He is Exalted, Wise. 
42|52|ash-Shura: The Counsel|And thus have We inspired in thee (Muhammad) a Spirit of Our command.  Thou knewest not what the Scripture was, nor what the Faith. But We have made it a  light whereby We guide whom We will of Our bondmen. And lo! thou verily dost  guide unto a right path, 
42|53|ash-Shura: The Counsel|The path of Allah, unto Whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and  whatsoever is in the earth. Do not all things reach Allah at last ? 
43|1|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Ha. Mim. 
43|2|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|By the Scripture which maketh plain, 
43|3|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Lo! We have appointed it a Lecture, in Arabic that haply ye may understand. 
43|4|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And Lo! in the Source of Decrees, which We possess, it is indeed sublime,  decisive. 
43|5|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Shall We utterly ignore you because ye are a wanton folk ? 
43|6|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|How many a prophet did We send among the men of old! 
43|7|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And never came there unto them a prophet but they used to mock him. 
43|8|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Then We destroyed men mightier than these in prowess; and the example of  the men of old hath gone (before them). 
43|9|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And if thou (Muhammad) ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth,  they will surely answer: The Mighty, the Knower created them; 
43|10|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Who made the earth a resting-place for you, and placed roads for you therein,  that haply ye may find your way; 
43|11|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And Who sendeth down water from the sky in (due) measure, and We revive  a dead land therewith. Even so will ye be brought forth; 
43|12|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|He Who created all the pairs, and appointed for you ships and cattle  whereupon ye ride. 
43|13|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|That ye may mount upon their backs, and may remember your Lord's favour  when ye mount thereon, and may say: Glorified be He Who hath subdued these unto  us, and we were not capable (of subduing them); 
43|14|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And lo! unto our Lord we surely are returning. 
43|15|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And they allot to Him a portion of His bondmen! Lo! man is verily a mere  ingrate. 
43|16|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Or chooseth He daughters of all that He hath created, and honoureth He you  with sons ? 
43|17|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And if one of them hath tidings of that which he likeneth to the Beneficent  One, his countenance becometh black and he is full of inward rage. 
43|18|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|(Liken they then to Allah) that which is bred up in outward show, and in  dispute cannot make itself plain ? 
43|19|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent, females. Did  they witness their creation ? Their testimony will be recorded and they will be  questioned. 
43|20|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should not have  worshipped them. They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do but guess. 
43|21|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Or have We given them any scripture before (this Qur'an) so that they are  holding fast thereto ? 
43|22|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Nay, for they say only: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we  are guided by their footprints. 
43|23|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any  township but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion,  and we are following their footprints. 
43|24|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|(And the warner) said: What! Even though I bring you better guidance than  that ye found your fathers following ? They answered: Lo! in what ye bring we are  disbelievers. 
43|25|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|So We requited them. Then see the nature of the consequence for the  rejecters! 
43|26|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am innocent of  what ye worship 
43|27|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Save Him Who did create me, for He will surely guide me. 
43|28|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And he made it a word enduring among his seed, that haply they might  return. 
43|29|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Nay, but I let these and their fathers enjoy life (only) till there should come  unto them the Truth and a messenger making plain. 
43|30|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And now that the Truth hath come unto them they say: This is mere magic,  and lo! we are disbelievers therein. 
43|31|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And they say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great man of the  two towns ? 
43|32|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Is it they who apportion thy Lord's mercy ? We have apportioned among  them their livelihood in the life of the world, and raised some of them above others in  rank that some of them may take labour from others; and the mercy of thy Lord is  better than (the wealth) that they amass. 
43|33|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And were it not that mankind would have become one community, We might  well have appointed, for those who disbelieve in the Beneficent, roofs of silver for  their houses and stairs (of silver) whereby to mount, 
43|34|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And for their houses doors (of silver) and couches of silver whereon to  recline, 
43|35|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And ornaments of gold. Yet all that would have been but a provision of the  life of the world. And the Hereafter with your Lord would have been for those who  keep from evil. 
43|36|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And he whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Beneficent, We assign  unto him a devil who becometh his comrade; 
43|37|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And lo! they surely turn them from the way of Allah, and yet they deem that  they are rightly guided; 
43|38|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Till, when he cometh unto Us, he saith (unto his comrade): Ah, would that  between me and thee there were the distance of the two horizons - an evil comrade! 
43|39|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And it profiteth you not this day, because ye did wrong, that ye will be  sharers in the doom. 
43|40|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Canst thou (Muhammad) make the deaf to hear, or canst thou guide the blind  or him who is in error manifest ? 
43|41|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And if We take thee away, We surely shall take vengeance on them, 
43|42|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Or (if) We show thee that wherewith We threaten them; for lo! We have  complete command of them. 
43|43|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|So hold thou fast to that which is inspired in thee. Lo! thou art on a right  path. 
43|44|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And lo! it is in truth a Reminder for thee and for thy folk; and ye will be  questioned. 
43|45|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before thee: Did We ever  appoint gods to be worshipped beside the Beneficent ? 
43|46|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and his chiefs,  and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds. 
43|47|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|But when he brought them Our tokens, behold! they laughed at them. 
43|48|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And every token that We showed them was greater than its sister (token),  and We grasped them with the torment, that haply they might turn again. 
43|49|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And they said: O wizard! Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that He hath  made with thee. Lo! we verily will walk aright. 
43|50|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|But when We eased them of the torment, behold! they broke their word. 
43|51|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people saying: O  my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me ?  Can ye not then discern ? 
43|52|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable and can hardly make  (his meaning) plain! 
43|53|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Why, then, have armlets of gold not been set upon him, or angels sent along  with him ? 
43|54|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed  him. Lo! they were a wanton folk. 
43|55|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|So, when they angered Us, We punished them and drowned them every one. 
43|56|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And We made them a thing past, and an example for those after (them). 
43|57|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example, behold! the folk laugh  out, 
43|58|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And say: Are our gods better, or is he ? They raise not the objection save for  argument. Nay! but they are a contentious folk. 
43|59|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|He is nothing but a slave on whom We bestowed favour, and We made him a  pattern for the Children of Israel. 
43|60|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And had We willed We could have set among you angels to be viceroys in  the earth. 
43|61|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And lo! verily there is knowledge of the Hour. So doubt ye not concerning it,  but follow Me. This is the right path. 
43|62|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And let not Satan turn you aside. Lo! he is an open enemy for you. 
43|63|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|When Jesus came with clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), he said: I have  come unto you with wisdom, and to make plain some of that concerning which ye  differ. So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me. 
43|64|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Lo! Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a right  path. 
43|65|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|But the factions among them differed. Then woe unto those who do wrong  from the doom of a painful day. 
43|66|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly,  when they know not ? 
43|67|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Friends on that day will be foes one to another, save those who kept their  duty (to Allah). 
43|68|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|O My slaves! For you there is no fear this day, nor is it ye who grieve; 
43|69|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|(Ye) who believed Our revelations and were self-surrendered, 
43|70|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Enter the Garden, ye and your wives, to be made glad. 
43|71|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Therein are brought round for them trays of gold and goblets, and therein is  all that souls desire and eyes find sweet. And ye are immortal therein. 
43|72|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|This is the Garden which ye are made to inherit because of what ye used to  do. 
43|73|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Therein for you is fruit in plenty whence to eat. 
43|74|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Lo! the guilty are immortal in hell's torment. 
43|75|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein. 
43|76|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong. 
43|77|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us. He saith: Lo! here  ye must remain. 
43|78|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|We verily brought the Truth unto you, but ye were, most of you, averse to  the Truth. 
43|79|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Or do they determine any thing (against the Prophet) ? Lo! We (also) are  determining. 
43|80|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Or deem they that We cannot hear their secret thoughts and private  confidences ? Nay, but Our envoys, present with them, do record. 
43|81|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Say (O Muhammad): If the Beneficent One hath a son, then, I shall be first  among the worshippers. (But there is no son). 
43|82|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne,  from that which they ascribe (unto Him)! 
43|83|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|So let them flounder (in their talk) and play until they meet the Day which  they are promised. 
43|84|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And He it is Who in the heaven is God, and in the earth God. He is the Wise,  the Knower. 
43|85|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And blessed be He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and  the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom is knowledge of the Hour, and  unto Whom ye will be returned. 
43|86|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And those unto whom they cry instead of Him possess no power of  intercession, saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth knowingly. 
43|87|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And if thou ask them who created them, they will surely say: Allah. How  then are they turned away ? 
43|88|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! these are a folk who believe not. 
43|89|az-Zukhruf: The Embellishment|Then bear with them (O Muhammad) and say: Peace. But they will come to  know. 
44|1|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Ha. Mim. 
44|2|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|By the Scripture that maketh plain 
44|3|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lo! We revealed it on a blessed night - Lo! We are ever warning - 
44|4|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Whereon every wise command is made clear 
44|5|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|As a command from Our presence - Lo! We are ever sending - 
44|6|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|A mercy from thy Lord. Lo! He, even He is the Hearer, the Knower, 
44|7|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye would  be sure. 
44|8|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|There is no God save Him. He quickeneth and giveth death; your Lord and  Lord of your forefathers. 
44|9|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Nay, but they play in doubt. 
44|10|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|But watch thou (O Muhammad) for the day when the sky will produce  visible smoke 
44|11|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|That will envelop the people. This will be a painful torment. 
44|12|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|(Then they will say): Our Lord relieve us of the torment. Lo! we are  believers. 
44|13|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|How can there be remembrance for them, when a messenger making plain  (the Truth) had already come unto them, 
44|14|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And they had turned away from him and said: One taught (by others), a  madman ? 
44|15|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lo! We withdraw the torment a little. Lo! ye return (to disbelief). 
44|16|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|On the day when We shall seize them with the greater seizure, (then) in truth  We shall punish. 
44|17|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And verily We tried before them Pharaoh's folk, when there came unto them  a noble messenger, 
44|18|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Saying: Give up to me the slaves of Allah. Lo! I am a faithful messenger  unto you. 
44|19|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And saying: Be not proud against Allah. Lo! I bring you a clear warrant. 
44|20|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And lo! I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord lest ye stone me to  death. 
44|21|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And if ye put no faith in me, then let me go. 
44|22|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And he cried unto his Lord, (saying): These are guilty folk. 
44|23|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Then (his Lord commanded): Take away My slaves by night. Lo! ye will be  followed, 
44|24|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And leave the sea behind at rest, for lo! they are a drowned host. 
44|25|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|How many were the gardens and the watersprings that they left behind, 
44|26|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And the cornlands and the goodly sites 
44|27|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And pleasant things wherein they took delight! 
44|28|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Even so (it was), and We made it an inheritance for other folk; 
44|29|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And the heaven and the earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved. 
44|30|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And We delivered the Children of Israel from the shameful doom; 
44|31|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|(We delivered them) from Pharaoh. Lo! he was a tyrant of the wanton ones. 
44|32|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And We chose them, purposely, above (all) creatures. 
44|33|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And We gave them portents wherein was a clear trial. 
44|34|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lo! these, forsooth, are saying: 
44|35|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|There is naught but our first death, and we shall not be raised again. 
44|36|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Bring back our fathers, if ye speak the truth! 
44|37|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Are they better, or the folk of Tubb'a and those before them ? We destroyed  them, for surely they were guilty. 
44|38|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|And We created not the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them,  in play. 
44|39|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|We created them not save with truth; but most of them know not. 
44|40|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Assuredly the Day of Decision is the term for all of them, 
44|41|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|A day when friend can in naught avail friend, nor can they be helped, 
44|42|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Save him on whom Allah hath mercy. Lo! He is the Mighty, the Merciful. 
44|43|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lo! the tree of Zaqqum, 
44|44|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|The food of the sinner! 
44|45|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Like molten brass, it seetheth in their bellies 
44|46|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|As the seething of boiling water. 
44|47|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|(And it will be said): Take him and drag him to the midst of hell, 
44|48|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Then pour upon his head the torment of boiling water.

44|50|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lo! this is that whereof ye used to doubt. 
44|51|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Lo! those who kept their duty will be in a place secured. 
44|52|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|Amid gardens and watersprings,

44|55|ad-Dukhan: The Evident Smoke|They call therein for every fruit in safety.
