45|1|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Ha. Mim. 
45|2|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise. 
45|3|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Lo! in the heavens and the earth are portents for believers. 
45|4|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And in your creation, and all the beasts that He scattereth in the earth, are  portents for a folk whose faith is sure. 
45|5|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And the difference of night and day and the provision that Allah sendeth  down from the sky and thereby quickeneth the earth after her death, and the ordering  of the winds, are portents for a people who have sense. 
45|6|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|These are the portents of Allah which We recite unto thee (Muhammad) with  truth. Then in what fact, after Allah and His portents, will they believe ? 
45|7|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Woe unto each sinful liar, 
45|8|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Who heareth the revelations of Allah recited unto him, and then continueth in  pride as though he heard them not. Give him tidings of a painful doom. 
45|9|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And when he knoweth aught of Our revelations he maketh it a jest. For such  there is a shameful doom. 
45|10|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Beyond them there is hell, and that which they have earned will naught avail  them, nor those whom they have chosen for protecting friends beside Allah. Theirs  will be an awful doom. 
45|11|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|This is guidance. And those who disbelieve the revelations of their Lord, for  them there is a painful doom of wrath. 
45|12|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Allah it is Who hath made the sea of service unto you that the ships may run  thereon by His command, and that ye may seek of His bounty, and that haply ye may  be thankful; 
45|13|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And hath made of service unto you whatsoever is in the heavens and  whatsoever is in the earth; it is all from Him. Lo! herein verily are portents for a  people who reflect. 
45|14|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Tell those who believe to forgive those who hope not for the days of Allah;  in order that He may requite folk what they used to earn. 
45|15|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Whoso doeth right, it is for his soul, and whoso doeth wrong, it is against it.  And afterward unto your Lord ye will be brought back. 
45|16|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And verily we gave the Children of Israel the Scripture and the Command  and the Prophethood, and provided them with good things and favoured them above  (all) peoples; 
45|17|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And gave them plain commandments. And they differed not until after the  knowledge came unto them, through rivalry among themselves. Lo! thy Lord will  judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they used to  differ. 
45|18|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And now have We set thee (O Muhammad) on a clear road of (Our)  commandment; so follow it, and follow not the whims of those who know not. 
45|19|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Lo! they can avail thee naught against Allah. And lo! as for the wrong-doers,  some of them are friends of others; and Allah is the Friend of those who ward off  (evil). 
45|20|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|This is clear indication for mankind, and a guidance and a mercy for a folk  whose faith is sure. 
45|21|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Or do those who commit ill-deeds suppose that We shall make them as those  who believe and do good works, the same in life and death ? Bad is their judgment! 
45|22|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And Allah hath created the heavens and the earth with truth, and that every  soul may be repaid what it hath earned. And they will not be wronged. 
45|23|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Hast thou seen him who maketh his desire his god, and Allah sendeth him  astray purposely, and sealeth up his hearing and his heart, and setteth on his sight a  covering ? Then who will lead him after Allah (hath condemned him) ? Will ye not  then heed ? 
45|24|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And they say: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live,  and naught destroyeth us save time; when they have no knowledge whatsoever of (all)  that; they do but guess. 
45|25|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them their only argument is  that they say: Bring (back) our fathers. then, if ye are truthful. 
45|26|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Allah giveth life to you, then causeth you to  die, then gathereth you unto the Day of Resurrection whereof there is no doubt. But  most of mankind know not. 
45|27|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; and  on the day when the Hour riseth, on that day those who follow falsehood will be lost. 
45|28|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And thou wilt see each nation crouching, each nation summoned to its  record. (And it will be said unto them): This day ye are requited what ye used to do. 
45|29|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|This Our Book pronounceth against you with truth. Lo! We have caused (all)  that ye did to be recorded. 
45|30|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Then, as for those who believed and did good works, their Lord will bring  them in unto His mercy. That is the evident triumph. 
45|31|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And as for those who disbelieved (it will be said unto them): Were not Our  revelations recited unto you ? But ye were scornful and became a guilty folk. 
45|32|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And when it was said: Lo! Allah's promise is the truth, and there is no doubt  of the Hour's coming, ye said: We know not what the Hour is. We deem it naught but  a conjecture, and we are by no means convinced. 
45|33|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And the evils of what they did will appear unto them, and that which they  used to deride will befall them. 
45|34|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And it will be said: This day We forget you, even as ye forgot the meeting of  this your day; and your habitation is the Fire, and there is none to help you. 
45|35|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|This, forasmuch as ye made the revelations of Allah a jest, and the life of the  world beguiled you. Therefor this day they come not forth from thence, nor can they  make amends. 
45|36|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|Then praise be to Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, the Lord  of the Worlds. 
45|37|al-Jathiyah: The Kneeling|And unto Him (alone) belongeth Majesty in the heavens and the earth, and  He is the Mighty, the Wise. 
46|1|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Ha. Mim. 
46|2|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah the Mighty, the Wise. 
46|3|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save  with truth, and for a term appointed. But those who disbelieve turn away from that  whereof they are warned. 
46|4|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Have ye thought on all that ye invoke  beside Allah ? Show me what they have created of the earth. Or have they any portion  in the heavens ? Bring me a scripture before this (Scripture), or some vestige of  knowledge (in support of what ye say), if ye are truthful. 
46|5|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And who is further astray than those who, instead of Allah, pray unto such as  hear not their prayer until the Day of Resurrection, and are unconscious of their  prayer, 
46|6|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And when mankind are gathered (to the Judgment) will become enemies for  them, and will become deniers of having been worshipped. 
46|7|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, those who disbelieve  say of the Truth when it reacheth them: This is mere magic. 
46|8|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Or say they: He hath invented it ? Say (O Muhammad): If I have invented it,  still ye have no power to support me against Allah. He is Best Aware of what ye say  among yourselves concerning it. He sufficeth for a witness between me and you. And  He is the Forgiving, the Merciful. 
46|9|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Say: I am no new thing among the messengers (of Allah), nor know I what  will be done with me or with you. I do but follow that which is inspired in me, and I  am but a plain warner. 
46|10|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Bethink you: If it is from Allah and ye disbelieve therein, and a witness of  the Children of Israel hath already testified to the like thereof and hath believed, and  ye are too proud (what plight is yours) ? Lo! Allah guideth not wrong-doing folk. 
46|11|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And those who disbelieve say of those who believe: If it had been (any)  good, they would not have been before us in attaining it. And since they will not be  guided by it, they say: This is an ancient lie; 
46|12|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|When before it there was the Scripture of Moses, an example and a mercy;  and this is a confirming Scripture in the Arabic language, that it may warn those who  do wrong and bring good tidings for the righteous. 
46|13|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Lo! those who say: Our Lord is Allah, and thereafter walk aright, there shall  no fear come upon them neither shall they grieve. 
46|14|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Such are rightful owners of the Garden, immortal therein, as a reward for  what they used to do. 
46|15|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And We have commended unto man kindness toward parents. His mother  beareth him with reluctance, and bringeth him forth with reluctance, and the bearing  of him and the weaning of him is thirty months, till, when he attaineth full strength  and reacheth forty years, he saith: My Lord! Arouse me that I may give thanks for the  favour wherewith Thou hast favoured me and my parents, and that I may do right  acceptable unto Thee. And be gracious unto me in the matter of my seed. Lo! I have  turned unto Thee repentant, and lo! I am of those who surrender (unto Thee). 
46|16|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Those are they from whom We accept the best of what they do, and overlook  their evil deeds. (They are) among the owners of the Garden. This is the true promise  which they were promised (in the world). 
46|17|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And whoso saith unto his parents: Fie upon you both! Do ye threaten me that  I shall be brought forth (again) when generations before me have passed away ? And  they twain cry unto Allah for help (and say): Woe unto thee! Believe! Lo! the promise  of Allah is true. But he saith: This is naught save fables of the men of old: 
46|18|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Such are those on whom the Word concerning nations of the jinn and  mankind which have passed away before them hath effect. Lo! they are the losers. 
46|19|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And for all there will be ranks from what they do, that He may pay them for  their deeds; and they will not be wronged. 
46|20|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And on the day when those who disbelieve are exposed to the Fire (it will be  said): Ye squandered your good things in the life of the world and sought comfort  therein. Now this day ye are rewarded with the doom of ignominy because ye were  disdainful in the land without a right, and because ye used to transgress. 
46|21|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And make mention (O Muhammad) of the brother of A'ad when he warned  his folk among the wind-curved sandhills - and verily warners came and went before  and after him - saying: Serve none but Allah. Lo! I fear for you the doom of a  tremendous Day. 
46|22|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|They said: Hast come to turn us away from our gods ? Then bring upon us  that wherewith thou threatenest us, if thou art of the truthful. 
46|23|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|He said: The knowledge is with Allah only. I convey unto you that  wherewith I have been sent, but I see you are a folk that know not. 
46|24|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Then, when they beheld it as a dense cloud coming toward their valleys, they  said: Here is a cloud bringing us rain. Nay, but it is that which ye did seek to hasten, a  wind wherein is painful torment, 
46|25|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Destroying all things by commandment of its Lord. And morning found them  so that naught could be seen save their dwellings. Thus do We reward the guilty folk. 
46|26|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And verily We had empowered them with that wherewith We have not  empowered you, and had assigned them ears and eyes and hearts; but their ears and  eyes and hearts availed them naught since they denied the revelations of Allah; and  what they used to mock befell them. 
46|27|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And verily We have destroyed townships round about you, and displayed  (for them) Our revelation, that haply they might return. 
46|28|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Then why did those whom they had chosen for gods as a way of approach  (unto Allah) not help them ? Nay, but they did fail them utterly. And (all) that was  their lie, and what they used to invent. 
46|29|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And when We inclined toward thee (Muhammad) certain of the jinn, who  wished to hear the Qur'an and, when they were in its presence, said: Give ear! and,  when it was finished, turned back to their people, warning. 
46|30|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|They said: O our people! Lo! we have heard a scripture which hath been  revealed after Moses, confirming that which was before it, guiding unto the truth and  a right road. 
46|31|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|O our people! respond to Allah's summoner and believe in Him. He will  forgive you some of your sins and guard you from a painful doom. 
46|32|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And whoso respondeth not to Allah's summoner he can nowise escape in the  earth, and he hath no protecting friends instead of Him. Such are in error manifest. 
46|33|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Have they not seen that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and  was not wearied by their creation, is Able to give life to the dead ? Aye, He verily is  Able to do all things. 
46|34|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|And on the day when those who disbelieve are exposed to the Fire (they will  be asked): Is not this real ? They will say: Yea, by our Lord. He will say: Then taste  the doom for that ye disbelieved. 
46|35|al-Ahqaf: The Sandhills|Then have patience (O Muhammad) even as the stout of heart among the  messengers (of old) had patience, and seek not to hasten on (the doom) for them. On  the day when they see that which they are promised (it will seem to them) as though  they had tarried but an hour of daylight. A clear message. Shall any be destroyed save  evil-living folk ? 
47|1|Muhammad: Muhammad|Those who disbelieve and turn (men) from the way of Allah, He rendereth  their actions vain. 
47|2|Muhammad: Muhammad|And those who believe and do good works and believe in that which is  revealed unto Muhammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He riddeth them of  their ill-deeds and improveth their state. 
47|3|Muhammad: Muhammad|That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood and because those  who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus Allah coineth their similitudes for  mankind. 
47|4|Muhammad: Muhammad|Now when ye meet in battle those who disbelieve, then it is smiting of the  necks until, when ye have routed them, then making fast of bonds; and afterward  either grace or ransom till the war lay down its burdens. That (is the ordinance). And  if Allah willed He could have punished them (without you) but (thus it is ordained)  that He may try some of you by means of others. And those who are slain in the way  of Allah, He rendereth not their actions vain. 
47|5|Muhammad: Muhammad|He will guide them and improve their state, 
47|6|Muhammad: Muhammad|And bring them in unto the Garden which He hath made known to them. 
47|7|Muhammad: Muhammad|O ye who believe! If ye help Allah, He will help you and will make your  foothold firm. 
47|8|Muhammad: Muhammad|And those who disbelieve, perdition is for them, and He will make their  actions vain. 
47|9|Muhammad: Muhammad|That is because they are averse to that which Allah hath revealed, therefor  maketh He their actions fruitless. 
47|10|Muhammad: Muhammad|Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for  those who were before them ? Allah wiped them out. And for the disbelievers there  will be the like thereof. 
47|11|Muhammad: Muhammad|That is because Allah is patron of those who believe, and because the  disbelievers have no patron. 
47|12|Muhammad: Muhammad|Lo! Allah will cause those who believe and do good works to enter Gardens  underneath which rivers flow; while those who disbelieve take their comfort in this  life and eat even as the cattle eat, and the Fire is their habitation. 
47|13|Muhammad: Muhammad|And how many a township stronger than thy township (O Muhammad)  which hath cast thee out, have We destroyed, and they had no helper! 
47|14|Muhammad: Muhammad|Is he who relieth on a clear proof from his Lord like those for whom the evil  that they do is beautified while they follow their own lusts ? 
47|15|Muhammad: Muhammad|A similitude of the Garden which those who keep their duty (to Allah) are  promised: Therein are rivers of water unpolluted, and rivers of milk whereof the  flavour changeth not, and rivers of wine delicious to the drinkers, and rivers of clear- run honey; therein for them is every kind of fruit, with pardon from their Lord. (Are  those who enjoy all this) like those who are immortal in the Fire and are given boiling  water to drink so that it teareth their bowels ? 
47|16|Muhammad: Muhammad|Among them are some who give ear unto thee (Muhammad) till, when they  go forth from thy presence they say unto those who have been given knowledge:  What was that he said just now ? Those are they whose hearts Allah hath sealed, and  they follow their own lusts. 
47|17|Muhammad: Muhammad|While as for those who walk aright, He addeth to their guidance, and giveth  them their protection (against evil). 
47|18|Muhammad: Muhammad|Await they aught save the Hour, that it should come upon them unawares ?  And the beginnings thereof have already come. But how, when it hath come upon  them, can they take their warning ? 
47|19|Muhammad: Muhammad|So know (O Muhammad) that there is no God save Allah, and ask  forgiveness for thy sin and for believing men and believing women. Allah knoweth  (both) your place of turmoil and your place of rest. 
47|20|Muhammad: Muhammad|And those who believe say: If only a surah were revealed! But when a  decisive surah is revealed and war is mentioned therein, thou seest those in whose  hearts is a disease looking at thee with the look of men fainting unto death. Therefor  woe unto them! 
47|21|Muhammad: Muhammad|Obedience and a civil word. Then, when the matter is determined, if they are  loyal to Allah it will be well for them. 
47|22|Muhammad: Muhammad|Would ye then, if ye were given the command, work corruption in the land  and sever your ties of kinship ? 
47|23|Muhammad: Muhammad|Such are they whom Allah curseth so that He deafeneth them and maketh  blind their eyes. 
47|24|Muhammad: Muhammad|Will they then not meditate on the Qur'an, or are there locks on the hearts ? 
47|25|Muhammad: Muhammad|Lo! those who turn back after the guidance hath been manifested unto them,  Satan hath seduced them, and He giveth them the rein. 
47|26|Muhammad: Muhammad|That is because they say unto those who hate what Allah hath revealed: We  will obey you in some matters; and Allah knoweth their secret talk. 
47|27|Muhammad: Muhammad|Then how (will it be with them) when the angels gather them, smiting their  faces and their backs! 
47|28|Muhammad: Muhammad|That will be because they followed that which angereth Allah, and hated that  which pleaseth Him. Therefor He hath made their actions vain. 
47|29|Muhammad: Muhammad|Or do those in whose hearts is a disease deem that Allah will not bring to  light their (secret) hates ? 
47|30|Muhammad: Muhammad|And if We would, We could show them unto thee (Muhammad) so that thou  shouldst know them surely by their marks. And thou shalt know them by the burden  of their talk. And Allah knoweth your deeds. 
47|31|Muhammad: Muhammad|And verily We shall try you till We know those of you who strive hard (for  the cause of Allah) and the steadfast, and till We test your record. 
47|32|Muhammad: Muhammad|Lo! those who disbelieve and turn from the way of Allah and oppose the  messenger after the guidance hath been manifested unto them, they hurt Allah not a  jot, and He will make their actions fruitless. 
47|33|Muhammad: Muhammad|O ye who believe! Obey Allah and obey the messenger, and render not your  actions vain. 
47|34|Muhammad: Muhammad|Lo! those who disbelieve and turn from the way of Allah and then die  disbelievers, Allah surely will not pardon them. 
47|35|Muhammad: Muhammad|So do not falter and cry out for peace when ye (will be) the uppermost, and  Allah is with you, and He will not grudge (the reward of) your actions. 
47|36|Muhammad: Muhammad|The life of the world is but a sport and a pastime. And if ye believe and ward  off (evil). He will give you your wages, and will not ask of you your wordly wealth. 
47|37|Muhammad: Muhammad|If He should ask it of you and importune you, ye would hoard it, and He  would bring to light your (secret) hates. 
47|38|Muhammad: Muhammad|Lo! ye are those who are called to spend in the way of Allah, yet among you  there are some who hoard. And as for him who hoardeth, he hoardeth only from his  soul. And Allah is the Rich, and ye are the poor. And if ye turn away He will  exchange you for some other folk, and they will not be the likes of you. 
48|1|al-Fath: The Victory|Lo! We have given thee (O Muhammad) a signal victory, 
48|2|al-Fath: The Victory|That Allah may forgive thee of thy sin that which is past and that which is to  come, and may perfect His favour unto thee, and may guide thee on a right path, 
48|3|al-Fath: The Victory|And that Allah may help thee with strong help - 
48|4|al-Fath: The Victory|He it is Who sent down peace of reassurance into the hearts of the believers  that they might add faith unto their faith. Allah's are the hosts of the heavens and the  earth, and Allah is ever Knower, Wise - 
48|5|al-Fath: The Victory|That He may bring the believing men and the believing women into Gardens  underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide, and may remit from them their  evil deeds -  That, in the sight of Allah, is the supreme triumph - 
48|6|al-Fath: The Victory|And may punish the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women, and the  idolatrous men and the idolatrous women, who think an evil thought concerning  Allah. For them is the evil turn of fortune, and Allah is wroth against them and hath  cursed them, and hath made ready for them hell, a hapless journey's end. 
48|7|al-Fath: The Victory|Allah's are the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is ever Mighty,  Wise. 
48|8|al-Fath: The Victory|Lo! We have sent thee (O Muhammad) as a witness and a bearer of good  tidings and a warner, 
48|9|al-Fath: The Victory|That ye (mankind) may believe in Allah and His messenger, and may honour  Him, and may revere Him, and may glorify Him at early dawn and at the close of day. 
48|10|al-Fath: The Victory|Lo! those who swear allegiance unto thee (Muhammad), swear allegiance  only unto Allah. The Hand of Allah is above their hands. So whosoever breaketh his  oath, breaketh it only to his soul's hurt; while whosoever keepeth his covenant with  Allah, on him will He bestow immense reward. 
48|11|al-Fath: The Victory|Those of the wandering Arabs who were left behind will tell thee: Our  possessions and our households occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us! They speak  with their tongues that which is not in their hearts. Say: Who can avail you aught  against Allah, if He intend you hurt or intend you profit ? Nay, but Allah is ever  Aware of what ye do. 
48|12|al-Fath: The Victory|Nay, but ye deemed that the messenger and the believers would never return  to their own folk, and that was made fairseeming in your hearts, and ye did think an  evil thought, and ye were worthless folk. 
48|13|al-Fath: The Victory|And so for him who believeth not in Allah and His messenger - Lo! We have  prepared a flame for disbelievers. 
48|14|al-Fath: The Victory|And Allah's is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He forgiveth  whom He will, and punisheth whom He will. And Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful. 
48|15|al-Fath: The Victory|Those who were left behind will say, when ye set forth to capture booty: Let  us go with you. They fain would change the verdict of Allah. Say (unto them, O  Muhammad): Ye shall not go with us. Thus hath Allah said beforehand. Then they  will say: Ye are envious of us. Nay, but they understand not, save a little. 
48|16|al-Fath: The Victory|Say unto those of the wandering Arabs who were left behind: Ye will be  called against a folk of mighty prowess, to fight them until they surrender; and if ye  obey, Allah will give you a fair reward; but if ye turn away as ye did turn away  before, He will punish you with a painful doom. 
48|17|al-Fath: The Victory|There is no blame for the blind, nor is there blame for the lame, nor is there  blame for the sick (that they go not forth to war). And whoso obeyeth Allah and His  messenger, He will make him enter Gardens underneath which rivers flow; and  whoso turneth back, him will He punish with a painful doom. 
48|18|al-Fath: The Victory|Allah was well pleased with the believers when they swore allegiance unto  thee beneath the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, and He sent down peace  of reassurance on them, and hath rewarded them with a near victory; 
48|19|al-Fath: The Victory|And much booty that they will capture. Allah is ever Mighty, Wise. 
48|20|al-Fath: The Victory|Allah promiseth you much booty that ye will capture, and hath given you this  in advance, and hath withheld men's hands from you, that it may be a token for the  believers, and that He may guide you on a right path. 
48|21|al-Fath: The Victory|And other (gain), which ye have not been able to achieve, Allah will  compass it, Allah is Able to do all things. 
48|22|al-Fath: The Victory|And if those who disbelieve join battle with you they will take to flight, and  afterward they will find no protecting friend nor helper. 
48|23|al-Fath: The Victory|It is the law of Allah which hath taken course aforetime. Thou wilt not find  for the law of Allah aught of power to change. 
48|24|al-Fath: The Victory|And He it is Who hath withheld men's hands from you, and hath withheld  your hands from them, in the valley of Mecca, after He had made you victors over  them. Allah is Seer of what ye do. 
48|25|al-Fath: The Victory|These it was who disbelieved and debarred you from the Inviolable Place of  Worship, and debarred the offering from reaching its goal. And if it had not been for  believing men and believing women, whom ye know not - lest ye should tread them  under foot and thus incur guilt for them unknowingly; that Allah might bring into His  mercy whom He will - If (the believers and the disbelievers) had been clearly  separated We verily had punished those of them who disbelieved with painful  punishment. 
48|26|al-Fath: The Victory|When those who disbelieve had set up in their hearts zealotry, the zealotry of  the Age of Ignorance, then Allah sent down His peace of reassurance upon His  messenger and upon the believers and imposed on them the word of self-restraint, for  they were worthy of it and meet for it. And Allah is Aware of all things. 
48|27|al-Fath: The Victory|Allah hath fulfilled the vision for His messenger in very truth. Ye shall  indeed enter the Inviolable Place of Worship, if Allah will, secure, (having your hair)  shaven and cut, not fearing. But He knoweth that which ye know not, and hath given  you a near victory beforehand. 
48|28|al-Fath: The Victory|He it is Who hath sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of  truth, that He may cause it to prevail over all religion. And Allah sufficeth as a  Witness. 
48|29|al-Fath: The Victory|Muhammad is the messenger of Allah. And those with him are hard against  the disbelievers and merciful among themselves. Thou (O Muhammad) seest them  bowing and falling prostrate (in worship), seeking bounty from Allah and (His)  acceptance. The mark of them is on their foreheads from the traces of prostration.  Such is their likeness in the Torah and their likeness in the Gospel - like as sown corn  that sendeth forth its shoot and strengtheneth it and riseth firm upon its stalk,  delighting the sowers - that He may enrage the disbelievers with (the sight of) them.  Allah hath promised, unto such of them as believe and do good works, forgiveness  and immense reward. 
49|1|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|O ye who believe! Be not forward in the presence of Allah and His  messenger, and keep your duty to Allah. Lo! Allah is Hearer, Knower. 
49|2|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|O ye who believe! Lift not up your voices above the voice of the Prophet,  nor shout when speaking to him as ye shout one to another, lest your works be  rendered vain while ye perceive not. 
49|3|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|Lo! they who subdue their voices in the presence of the messenger of Allah,  those are they whose hearts Allah hath proven unto righteousness. Theirs will be  forgiveness and immense reward. 
49|4|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|Lo! those who call thee from behind the private apartments, most of them  have no sense. 
49|5|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|And if they had had patience till thou camest forth unto them, it had been  better for them. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
49|6|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|O ye who believe! If an evil-liver bring you tidings, verify it, lest ye smite  some folk in ignorance and afterward repent of what ye did. 
49|7|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|And know that the messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to obey you  in much of the government, ye would surely be in trouble; but Allah hath endeared  the faith to you and hath beautified it in your hearts, and hath made disbelief and  lewdness and rebellion hateful unto you. Such are they who are the rightly guided. 
49|8|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|(It is) a bounty and a grace from Allah; and Allah is Knower, Wise. 
49|9|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|And if two parties of believers fall to fighting, then make peace between  them. And if one party of them doeth wrong to the other, fight ye that which doeth  wrong till it return unto the ordinance of Allah; then, if it return, make peace between  them justly, and act equitably. Lo! Allah loveth the equitable. 
49|10|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|The believers are naught else than brothers. Therefore make peace between  your brethren and observe your duty to Allah that haply ye may obtain mercy. 
49|11|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|O ye who believe! Let not a folk deride a folk who may be better than they  (are), not let women (deride) women who may be better than they are; neither defame  one another, nor insult one another by nicknames. Bad is the name of lewdness after  faith. And whoso turneth not in repentance, such are evil-doers. 
49|12|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|O ye who believe! Shun much suspicion; for lo! some suspicion is a crime.  And spy not, neither backbite one another. Would one of you love to eat the flesh of  his dead brother ? Ye abhor that (so abhor the other)! And keep your duty (to Allah).  Lo! Allah is Relenting, Merciful. 
49|13|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|O mankind! Lo! We have created you male and female, and have made you  nations and tribes that ye may know one another. Lo! the noblest of you, in the sight  of Allah, is the best in conduct. Lo! Allah is Knower, Aware. 
49|14|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|The wandering Arabs say: We believe. Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Ye  believe not, but rather say "We submit," for the faith hath not yet entered into your  hearts. Yet, if ye obey Allah and His messenger, He will not withhold from you aught  of (the reward of) your deeds. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
49|15|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|The (true) believers are those only who believe in Allah and His messenger  and afterward doubt not, but strive with their wealth and their lives for the cause of  Allah. Such are the sincere. 
49|16|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Would ye teach Allah your religion, when  Allah knoweth all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and Allah is Aware  of all things ? 
49|17|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|They make it a favour unto thee (Muhammad) that they have surrendered  (unto Him). Say: Deem not your Surrender a favour unto me; but Allah doth confer a  favour on you, inasmuch as He hath led you to the Faith, if ye are earnest. 
49|18|al-Hujurat: The Chambers|Lo! Allah knoweth the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is  Seer of what ye do. 
50|1|Qaf: Qaf|Qaf. By the Glorious Qur'an, 
50|2|Qaf: Qaf|Nay, but they marvel that a warner of their own hath come unto them; and  the disbelievers say: This is a strange thing: 
50|3|Qaf: Qaf|When we are dead and have become dust (shall we be brought back again) ?  That would be a far return! 
50|4|Qaf: Qaf|We know that which the earth taketh of them, and with Us is a recording  Book. 
50|5|Qaf: Qaf|Nay, but they have denied the truth when it came unto them, therefor they  are now in troubled case. 
50|6|Qaf: Qaf|Have they not then observed the sky above them, how We have constructed  it and beautified it, and how there are no rifts therein ? 
50|7|Qaf: Qaf|And the earth have We spread out, and have flung firm hills therein, and  have caused of every lovely kind to grow thereon, 
50|8|Qaf: Qaf|A vision and a reminder for every penitent slave. 
50|9|Qaf: Qaf|And We send down from the sky blessed water whereby We give growth  unto gardens and the grain of crops, 
50|10|Qaf: Qaf|And lofty date-palms with ranged clusters, 
50|11|Qaf: Qaf|Provision (made) for men; and therewith We quicken a dead land. Even so  will be the resurrection of the dead. 
50|12|Qaf: Qaf|The folk of Noah denied (the truth) before them, and (so did) the dwellers at  Ar-Rass and (the tribe of) Thamud, 
50|13|Qaf: Qaf|And (the tribe of) A'ad, and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot, 
50|14|Qaf: Qaf|And the dwellers in the wood, and the folk of Tubb'a: every one denied their  messengers, therefor My threat took effect. 
50|15|Qaf: Qaf|Were We then worn out by the first creation ? Yet they are in doubt about a  new creation. 
50|16|Qaf: Qaf|We verily created man and We know what his soul whispereth to him, and  We are nearer to him than his jugular vein. 
50|17|Qaf: Qaf|When the two Receivers receive (him), seated on the right hand and on the  left, 
50|18|Qaf: Qaf|He uttereth no word but there is with him an observer ready. 
50|19|Qaf: Qaf|And the agony of death cometh in truth. (And it is said unto him): This is that  which thou wast wont to shun. 
50|20|Qaf: Qaf|And the trumpet is blown. This is the threatened Day. 
50|21|Qaf: Qaf|And every soul cometh, along with it a driver and a witness. 
50|22|Qaf: Qaf|(And unto the evil-doer it is said): Thou wast in heedlessness of this. Now  We have removed from thee thy covering, and piercing is thy sight this day. 
50|23|Qaf: Qaf|And (unto the evil-doer) his comrade saith: This is that which I have ready  (as testimony). 
50|24|Qaf: Qaf|(And it is said): Do ye twain hurl to hell each rebel ingrate, 
50|25|Qaf: Qaf|Hinderer of good, transgressor, doubter, 
50|26|Qaf: Qaf|Who setteth up another god along with Allah. Do ye twain hurl him to the  dreadful doom. 
50|27|Qaf: Qaf|His comrade saith: Our Lord! I did not cause him to rebel, but he was  (himself) far gone in error. 
50|28|Qaf: Qaf|He saith: Contend not in My presence, when I had already proffered unto  you the warning. 
50|29|Qaf: Qaf|The sentence that cometh from Me cannot be changed, and I am in no wise a  tyrant unto the slaves. 
50|30|Qaf: Qaf|On the day when We say unto hell: Art thou filled ? and it saith: Can there be  more to come ? 
50|31|Qaf: Qaf|And the Garden is brought nigh for those who kept from evil, no longer  distant. 
50|32|Qaf: Qaf|(And it is said): This is that which ye were promised.  (It is) for every  penitent and heedful one, 
50|33|Qaf: Qaf|Who feareth the Beneficent in secret and cometh with a contrite heart. 
50|34|Qaf: Qaf|Enter it in peace. This is the day of immortality. 
50|35|Qaf: Qaf|There they have all that they desire, and there is more with Us. 
50|36|Qaf: Qaf|And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were mightier  than these in prowess so that they overran the lands! Had they any place of refuge  (when the judgment came) ? 
50|37|Qaf: Qaf|Lo! therein verily is a reminder for him who hath a heart, or giveth ear with  full intelligence. 
50|38|Qaf: Qaf|And verily We created the heavens and the earth, and all that is between  them, in six Days, and naught of weariness touched Us. 
50|39|Qaf: Qaf|Therefor (O Muhammad) bear with what they say, and hymn the praise of  thy Lord before the rising and before the setting of the sun; 
50|40|Qaf: Qaf|And in the night-time hymn His praise, and after the (prescribed)  prostrations. 
50|41|Qaf: Qaf|And listen on the day when the crier crieth from a near place, 
50|42|Qaf: Qaf|The day when they will hear the (Awful) Cry in truth. That is the day of  coming forth (from the graves). 
50|43|Qaf: Qaf|Lo! We it is Who quicken and give death, and unto Us is the journeying. 
50|44|Qaf: Qaf|On the day when the earth splitteth asunder from them, hastening forth (they  come). That is a gathering easy for Us (to make). 
50|45|Qaf: Qaf|We are Best Aware of what they say, and thou (O Muhammad) art in no wise  a compeller over them. But warn by the Qur'an him who feareth My threat. 
51|1|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|By those that winnow with a winnowing 
51|2|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And those that bear the burden (of the rain) 
51|3|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And those that glide with ease (upon the sea) 
51|4|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And those who distribute (blessings) by command, 
51|5|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Lo! that wherewith ye are threatened is indeed true, 
51|6|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And lo! the judgment will indeed befall. 
51|7|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|By the heaven full of paths, 
51|8|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Lo! ye, forsooth, are of various opinion (concerning the truth). 
51|9|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|He is made to turn away from it who is (himself) averse. 
51|10|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Accursed be the conjecturers 
51|11|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Who are careless in an abyss! 
51|12|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|They ask: When is the Day of Judgment ? 
51|13|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|(It is) the day when they will be tormented at the Fire, 
51|14|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|(And it will be said unto them): Taste your torment (which ye inflicted). This  is what ye sought to hasten. 
51|15|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Lo! those who keep from evil will dwell amid gardens and watersprings, 
51|16|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Taking that which their Lord giveth them; for lo! aforetime they were doers  of good; 
51|17|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|They used to sleep but little of the night, 
51|18|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And ere the dawning of each day would seek forgiveness, 
51|19|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And in their wealth the beggar and the outcast had due share. 
51|20|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And in the earth are portents for those whose faith is sure. 
51|21|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And (also) in yourselves. Can ye then not see ? 
51|22|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And in the heaven is your providence and that which ye are promised; 
51|23|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, it is the truth, even as (it is  true) that ye speak. 
51|24|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Hath the story of Abraham's honoured guests reached thee (O Muhammad) ? 
51|25|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|When they came in unto him and said: Peace! he answered, Peace! (and  thought): Folk unknown (to me). 
51|26|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Then he went apart unto his housefolk so that they brought a fatted calf; 
51|27|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And he set it before them, saying: Will ye not eat ? 
51|28|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Then he conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! and gave him tidings  of (the birth of) a wise son. 
51|29|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Then his wife came forward, making moan, and smote her face, and cried: A  barren old woman! 
51|30|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|They said: Even so saith thy Lord. Lo! He is the Wise, the Knower. 
51|31|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|(Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand, O ye sent (from Allah)  ? 
51|32|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|They said: Lo! we are sent unto a guilty folk, 
51|33|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|That we may send upon them stones of clay, 
51|34|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Marked by thy Lord for (the destruction of) the wanton. 
51|35|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Then we brought forth such believers as were there. 
51|36|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|But We found there but one house of those surrendered (to Allah). 
51|37|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And We left behind therein a portent for those who fear a painful doom. 
51|38|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And in Moses (too, there is a portent) when We sent him unto Pharaoh with  clear warrant, 
51|39|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|But he withdrew (confiding) in his might, and said: A wizard or a madman. 
51|40|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|So We seized him and his hosts and flung them in the sea, for he was  reprobate. 
51|41|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And in (the tribe of) A'ad (there is a portent) when we sent the fatal wind  against them. 
51|42|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|It spared naught that it reached, but made it (all) as dust. 
51|43|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And in (the tribe of) Thamud (there is a portent) when it was told them: Take  your ease awhile. 
51|44|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|But they rebelled against their Lord's decree, and so the thunderbolt overtook  them even while they gazed; 
51|45|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves. 
51|46|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And the folk of Noah aforetime. Lo! they were licentious folk. 
51|47|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|We have built the heaven with might, and We it is Who make the vast extent  (thereof). 
51|48|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And the earth have We laid out, how gracious is the Spreader (thereof)! 
51|49|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And all things We have created by pairs, that haply ye may reflect. 
51|50|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Therefor flee unto Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from him. 
51|51|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And set not any other god along with Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you  from Him. 
51|52|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Even so there came no messenger unto those before them but they said: A  wizard or a madman! 
51|53|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Have they handed down (the saying) as an heirloom one unto another ? Nay,  but they are froward folk. 
51|54|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|So withdraw from them (O Muhammad), for thou art in no wise  blameworthy, 
51|55|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And warn, for warning profiteth believers. 
51|56|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|I created the jinn and humankind only that they might worship Me. 
51|57|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|I seek no livelihood from them, nor do I ask that they should feed Me. 
51|58|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|Lo! Allah! He it is that giveth livelihood, the Lord of unbreakable might. 
51|59|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And lo! for those who (now) do wrong there is an evil day like unto the evil  day (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on (that  day). 
51|60|adh-Dhariyat: The Scatterers|And woe unto those who disbelieve, from (that) their day which they are  promised. 
52|1|at-Tur: The Mountain|By the Mount, 
52|2|at-Tur: The Mountain|And a Scripture inscribed 
52|3|at-Tur: The Mountain|On fine parchment unrolled, 
52|4|at-Tur: The Mountain|And the House frequented, 
52|5|at-Tur: The Mountain|And the roof exalted, 
52|6|at-Tur: The Mountain|And the sea kept filled, 
52|7|at-Tur: The Mountain|Lo! the doom of thy Lord will surely come to pass; 
52|8|at-Tur: The Mountain|There is none that can ward it off. 
52|9|at-Tur: The Mountain|On the day when the heaven will heave with (awful) heaving, 
52|10|at-Tur: The Mountain|And the mountains move away with (awful) movement, 
52|11|at-Tur: The Mountain|Then woe that day unto the deniers 
52|12|at-Tur: The Mountain|Who play in talk of grave matters; 
52|13|at-Tur: The Mountain|The day when they are thrust with a (disdainful) thrust, into the fire of hell 
52|14|at-Tur: The Mountain|(And it is said unto them): This is the Fire which ye were wont to deny. 
52|15|at-Tur: The Mountain|Is this magic, or do ye not see ? 
52|16|at-Tur: The Mountain|Endure the heat thereof, and whether ye are patient of it or impatient of it is  all one for you. Ye are only being paid for what ye used to do. 
52|17|at-Tur: The Mountain|Lo! those who kept their duty dwell in gardens and delight, 
52|18|at-Tur: The Mountain|Happy because of what their Lord hath given them, and (because) their Lord  hath warded off from them the torment of hell-fire. 
52|19|at-Tur: The Mountain|(And it is said unto them): Eat and drink in health (as a reward) for what ye  used to do, 
52|20|at-Tur: The Mountain|Reclining on ranged couches. And we wed them unto fair ones with wide,  lovely eyes. 
52|21|at-Tur: The Mountain|And they who believe and whose seed follow them in faith, We cause their  seed to join them (there), and We deprive them of nought of their (life's) work. Every  man is a pledge for that which he hath earned. 
52|22|at-Tur: The Mountain|And We provide them with fruit and meat such as they desire. 
52|23|at-Tur: The Mountain|There they pass from hand to hand a cup wherein is neither vanity nor cause  of sin. 
52|24|at-Tur: The Mountain|And there go round, waiting on them menservants of their own, as they were  hidden pearls. 
52|25|at-Tur: The Mountain|And some of them draw near unto others, questioning, 
52|26|at-Tur: The Mountain|Saying: Lo! of old, when we were with our families, we were ever anxious; 
52|27|at-Tur: The Mountain|But Allah hath been gracious unto us and hath preserved us from the torment  of the breath of Fire. 
52|28|at-Tur: The Mountain|Lo! we used to pray unto Him of old. Lo! He is the Benign, the Merciful. 
52|29|at-Tur: The Mountain|Therefor warn (men, O Muhammad). By the grace of Allah thou art neither  soothsayer nor madman. 
52|30|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or say they: (he is) a poet, (one) for whom we may expect the accident of  time ? 
52|31|at-Tur: The Mountain|Say (unto them): Except (your fill)! Lo! I am with you among the expectant. 
52|32|at-Tur: The Mountain|Do their minds command them to do this, or are they an outrageous folk ? 
52|33|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or say they: He hath invented it ? Nay, but they will not believe! 
52|34|at-Tur: The Mountain|Then let them produce speech the like thereof, if they are truthful. 
52|35|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or were they created out of naught ? Or are they the creators ? 
52|36|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or did they create the heavens and the earth ? Nay, but they are sure of  nothing! 
52|37|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or do they own the treasures of thy Lord ? Or have they been given charge  (thereof) ? 
52|38|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or have they any stairway (unto heaven) by means of which they overhear  (decrees). Then let their listener produce some warrant manifest! 
52|39|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or hath He daughters whereas ye have sons ? 
52|40|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or askest thou (Muhammad) a fee from them so that they are plunged in debt  ? 
52|41|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or possess they the Unseen so that they can write (it) down ? 
52|42|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or seek they to ensnare (the messenger) ? But those who disbelieve, they are  the ensnared! 
52|43|at-Tur: The Mountain|Or have they any god beside Allah ? Glorified be Allah from all that they  ascribe as partner (unto Him)! 
52|44|at-Tur: The Mountain|And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A  heap of clouds. 
52|45|at-Tur: The Mountain|Then let them be (O Muhammad), till they meet their day, in which they will  be thunder-stricken, 
52|46|at-Tur: The Mountain|A day in which their guile will naught avail them, nor will they be helped. 
52|47|at-Tur: The Mountain|And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a punishment beyond that. But  most of them know not. 
52|48|at-Tur: The Mountain|So wait patiently (O Muhammad) for thy Lord's decree, for surely thou art in  Our sight; and hymn the praise of thy Lord when thou uprisest, 
52|49|at-Tur: The Mountain|And in the night-time also hymn His praise, and at the setting of the stars. 
53|1|an-Najm: The Star|By the Star when it setteth, 
53|2|an-Najm: The Star|Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived; 
53|3|an-Najm: The Star|Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire. 
53|4|an-Najm: The Star|It is naught save an inspiration that is inspired, 
53|5|an-Najm: The Star|Which one of mighty powers hath taught him, 
53|6|an-Najm: The Star|One vigorous; and he grew clear to view 
53|7|an-Najm: The Star|When he was on the uppermost horizon. 
53|8|an-Najm: The Star|Then he drew nigh and came down 
53|9|an-Najm: The Star|Till he was (distant) two bows' length or even nearer, 
53|10|an-Najm: The Star|And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed. 
53|11|an-Najm: The Star|The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw. 
53|12|an-Najm: The Star|Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he seeth ? 
53|13|an-Najm: The Star|And verily he saw him yet another time 
53|14|an-Najm: The Star|By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary, 
53|15|an-Najm: The Star|Nigh unto which is the Garden of Abode. 
53|16|an-Najm: The Star|When that which shroudeth did enshroud the lote-tree, 
53|17|an-Najm: The Star|The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold. 
53|18|an-Najm: The Star|Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord. 
53|19|an-Najm: The Star|Have ye thought upon Al-Lat and Al-'Uzza 
53|20|an-Najm: The Star|And Manat, the third, the other ? 
53|21|an-Najm: The Star|Are yours the males and His the females ? 
53|22|an-Najm: The Star|That indeed were an unfair division! 
53|23|an-Najm: The Star|They are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers, for which  Allah hath revealed no warrant. They follow but a guess and that which (they)  themselves desire. And now the guidance from their Lord hath come unto them. 
53|24|an-Najm: The Star|Or shall man have what he coveteth ? 
53|25|an-Najm: The Star|But unto Allah belongeth the after (life), and the former. 
53|26|an-Najm: The Star|And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught  save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth. 
53|27|an-Najm: The Star|Lo! it is those who disbelieve in the Hereafter who name the angels with the  names of females. 
53|28|an-Najm: The Star|And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a  guess can never take the place of the truth. 
53|29|an-Najm: The Star|Then withdraw (O Muhammad) from him who fleeth from Our remembrance  and desireth but the life of the world. 
53|30|an-Najm: The Star|Such is their sum of knowledge. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who  strayeth, and He is Best Aware of him whom goeth right. 
53|31|an-Najm: The Star|And unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in  the earth, that He may reward those who do evil with that which they have done, and  reward those who do good with goodness. 
53|32|an-Najm: The Star|Those who avoid enormities of sin and abominations, save the unwilled  offences - (for them) lo! thy Lord is of vast mercy. He is Best Aware of you (from the  time) when He created you from the earth, and when ye were hidden in the bellies of  your mothers. Therefor ascribe not purity unto yourselves. He is Best Aware of him  who wardeth off (evil). 
53|33|an-Najm: The Star|Didst thou (O Muhammad) observe him who turned away, 
53|34|an-Najm: The Star|And gave a little, then was grudging ? 
53|35|an-Najm: The Star|Hath he knowledge of the Unseen so that he seeth ? 
53|36|an-Najm: The Star|Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses 
53|37|an-Najm: The Star|And Abraham who paid his debt: 
53|38|an-Najm: The Star|That no laden one shall bear another's load, 
53|39|an-Najm: The Star|And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort, 
53|40|an-Najm: The Star|And that his effort will be seen. 
53|41|an-Najm: The Star|And afterward he will be repaid for it with fullest payment; 
53|42|an-Najm: The Star|And that thy Lord, He is the goal; 
53|43|an-Najm: The Star|And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep, 
53|44|an-Najm: The Star|And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life; 
53|45|an-Najm: The Star|And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female, 
53|46|an-Najm: The Star|From a drop (of seed) when it is poured forth; 
53|47|an-Najm: The Star|And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth; 
53|48|an-Najm: The Star|And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth; 
53|49|an-Najm: The Star|And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius; 
53|50|an-Najm: The Star|And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A'ad, 
53|51|an-Najm: The Star|And (the tribe of) Thamud He spared not; 
53|52|an-Najm: The Star|And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more  rebellious; 
53|53|an-Najm: The Star|And Al-Mu'tafikah He destroyed 
53|54|an-Najm: The Star|So that there covered them that which did cover. 
53|55|an-Najm: The Star|Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute ? 
53|56|an-Najm: The Star|This is a warner of the warners of old. 
53|57|an-Najm: The Star|The threatened Hour is nigh. 
53|58|an-Najm: The Star|None beside Allah can disclose it. 
53|59|an-Najm: The Star|Marvel ye then at this statement, 
53|60|an-Najm: The Star|And laugh and not weep, 
53|61|an-Najm: The Star|While ye amuse yourselves ? 
53|62|an-Najm: The Star|Rather prostrate yourselves before Allah and serve Him. 
54|1|al-Qamar: The Moon|The hour drew nigh and the moon was rent in twain. 
54|2|al-Qamar: The Moon|And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion. 
54|3|al-Qamar: The Moon|They denied (the Truth) and followed their own lusts. Yet everything will  come to a decision 
54|4|al-Qamar: The Moon|And surely there hath come unto them news whereof the purport should  deter, 
54|5|al-Qamar: The Moon|Effective wisdom; but warnings avail not. 
54|6|al-Qamar: The Moon|So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) on the day when the Summoner  summoneth unto a painful thing. 
54|7|al-Qamar: The Moon|With downcast eyes, they come forth from the graves as they were locusts  spread abroad, 
54|8|al-Qamar: The Moon|Hastening toward the summoner; the disbelievers say: This is a hard day. 
54|9|al-Qamar: The Moon|The folk of Noah denied before them, yea, they denied Our slave and said: A  madman; and he was repulsed. 
54|10|al-Qamar: The Moon|So he cried unto his Lord, saying: I am vanquished, so give help. 
54|11|al-Qamar: The Moon|Then opened We the gates of heaven with pouring water 
54|12|al-Qamar: The Moon|And caused the earth to gush forth springs, so that the waters met for a  predestined purpose. 
54|13|al-Qamar: The Moon|And We carried him upon a thing of planks and nails, 
54|14|al-Qamar: The Moon|That ran (upon the waters) in Our sight, as a reward for him who was  rejected. 
54|15|al-Qamar: The Moon|And verily We left it as a token; but is there any that remembereth ? 
54|16|al-Qamar: The Moon|Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings! 
54|17|al-Qamar: The Moon|And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any  that remembereth ? 
54|18|al-Qamar: The Moon|(The tribe of) A'ad rejected warnings. Then how (dreadful) was My  punishment after My warnings. 
54|19|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind on a day of constant calamity, 
54|20|al-Qamar: The Moon|Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm-trees. 
54|21|al-Qamar: The Moon|Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings! 
54|22|al-Qamar: The Moon|And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any  that remembereth ? 
54|23|al-Qamar: The Moon|(The tribe of) Thamud rejected warnings 
54|24|al-Qamar: The Moon|For they said; Is it a mortal man, alone among us, that we are to follow ?  Then indeed we should fall into error and madness. 
54|25|al-Qamar: The Moon|Hath the remembrance been given unto him alone among us ? Nay, but he is  a rash liar. 
54|26|al-Qamar: The Moon|(Unto their warner it was said): To-morrow they will know who is the rash  liar. 
54|27|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! We are sending the she-camel as a test for them; so watch them and have  patience; 
54|28|al-Qamar: The Moon|And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them.  Every drinking will be witnessed. 
54|29|al-Qamar: The Moon|But they call their comrade and he took and hamstrung (her). 
54|30|al-Qamar: The Moon|Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings! 
54|31|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! We sent upon them one Shout, and they became as the dry twigs  (rejected by) the builder of a cattle-fold. 
54|32|al-Qamar: The Moon|And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any  that remembereth ? 
54|33|al-Qamar: The Moon|The folk of Lot rejected warnings. 
54|34|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! We sent a storm of stones upon them (all) save the family of Lot, whom  We rescued in the last watch of the night, 
54|35|al-Qamar: The Moon|As grace from Us. Thus We reward him who giveth thanks. 
54|36|al-Qamar: The Moon|And he indeed had warned them of Our blow, but they did doubt the  warnings. 
54|37|al-Qamar: The Moon|They even asked of him his guests for an ill purpose. Then We blinded their  eyes (and said): Taste now My punishment after My warnings! 
54|38|al-Qamar: The Moon|And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning. 
54|39|al-Qamar: The Moon|Now taste My punishment after My warnings! 
54|40|al-Qamar: The Moon|And in truth We have made the Qur'an easy to remember; but is there any  that remembereth ? 
54|41|al-Qamar: The Moon|And warnings came in truth unto the house of Pharaoh 
54|42|al-Qamar: The Moon|Who denied Our revelations, every one. Therefore We grasped them with the  grasp of the Mighty, the Powerful. 
54|43|al-Qamar: The Moon|Are your disbelievers better than those, or have ye some immunity in the  scriptures ? 
54|44|al-Qamar: The Moon|Or say they: We are a host victorious ? 
54|45|al-Qamar: The Moon|The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee. 
54|46|al-Qamar: The Moon|Nay, but the Hour (of doom) is their appointed tryst, and the Hour will be  more wretched and more bitter (than their earthly failure). 
54|47|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! the guilty are in error and madness. 
54|48|al-Qamar: The Moon|On the day when they are dragged into the Fire upon their faces (it is said  unto them): Feel the touch of hell. 
54|49|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! We have created every thing by measure. 
54|50|al-Qamar: The Moon|And Our commandment is but one (commandment), as the twinkling of an  eye. 
54|51|al-Qamar: The Moon|And verily We have destroyed your fellows; but is there any that  remembereth ? 
54|52|al-Qamar: The Moon|And every thing they did is in the scriptures, 
54|53|al-Qamar: The Moon|And every small and great thing is recorded. 
54|54|al-Qamar: The Moon|Lo! the righteous will dwell among gardens and rivers, 
54|55|al-Qamar: The Moon|Firmly established in the favour of a Mighty King. 
55|1|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|The Beneficent 
55|2|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Hath made known the Qur'an. 
55|3|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|He hath created man. 
55|4|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|He hath taught him utterance. 
55|5|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|The sun and the moon are made punctual. 
55|6|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|The stars and the trees adore. 
55|7|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure, 
55|8|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|That ye exceed not the measure, 
55|9|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof. 
55|10|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures, 
55|11|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Wherein are fruit and sheathed palm-trees, 
55|12|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Husked grain and scented herb. 
55|13|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|14|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|He created man of clay like the potter's, 
55|15|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire. 
55|16|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|17|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests! 
55|18|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|19|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|He hath loosed the two seas. They meet. 
55|20|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|There is a barrier between them. They encroach not (one upon the other). 
55|21|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|22|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone. 
55|23|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|24|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|His are the ships displayed upon the sea, like banners. 
55|25|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|26|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Everyone that is thereon will pass away; 
55|27|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|There remaineth but the Countenance of thy Lord of Might and Glory. 
55|28|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|29|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|All that are in the heavens and the earth entreat Him. Every day He  exerciseth (universal) power. 
55|30|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|31|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|We shall dispose of you, O ye two dependents (man and jinn). 
55|32|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|33|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|O company of jinn and men, if ye have power to penetrate (all) regions of the  heavens and the earth, then penetrate (them)! Ye will never penetrate them save with  (Our) sanction. 
55|34|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|35|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|There will be sent, against you both, heat of fire and flash of brass, and ye  will not escape. 
55|36|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|37|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide - 
55|38|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? - 
55|39|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin. 
55|40|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|41|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|The guilty will be known by their marks, and will be taken by the forelocks  and the feet. 
55|42|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|43|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|This is hell which the guilty deny. 
55|44|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|They go circling round between it and fierce, boiling water. 
55|45|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|46|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|But for him who feareth the standing before his Lord there are two gardens. 
55|47|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|48|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Of spreading branches. 
55|49|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|50|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Wherein are two fountains flowing. 
55|51|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|52|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs. 
55|53|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|54|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Reclining upon couches lined with silk brocade, the fruit of both the gardens  near to hand. 
55|55|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|56|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Therein are those of modest gaze, whom neither man nor jinni will have  touched before them. 
55|57|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|58|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|(In beauty) like the jacynth and the coral-stone. 
55|59|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|60|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Is the reward of goodness aught save goodness ? 
55|61|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|62|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|And beside them are two other gardens, 
55|63|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|64|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Dark green with foliage. 
55|65|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|66|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Wherein are two abundant springs. 
55|67|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|68|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Wherein is fruit, the date-palm and pomegranate. 
55|69|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? 
55|70|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Wherein (are found) the good and beautiful - 
55|71|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? - 
55|72|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Fair ones, close-guarded in pavilions -

55|76|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.
