55|78|ar-Rahman: The Merciful|Blessed be the name of thy Lord, Mighty and glorious! 
56|1|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|When the event befalleth - 
56|2|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|There is no denying that it will befall - 
56|3|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Abasing (some), exalting (others); 
56|4|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|When the earth is shaken with a shock 
56|5|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And the hills are ground to powder 
56|6|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|So that they become a scattered dust, 
56|7|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And ye will be three kinds: 
56|8|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|(First) those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand ? 
56|9|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And (then) those on the left hand; what of those on the left hand ? 
56|10|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And the foremost in the race, the foremost in the race: 
56|11|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Those are they who will be brought nigh 
56|12|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|In gardens of delight; 
56|13|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|A multitude of those of old 
56|14|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And a few of those of later time. 
56|15|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|On lined couches, 
56|16|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Reclining therein face to face. 
56|17|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|There wait on them immortal youths 
56|18|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|With bowls and ewers and a cup from a pure spring 
56|19|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Wherefrom they get no aching of the head nor any madness, 
56|20|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And fruit that they prefer 
56|21|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And flesh of fowls that they desire. 
56|22|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And (there are) fair ones with wide, lovely eyes, 
56|23|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Like unto hidden pearls, 
56|24|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Reward for what they used to do. 
56|25|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|There hear they no vain speaking nor recrimination 
56|26|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|(Naught) but the saying: Peace, (and again) Peace. 
56|27|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand ? 
56|28|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Among thornless lote-trees 
56|29|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And clustered plantains, 
56|30|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And spreading shade, 
56|31|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And water gushing, 
56|32|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And fruit in plenty 
56|33|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Neither out of reach nor yet forbidden, 
56|34|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And raised couches; 
56|35|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Lo! We have created them a (new) creation 
56|36|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And made them virgins, 
56|37|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Lovers, friends, 
56|38|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|For those on the right hand; 
56|39|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|A multitude of those of old 
56|40|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And a multitude of those of later time. 
56|41|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And those on the left hand: What of those on the left hand ? 
56|42|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|In scorching wind and scalding water 
56|43|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And shadow of black smoke, 
56|44|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Neither cool nor refreshing. 
56|45|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Lo! heretofore they were effete with luxury 
56|46|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And used to persist in the awful sin. 
56|47|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And they used to say: When we are dead and have become dust and bones,  shall we then, forsooth, be raised again, 
56|48|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And also our forefathers ? 
56|49|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Lo! those of old and those of later time 
56|50|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Will all be brought together to the tryst of an appointed day. 
56|51|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Then lo! ye, the erring, the deniers, 
56|52|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Ye verily will eat of a tree called Zaqqum 
56|53|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And will fill your bellies therewith; 
56|54|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And thereon ye will drink of boiling water, 
56|55|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Drinking even as the camel drinketh. 
56|56|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment. 
56|57|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|We created you. Will ye then admit the truth ? 
56|58|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Have ye seen that which ye emit ? 
56|59|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Do ye create it or are We the Creator ? 
56|60|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|We mete out death among you, and We are not to be outrun, 
56|61|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|That We may transfigure you and make you what ye know not. 
56|62|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And verily ye know the first creation. Why, then, do ye not reflect ? 
56|63|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Have ye seen that which ye cultivate ? 
56|64|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Is it ye who foster it, or are We the Fosterer ? 
56|65|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|If We willed, We verily could make it chaff, then would ye cease not to  exclaim: 
56|66|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Lo! we are laden with debt! 
56|67|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Nay, but we are deprived! 
56|68|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Have ye observed the water which ye drink ? 
56|69|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Is it ye who shed it from the raincloud, or are We the Shedder ? 
56|70|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|If We willed We verily could make it bitter. Why then, give ye not thanks ? 
56|71|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Have ye observed the fire which ye strike out; 
56|72|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Was it ye who made the tree thereof to grow, or were We the grower ? 
56|73|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|We, even We, appointed it a memorial and a comfort for the dwellers in the  wilderness. 
56|74|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Therefor (O Muhammad), praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous. 
56|75|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Nay, I swear by the places of the stars - 
56|76|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And lo! that verily is a tremendous oath, if ye but knew - 
56|77|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|That (this) is indeed a noble Qur'an 
56|78|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|In a Book kept hidden 
56|79|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Which none toucheth save the purified, 
56|80|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds. 
56|81|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Is it this Statement that ye scorn, 
56|82|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And make denial thereof your livelihood ? 
56|83|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Why, then, when (the soul) cometh up to the throat (of the dying) 
56|84|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And ye are at that moment looking 
56|85|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|- And We are nearer unto him than ye are, but ye see not - 
56|86|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Why then, if ye are not in bondage (unto Us), 
56|87|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Do ye not force it back, if ye are truthful ? 
56|88|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Thus if he is of those brought nigh, 
56|89|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Then breath of life, and plenty, and a Garden of delight. 
56|90|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And if he is of those on the right hand, 
56|91|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Then (the greeting) "Peace be unto thee" from those on the right hand. 
56|92|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|But if he is of the rejecters, the erring, 
56|93|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Then the welcome will be boiling water 
56|94|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|And roasting at hell-fire. 
56|95|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Lo! this is certain truth. 
56|96|al-Waqi`ah: That Which is Coming|Therefor (O Muhammad) praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous. 
57|1|al-Hadid: The Iron|All that is in the heavens and the earth glorifieth Allah; and He is the Mighty,  the Wise. 
57|2|al-Hadid: The Iron|His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; He quickeneth and He  giveth death; and He is Able to do all things. 
57|3|al-Hadid: The Iron|He is the First and the Last, and the Outward and the Inward; and He is  Knower of all things. 
57|4|al-Hadid: The Iron|He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days; then He mounted  the Throne. He knoweth all that entereth the earth and all that emergeth therefrom and  all that cometh down from the sky and all that ascendeth therein; and He is with you  wheresoever ye may be. And Allah is Seer of what ye do. 
57|5|al-Hadid: The Iron|His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and unto Allah (all)  things are brought back. 
57|6|al-Hadid: The Iron|He causeth the night to pass into the day, and He causeth the day to pass into  the night, and He is knower of all that is in the breasts. 
57|7|al-Hadid: The Iron|Believe in Allah and His messenger, and spend of that whereof He hath  made you trustees; and such of you as believe and spend (aright), theirs will be a great  reward. 
57|8|al-Hadid: The Iron|What aileth you that ye believe not in Allah, when the messenger calleth you  to believe in your Lord, and He hath already made a covenant with you, if ye are  believers ? 
57|9|al-Hadid: The Iron|He it is Who sendeth down clear revelations unto His slave, that He may  bring you forth from darkness unto light; and lo! for you, Allah is Full of Pity,  Merciful. 
57|10|al-Hadid: The Iron|And what aileth you that ye spend not in the way of Allah when unto Allah  belongeth the inheritance of the heavens and the earth ? Those who spent and fought  before the victory are not upon a level (with the rest of you). Such are greater in rank  than those who spent and fought afterwards. Unto each hath Allah promised good.  And Allah is Informed of what ye do. 
57|11|al-Hadid: The Iron|Who is he that will lend unto Allah a goodly loan, that He may double it for  him and his may be a rich reward ? 
57|12|al-Hadid: The Iron|On the day when thou (Muhammad) wilt see the believers, men and women,  their light shining forth before them and on their right hands, (and wilt hear it said  unto them): Glad news for you this day: Gardens underneath which rivers flow,  wherein ye are immortal. That is the supreme triumph. 
57|13|al-Hadid: The Iron|On the day when the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women will say  unto those who believe: Look on us that we may borrow from your light! it will be  said: Go back and seek for light! Then there will separate them a wall wherein is a  gate, the inner side whereof containeth mercy, while the outer side thereof is toward  the doom. 
57|14|al-Hadid: The Iron|They will cry unto them (saying): Were we not with you ? They will say:  Yea, verily; but ye tempted one another, and hesitated, and doubted, and vain desires  beguiled you till the ordinance of Allah came to pass; and the deceiver deceived you  concerning Allah; 
57|15|al-Hadid: The Iron|So this day no ransom can be taken from you nor from those who  disbelieved. Your home is the Fire; that is your patron, and a hapless journey's end. 
57|16|al-Hadid: The Iron|Is not the time ripe for the hearts of those who believe to submit to Allah's  reminder and to the truth which is revealed, that they become not as those who  received the scripture of old but the term was prolonged for them and so their hearts  were hardened, and many of them are evil-livers. 
57|17|al-Hadid: The Iron|Know that Allah quickeneth the earth after its death. We have made clear  Our revelations for you, that haply ye may understand. 
57|18|al-Hadid: The Iron|Lo! those who give alms, both men and women, and lend unto Allah a  goodly loan, it will be doubled for them, and theirs will be a rich reward. 
57|19|al-Hadid: The Iron|And those who believe in Allah and His messengers, they are the loyal, and  the martyrs are with their Lord; they have their reward and their light; while as for  those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, they are owners of hell-fire. 
57|20|al-Hadid: The Iron|Know that the life of the world is only play, and idle talk, and pageantry, and  boasting among you, and rivalry in respect of wealth and children; as the likeness of  vegetation after rain, whereof the growth is pleasing to the husbandman, but afterward  it drieth up and thou seest it turning yellow, then it becometh straw. And in the  Hereafter there is grievous punishment, and (also) forgiveness from Allah and His  good pleasure, whereas the life of the world is but matter of illusion. 
57|21|al-Hadid: The Iron|Race one with another for forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whereof  the breadth is as the breadth of the heavens and the earth, which is in store for those  who believe in Allah and His messengers. Such is the bounty of Allah, which He  bestoweth upon whom He will, and Allah is of Infinite Bounty. 
57|22|al-Hadid: The Iron|Naught of disaster befalleth in the earth or in yourselves but it is in a Book  before we bring it into being - Lo! that is easy for Allah - 
57|23|al-Hadid: The Iron|That ye grieve not for the sake of that which hath escaped you, nor yet exult  because of that which hath been given. Allah loveth not all prideful boasters, 
57|24|al-Hadid: The Iron|Who hoard and who enjoin upon the people avarice. And whosoever turneth  away, still Allah is the Absolute, the Owner of Praise. 
57|25|al-Hadid: The Iron|We verily sent Our messengers with clear proofs, and revealed with them the  Scripture and the Balance, that mankind may observe right measure; and He revealed  iron, wherein is mighty power and (many) uses for mankind, and that Allah may  know him who helpeth Him and His messengers, though unseen. Lo! Allah is Strong,  Almighty. 
57|26|al-Hadid: The Iron|And We verily sent Noah and Abraham and placed the prophethood and the  scripture among their seed, and among them there is he who goeth right, but many of  them are evil-livers. 
57|27|al-Hadid: The Iron|Then We caused Our messengers to follow in their footsteps; and We caused  Jesus, son of Mary, to follow, and gave him the Gospel, and placed compassion and  mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. But monasticism they invented - We  ordained it not for them - only seeking Allah's pleasure, and they observed it not with  right observance. So We give those of them who believe their reward, but many of  them are evil-livers. 
57|28|al-Hadid: The Iron|O ye who believe! Be mindful of your duty to Allah and put faith in His  messenger. He will give you twofold of His mercy and will appoint for you a light  wherein ye shall walk, and will forgive you. Allah is Forgiving, Merciful; 
57|29|al-Hadid: The Iron|That the People of the Scripture may know that they control naught of the  bounty of Allah, but that the bounty is in Allah's hand to give to whom He will. And  Allah is of Infinite Bounty. 
58|1|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Allah hath heard the saying of her that disputeth with thee (Muhammad)  concerning her husband, and complaineth unto Allah. And Allah heareth your  colloquy. Lo! Allah is Hearer, Knower. 
58|2|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Such of you as put away your wives (by saying they are as their mothers) -  They are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave them birth -  they indeed utter an ill word and a lie. And lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
58|3|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Those who put away their wives (by saying they are as their mothers) and  afterward would go back on that which they have said, (the penalty) in that case (is)  the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. Unto this ye are exhorted; and  Allah is Informed of what ye do. 
58|4|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|And he who findeth not (the wherewithal), let him fast for two successive  months before they touch one another; and for him who is unable to do so (the  penance is) the feeding of sixty needy ones. This, that ye may put trust in Allah and  His messenger. Such are the limits (imposed by Allah); and for disbelievers is a  painful doom. 
58|5|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Lo! those who oppose Allah and His messenger will be abased even as those  before them were abased; and We have sent down clear tokens, and for disbelievers is  a shameful doom 
58|6|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|On the day when Allah will raise them all together and inform them of what  they did. Allah hath kept account of it while they forgot it. And Allah is Witness over  all things. 
58|7|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Hast thou not seen that Allah knoweth all that is in the heavens and all that is  in the earth ? There is no secret conference of three but He is their fourth, nor of five  but He is their sixth, nor of less than that or more but He is with them wheresoever  they may be; and afterward, on the Day of Resurrection, He will inform them of what  they did. Lo! Allah is Knower of all things. 
58|8|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Hast thou not observed those who were forbidden conspiracy and afterward  returned to that which they had been forbidden, and (now) conspire together for crime  and wrongdoing and disobedience toward the messenger ? And when they come unto  thee they greet thee with a greeting wherewith Allah greeteth thee not, and say within  themselves: Why should Allah punish us for what we say ? Hell will suffice them;  they will feel the heat thereof - a hapless journey's end! 
58|9|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|O ye who believe! When ye conspire together, conspire not together for  crime and wrongdoing and disobedience toward the messenger, but conspire together  for righteousness and piety, and keep your duty toward Allah, unto whom ye will be  gathered. 
58|10|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Lo! Conspiracy is only of the devil, that he may vex those who believe; but  he can harm them not at all unless by Allah's leave. In Allah let believers put their  trust. 
58|11|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|O ye who believe! when it is said unto you, Make room! in assemblies, then  make room; Allah will make way for you (hereafter). And when it is said, Come up  higher! go up higher; Allah will exalt those who believe among you, and those who  have knowledge, to high ranks. Allah is Informed of what ye do. 
58|12|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|O ye who believe! When ye hold conference with the messenger, offer an  alms before your conference. That is better and purer for you. But if ye cannot find  (the wherewithal) then lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
58|13|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Fear ye to offer alms before your conference ? Then, when ye do it not and  Allah hath forgiven you, establish worship and pay the poor-due and obey Allah and  His messenger. And Allah is Aware of what ye do. 
58|14|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Hast thou not seen those who take for friends a folk with whom Allah is  wroth ? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear a false oath knowingly. 
58|15|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Allah hath prepared for them a dreadful doom. Evil indeed is that which they  are wont to do. 
58|16|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|They make a shelter of their oaths and turn (men) from the way of Allah; so  theirs will be a shameful doom. 
58|17|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Their wealth and their children will avail them naught against Allah. Such  are rightful owners of the Fire; they will abide therein. 
58|18|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|On the day when Allah will raise them all together, then will they swear unto  Him as they (now) swear unto you, and they will fancy that they have some standing.  Lo! is it not they who are the liars ? 
58|19|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|The devil hath engrossed them and so hath caused them to forget  remembrance of Allah. They are the devil's party. Lo! is it not the devil's party who  will be the losers ? 
58|20|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Lo! those who oppose Allah and His messenger, they will be among the  lowest. 
58|21|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Allah hath decreed: Lo! I verily shall conquer, I and My messengers. Lo!  Allah is Strong, Almighty. 
58|22|al-Mujadilah: She Who Pleaded|Thou wilt not find folk who believe in Allah and the Last Day loving those  who oppose Allah and His messenger, even though they be their fathers or their sons  or their brethren or their clan. As for such, He hath written faith upon their hearts and  hath strengthened them with a Spirit from Him, and He will bring them into Gardens  underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide. Allah is well pleased with  them, and they are well pleased with Him. They are Allah's party. Lo! is it not Allah's  party who are the successful ? 
59|1|al-Hashr: The Exile|All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifieth Allah, and He is  the Mighty, the Wise. 
59|2|al-Hashr: The Exile|He it is Who hath caused those of the People of the Scripture who  disbelieved to go forth from their homes unto the first exile. Ye deemed not that they  would go forth, while they deemed that their strongholds would protect them from  Allah.  But Allah reached them from a place whereof they recked not, and cast terror  in their hearts so that they ruined their houses with their own hands and the hands of  the believers. So learn a lesson, O ye who have eyes! 
59|3|al-Hashr: The Exile|And if Allah had not decreed migration for them, He verily would have  punished them in the world, and theirs in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire. 
59|4|al-Hashr: The Exile|That is because they were opposed to Allah and His messenger; and whoso is  opposed to Allah, (for him) verily Allah is stern in reprisal. 
59|5|al-Hashr: The Exile|Whatsoever palm-trees ye cut down or left standing on their roots, it was by  Allah's leave, in order that He might confound the evil-livers. 
59|6|al-Hashr: The Exile|And that which Allah gave as spoil unto His messenger from them, ye urged  not any horse or riding-camel for the sake thereof, but Allah giveth His messenger  lordship over whom He will. Allah is Able to do all things. 
59|7|al-Hashr: The Exile|That which Allah giveth as spoil unto His messenger from the people of the  townships, it is for Allah and His messenger and for the near of kin and the orphans  and the needy and the wayfarer, that it become not a commodity between the rich  among you. And whatsoever the messenger giveth you, take it. And whatsoever he  forbiddeth, abstain (from it). And keep your duty to Allah. Lo! Allah is stern in  reprisal. 
59|8|al-Hashr: The Exile|And (it is) for the poor fugitives who have been driven out from their homes  and their belongings, who seek bounty from Allah and help Allah and His messenger.  They are the loyal. 
59|9|al-Hashr: The Exile|Those who entered the city and the faith before them love those who flee  unto them for refuge, and find in their breasts no need for that which hath been given  them, but prefer (the fugitives) above themselves though poverty become their lot.  And whoso is saved from his own avarice - such are they who are successful. 
59|10|al-Hashr: The Exile|And those who came (into the faith) after them say: Our Lord! Forgive us  and our brethren who were before us in the faith, and place not in our hearts any  rancour toward those who believe. Our Lord! Thou art Full of Pity, Merciful. 
59|11|al-Hashr: The Exile|Hast thou not observed those who are hypocrites, (how) they tell their  brethren who disbelieve among the People of the Scripture: If ye are driven out, we  surely will go out with you, and we will never obey anyone against you, and if ye are  attacked we verily will help you. And Allah beareth witness that they verily are liars. 
59|12|al-Hashr: The Exile|(For) indeed if they are driven out they go not out with them, and indeed if  they are attacked they help them not, and indeed if they had helped them they would  have turned and fled, and then they would not have been victorious. 
59|13|al-Hashr: The Exile|Ye are more awful as a fear in their bosoms than Allah. That is because they  are a folk who understand not. 
59|14|al-Hashr: The Exile|They will not fight against you in a body save in fortified villages or from  behind walls. Their adversity among themselves is very great. Ye think of them as a  whole whereas their hearts are divers. That is because they are a folk who have no  sense. 
59|15|al-Hashr: The Exile|On the likeness of those (who suffered) a short time before them, they taste  the ill-effects of their own conduct, and theirs is painful punishment. 
59|16|al-Hashr: The Exile|(And the hypocrites are) on the likeness of the devil when he telleth man to  disbelieve, then, when he disbelieveth saith: Lo! I am quit of thee. Lo! I fear Allah,  the Lord of the Worlds. 
59|17|al-Hashr: The Exile|And the consequence for both will be that they are in the Fire, therein  abiding. Such is the reward of evil-doers. 
59|18|al-Hashr: The Exile|O ye who believe! Observe your duty to Allah. And let every soul look to  that which it sendeth on before for the morrow. And observe your duty to Allah. Lo!  Allah is Informed of what ye do. 
59|19|al-Hashr: The Exile|And be not ye as those who forgot Allah, therefor He caused them to forget  their souls. Such are the evil-doers. 
59|20|al-Hashr: The Exile|Not equal are the owners of the Fire and the owners of the Garden. The  owners of the Garden, they are the victorious. 
59|21|al-Hashr: The Exile|If We had caused this Qur'an to descend upon a mountain, thou (O  Muhammad) verily hadst seen it humbled, rent asunder by the fear of Allah. Such  similitudes coin We for mankind that haply they may reflect. 
59|22|al-Hashr: The Exile|He is Allah, than Whom there is no other God, the Knower of the Invisible  and the Visible. He is the Beneficent, Merciful. 
59|23|al-Hashr: The Exile|He is Allah, than Whom there is no other God, the Sovereign Lord, the Holy  One, Peace, the Keeper of Faith, the Guardian, the Majestic, the Compeller, the  Superb. Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him). 
59|24|al-Hashr: The Exile|He is Allah, the Creator, the Shaper out of naught, the Fashioner. His are the  most beautiful names. All that is in the heavens and the earth glorifieth Him, and He  is the Mighty, the Wise. 
60|1|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|O ye who believe! Choose not My enemy and your enemy for allies. Do ye  give them friendship when they disbelieve in that truth which hath come unto you,  driving out the messenger and you because ye believe in Allah, your Lord ? If ye have  come forth to strive in My way and seeking My good pleasure, (show them not  friendship). Do ye show friendship unto them in secret, when I am Best Aware of  what ye hide and what ye proclaim ? And whosoever doeth it among you, he verily  hath strayed from the right way. 
60|2|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|If they have the upper hand of you, they will be your foes, and will stretch  out their hands and their tongues toward you with evil (intent), and they long for you  to disbelieve. 
60|3|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|Your ties of kindred and your children will avail you naught upon the Day of  Resurrection. He will part you. Allah is Seer of what ye do. 
60|4|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|There is a goodly pattern for you in Abraham and those with him, when they  told their folk: Lo! we are guiltless of you and all that ye worship beside Allah. We  have done with you. And there hath arisen between us and you hostility and hate for  ever until ye believe in Allah only - save that which Abraham promised his father  (when he said): I will ask forgiveness for thee, though I own nothing for thee from  Allah - Our Lord! In Thee we put our trust, and unto Thee we turn repentant, and unto  Thee is the journeying. 
60|5|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|Our Lord! Make us not a prey for those who disbelieve, and forgive us, our  Lord! Lo! Thou, only Thou, are the Mighty, the Wise. 
60|6|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|Verily ye have in them a goodly pattern for everyone who looketh to Allah  and the Last Day. And whosoever may turn away, lo! still Allah, He is the Absolute,  the Owner of Praise. 
60|7|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|It may be that Allah will ordain love between you and those of them with  whom ye are at enmity. Allah is Mighty, and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
60|8|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|Allah forbiddeth you not those who warred not against you on account of  religion and drove you not out from your homes, that ye should show them kindness  and deal justly with them. Lo! Allah loveth the just dealers. 
60|9|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|Allah forbiddeth you only those who warred against you on account of  religion and have driven you out from your homes and helped to drive you out, that  ye make friends of them. Whosoever maketh friends of them - (All) such are wrong- doers. 
60|10|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|O ye who believe! When believing women come unto you as fugitives,  examine them. Allah is Best Aware of their faith. Then, if ye know them for true  believers, send them not back unto the disbelievers. They are not lawful for them (the  disbelievers), nor are they (the disbelievers) lawful for them. And give them (the  disbelievers) that which they have spent (upon them). And it is no sin for you to  marry such women when ye have given them their dues. And hold not to the ties of  disbelieving women; and ask for (the return of) that which ye have spent; and let them  (the disbelievers) ask for that which they have spent. That is the judgment of Allah.  He judgeth between you. Allah is Knower, Wise. 
60|11|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|And if any of your wives have gone from you unto the disbelievers and  afterward ye have your turn (of triumph), then give unto those whose wives have  gone the like of that which they have spent, and keep your duty to Allah in Whom ye  are believers. 
60|12|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|O Prophet! If believing women come unto thee, taking oath of allegiance  unto thee that they will ascribe no thing as partner unto Allah, and will neither steal  nor commit adultery nor kill their children, nor produce any lie that they have devised  between their hands and feet, nor disobey thee in what is right, then accept their  allegiance and ask Allah to forgive them. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
60|13|al-Mumtahanah: She Who is Tested|O ye who believe! Be not friendly with a folk with whom Allah is wroth, (a  folk) who have despaired of the Hereafter as the disbelievers despair of those who are  in the graves. 
61|1|as-Saff: The Ranks|All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifieth Allah, and He is  the Mighty, the Wise. 
61|2|as-Saff: The Ranks|O ye who believe! Why say ye that which ye do not ? 
61|3|as-Saff: The Ranks|It is most hateful in the sight of Allah that ye say that which ye do not. 
61|4|as-Saff: The Ranks|Lo! Allah loveth them who battle for His cause in ranks, as if they were a  solid structure. 
61|5|as-Saff: The Ranks|And (remember) when Moses said unto his people: O my people! Why  persecute ye me, when ye well know that I am Allah's messenger unto you ? So when  they went astray Allah sent their hearts astray. And Allah guideth not the evil-living  folk. 
61|6|as-Saff: The Ranks|And when Jesus son of Mary said: O Children of Israel! Lo! I am the  messenger of Allah unto you, confirming that which was (revealed) before me in the  Torah, and bringing good tidings of a messenger who cometh after me, whose name  is the Praised One. Yet when he hath come unto them with clear proofs, they say:  This is mere magic. 
61|7|as-Saff: The Ranks|And who doeth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie against Allah when  he is summoned unto Al-Islam ? And Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk. 
61|8|as-Saff: The Ranks|Fain would they put out the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will  perfect His light however much the disbelievers are averse. 
61|9|as-Saff: The Ranks|He it is Who hath sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of  truth, that He may make it conqueror of all religion however much idolaters may be  averse. 
61|10|as-Saff: The Ranks|O ye who believe! Shall I show you a commerce that will save you from a  painful doom ? 
61|11|as-Saff: The Ranks|Ye should believe in Allah and His messenger, and should strive for the  cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is better for you, if ye did but  know. 
61|12|as-Saff: The Ranks|He will forgive you your sins and bring you into Gardens underneath which  rivers flow, and pleasant dwellings in Gardens of Eden. That is the supreme triumph. 
61|13|as-Saff: The Ranks|And (He will give you) another (blessing) which ye love: help from Allah  and present victory. Give good tidings (O Muhammad) to believers. 
61|14|as-Saff: The Ranks|O ye who believe! Be Allah's helpers, even as Jesus son of Mary said unto  the disciples: Who are my helpers for Allah ? They said: We are Allah's helpers. And  a party of the Children of Israel believed, while a party disbelieved. Then We  strengthened those who believed against their foe, and they became the uppermost. 
62|1|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifieth Allah, the  Sovereign Lord, the Holy One, the Mighty, the Wise. 
62|2|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|He it is Who hath sent among the unlettered ones a messenger of their own,  to recite unto them His revelations and to make them grow, and to teach them the  Scripture and wisdom, though heretofore they were indeed in error manifest, 
62|3|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|Along with others of them who have not yet joined them. He is the Mighty,  the Wise. 
62|4|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|That is the bounty of Allah; which He giveth unto whom He will. Allah is of  Infinite Bounty. 
62|5|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|The likeness of those who are entrusted with the Law of Moses, yet apply it  not, is as the likeness of the ass carrying books. Wretched is the likeness of folk who  deny the revelations of Allah. And Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk. 
62|6|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|Say (O Muhammad): O ye who are Jews! If ye claim that ye are favoured of  Allah apart from (all) mankind, then long for death if ye are truthful. 
62|7|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|But they will never long for it because of all that their own hands have sent  before, and Allah is Aware of evil-doers. 
62|8|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Lo! the death from which ye shrink will  surely meet you, and afterward ye will be returned unto the Knower of the Invisible  and the Visible, and He will tell you what ye used to do. 
62|9|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|O ye who believe! When the call is heard for the prayer of the day of  congregation, haste unto remembrance of Allah and leave your trading. That is better  for you if ye did but know. 
62|10|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|And when the prayer is ended, then disperse in the land and seek of Allah's  bounty, and remember Allah much, that ye may be successful. 
62|11|al-Jumu`ah: The Day of Congregation|But when they spy some merchandise or pastime they break away to it and  leave thee standing. Say: That which Allah hath is better than pastime and than  merchandise, and Allah is the Best of providers. 
63|1|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|When the hypocrites come unto thee (O Muhammad), they say: We bear  witness that thou art indeed Allah's messenger. And Allah knoweth that thou art  indeed His messenger, and Allah beareth witness that the hypocrites indeed are  speaking falsely. 
63|2|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|They make their faith a pretext so that they may turn (men) from the way of  Allah. Verily evil is that which they are wont to do, 
63|3|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|That is because they believed, then disbelieved, therefore their hearts are  sealed so that they understand not. 
63|4|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|And when thou seest them their figures please thee; and if they speak thou  givest ear unto their speech. (They are) as though they were blocks of wood in striped  cloaks. They deem every shout to be against them. They are the enemy, so beware of  them. Allah confound them! How they are perverted! 
63|5|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|And when it is said unto them: Come! The messenger of Allah will ask  forgiveness for you! they avert their faces and thou seest them turning away,  disdainful. 
63|6|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|Whether thou ask forgiveness for them or ask not forgiveness for them is all  one for them; Allah will not forgive them. Lo! Allah guideth not the evil-living folk. 
63|7|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|They it is who say: Spend not on behalf of those (who dwell) with Allah's  messenger that they may disperse (and go away from you); when Allah's are the  treasures of the heavens and the earth; but the hypocrites comprehend not. 
63|8|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|They say: Surely, if we return to Al-Madinah the mightier will soon drive out  the weaker; when might belongeth to Allah and to His messenger and to the believers;  but the hypocrites know not. 
63|9|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|O ye who believe! Let not your wealth nor your children distract you from  remembrance of Allah. Those who do so, they are the losers. 
63|10|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|And spend of that wherewith We have provided you before death cometh  unto one of you and he saith: My Lord! If only thou wouldst reprieve me for a little  while, then I would give alms and be among the righteous. 
63|11|al-Munafiqun: The Hypocrites|But Allah reprieveth no soul when its term cometh, and Allah is Informed of  what ye do. 
64|1|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifieth Allah; unto  Him belongeth Sovereignty and unto Him belongeth praise, and He is Able to do all  things. 
64|2|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|He it is Who created you, but one of you is a disbeliever and one of you is a  believer, and Allah is Seer of what ye do. 
64|3|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|He created the heavens and the earth with truth, and He shaped you and  made good your shapes, and unto Him is the journeying. 
64|4|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|He knoweth all that is in the heavens and the earth, and He knoweth what ye  conceal and what ye publish. And Allah is Aware of what is in the breasts (of men). 
64|5|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|Hath not the story reached you of those who disbelieved of old and so did  taste the ill-effects of their conduct, and theirs will be a painful doom. 
64|6|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|That was because their messengers (from Allah) kept coming unto them with  clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), but they said: Shall mere mortals guide us ? So  they disbelieved and turned away, and Allah was independent (of them). Allah is  Absolute, Owner of Praise. 
64|7|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|Those who disbelieve assert that they will not be raised again. Say (unto  them, O Muhammad): Yea, verily, by my Lord! ye will be raised again and then ye  will be informed of what ye did; and that is easy for Allah. 
64|8|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|So believe in Allah and His messenger and the light which We have  revealed. And Allah is Informed of what ye do. 
64|9|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|The day when He shall gather you unto the Day of Assembling, that will be a  day of mutual disillusion. And whoso believeth in Allah and doeth right, He will  remit from him his evil deeds and will bring him unto Gardens underneath which  rivers flow, therein to abide for ever. That is the supreme triumph. 
64|10|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, such are owners of the  Fire; they will abide therein - a hapless journey's end! 
64|11|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|No calamity befalleth save by Allah's leave. And whosoever believeth in  Allah, He guideth his heart. And Allah is Knower of all things. 
64|12|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|Obey Allah and obey His messenger; but if ye turn away, then the duty of  Our messenger is only to convey (the message) plainly. 
64|13|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|Allah! There is no God save Him. In Allah, therefore, let believers put their  trust. 
64|14|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|O ye who believe! Lo! among your wives and your children there are  enemies for you, therefor beware of them. And if ye efface and overlook and forgive,  then lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
64|15|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|Your wealth and your children are only a temptation, whereas Allah! with  Him is an immense reward. 
64|16|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|So keep your duty to Allah as best ye can, and listen, and obey, and spend;  that is better for your souls. And whoso is saved from his own greed, such are the  successful. 
64|17|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|If ye lend unto Allah a goodly loan, He will double it for you and will  forgive you, for Allah is Responsive, Clement, 
64|18|at-Taghabun: The Cheating|Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, the Mighty, the Wise. 
65|1|at-Talaq: The Divorce|O Prophet! When ye (men) put away women, put them away for their (legal)  period and reckon the period, and keep your duty to Allah, your Lord. Expel them not  from their houses nor let them go forth unless they commit open immorality. Such are  the limits (imposed by) Allah; and whoso transgresseth Allah's limits, he verily  wrongeth his soul. Thou knowest not: it may be that Allah will afterward bring some  new thing to pass. 
65|2|at-Talaq: The Divorce|Then, when they have reached their term, take them back in kindness or part  from them in kindness, and call to witness two just men among you, and keep your  testimony upright for Allah. Whoso believeth in Allah and the Last Day is exhorted to  act thus. And whosoever keepeth his duty to Allah, Allah will appoint a way out for  him, 
65|3|at-Talaq: The Divorce|And will provide for him from (a quarter) whence he hath no expectation.  And whosoever putteth his trust in Allah, He will suffice him. Lo! Allah bringeth His  command to pass. Allah hath set a measure for all things. 
65|4|at-Talaq: The Divorce|And for such of your women as despair of menstruation, if ye doubt, their  period (of waiting) shall be three months, along with those who have it not. And for  those with child, their period shall be till they bring forth their burden. And  whosoever keepeth his duty to Allah, He maketh his course easy for him. 
65|5|at-Talaq: The Divorce|That is the commandment of Allah which He revealeth unto you. And whoso  keepeth his duty to Allah, He will remit from him his evil deeds and magnify reward  for him. 
65|6|at-Talaq: The Divorce|Lodge them where ye dwell, according to your wealth, and harass them not  so as to straiten life for them. And if they are with child, then spend for them till they  bring forth their burden. Then, if they give suck for you, give them their due payment  and consult together in kindness; but if ye make difficulties for one another, then let  some other woman give suck for him (the father of the child). 
65|7|at-Talaq: The Divorce|Let him who hath abundance spend of his abundance, and he whose  provision is measured, let him spend of that which Allah hath given him. Allah asketh  naught of any soul save that which He hath given it. Allah will vouchsafe, after  hardship, ease. 
65|8|at-Talaq: The Divorce|And how many a community revolted against the ordinance of its Lord and  His messengers, and We called it to a stern account and punished it with dire  punishment, 
65|9|at-Talaq: The Divorce|So that it tasted the ill-effects of its conduct, and the consequence of its  conduct was loss. 
65|10|at-Talaq: The Divorce|Allah hath prepared for them stern punishment; so keep your duty to Allah,  O men of understanding! O ye who believe! Now Allah hath sent down unto you a  reminder, 
65|11|at-Talaq: The Divorce|A messenger reciting unto you the revelations of Allah made plain, that He  may bring forth those who believe and do good works from darkness unto light. And  whosoever believeth in Allah and doeth right, He will bring him into Gardens  underneath which rivers flow, therein to abide for ever. Allah hath made good  provision for him. 
65|12|at-Talaq: The Divorce|Allah it is who hath created seven heavens, and of the earth the like thereof.  The commandment cometh down among them slowly, that ye may know that Allah is  Able to do all things, and that Allah surroundeth all things in knowledge. 
66|1|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|O Prophet! Why bannest thou that which Allah hath made lawful for thee,  seeking to please thy wives ? And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
66|2|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|Allah hath made lawful for you (Muslims) absolution from your oaths (of  such a kind), and Allah is your Protector. He is the Knower, the Wise. 
66|3|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|When the Prophet confided a fact unto one of his wives and when she  afterward divulged it and Allah apprised him thereof, he made known (to her) part  thereof and passed over part. And when he told it her she said: Who hath told thee ?  He said: The Knower, the Aware hath told me. 
66|4|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|If ye twain turn unto Allah repentant, (ye have cause to do so) for your hearts  desired (the ban); and if ye aid one another against him (Muhammad) then lo! Allah,  even He, is his Protecting Friend, and Gabriel and the righteous among the believers;  and furthermore the angels are his helpers. 
66|5|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|It may happen that his Lord, if he divorce you, will give him in your stead  wives better than you, submissive (to Allah), believing, pious, penitent, devout,  inclined to fasting, widows and maids. 
66|6|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|O ye who believe! Ward off from yourselves and your families a Fire  whereof the fuel is men and stones, over which are set angels strong, severe, who  resist not Allah in that which He commandeth them, but do that which they are  commanded. 
66|7|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|(Then it will be said): O ye who disbelieve! Make no excuses for yourselves  this day. Ye are only being paid for what ye used to do. 
66|8|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|O ye who believe! Turn unto Allah in sincere repentance! It may be that your  Lord will remit from you your evil deeds and bring you into Gardens underneath  which rivers flow, on the day when Allah will not abase the Prophet and those who  believe with him. Their light will run before them and on their right hands; they will  say: Our Lord!  Perfect our light for us, and forgive us! Lo! Thou art Able to do all  things. 
66|9|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|O Prophet! Strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be stern  with them. Hell will be their home, a hapless journey's end. 
66|10|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|Allah citeth an example for those who disbelieve: the wife of Noah and the  wife of Lot, who were under two of Our righteous slaves yet betrayed them so that  they (the husbands) availed them naught against Allah and it was said (unto them):  Enter the Fire along with those who enter. 
66|11|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|And Allah citeth an example for those who believe: the wife of Pharaoh  when she said: My Lord! Build for me a home with thee in the Garden, and deliver  me from Pharaoh and his work, and deliver me from evil-doing folk; 
66|12|at-Tahrim: The Prohibition|And Mary, daughter of 'Imran, whose body was chaste, therefor We breathed  therein something of Our Spirit. And she put faith in the words of her Lord and His  scriptures, and was of the obedient. 
67|1|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Blessed is He in Whose hand is the Sovereignty, and, He is Able to do all  things. 
67|2|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Who hath created life and death that He may try you which of you is best in  conduct; and He is the Mighty, the Forgiving, 
67|3|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Who hath created seven heavens in harmony. Thou (Muhammad) canst see  no fault in the Beneficent One's creation; then look again: Canst thou see any rifts ? 
67|4|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Then look again and yet again, thy sight will return unto thee weakened and  made dim. 
67|5|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|And verily We have beautified the world's heaven with lamps, and We have  made them missiles for the devils, and for them We have prepared the doom of flame. 
67|6|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the doom of hell, a  hapless journey's end! 
67|7|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|When they are flung therein they hear its roaring as it boileth up, 
67|8|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|As it would burst with rage. Whenever a (fresh) host is flung therein the  wardens thereof ask them: Came there unto you no warner ? 
67|9|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|They say: Yea, verily, a warner came unto us; but we denied and said: Allah  hath naught revealed; ye are in naught but a great error. 
67|10|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|And they say: Had we been wont to listen or have sense, we had not been  among the dwellers in the flames. 
67|11|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|So they acknowledge their sins; but far removed (from mercy) are the  dwellers in the flames. 
67|12|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Lo! those who fear their Lord in secret, theirs will be forgiveness and a great  reward. 
67|13|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|And keep your opinion secret or proclaim it, lo! He is Knower of all that is in  the breasts (of men). 
67|14|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Should He not know what He created ? And He is the Subtile, the Aware. 
67|15|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|He it is Who hath made the earth subservient unto you, so Walk in the paths  thereof and eat of His providence. And unto Him will be the resurrection (of the  dead). 
67|16|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not cause  the earth to swallow you when lo! it is convulsed ? 
67|17|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Or have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not let  loose on you a hurricane ? But ye shall know the manner of My warning. 
67|18|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|And verily those before them denied, then (see) the manner of My wrath  (with them)! 
67|19|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and  closing them ? Naught upholdeth them save the Beneficent. Lo! He is Seer of all  things. 
67|20|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Or who is he that will be an army unto you to help you instead of the  Beneficent ? The disbelievers are in naught but illusion. 
67|21|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Or who is he that will provide for you if He should withhold His providence  ? Nay, but they are set in pride and frowardness. 
67|22|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Is he who goeth groping on his face more rightly guided, or he who walketh  upright on a straight road ? 
67|23|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He it is who gave you being, and hath  assigned unto you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye! 
67|24|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Say: He it is Who multiplieth you in the earth, and unto Whom ye will be  gathered. 
67|25|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful ? 
67|26|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Say: The knowledge is with Allah only, and I am but a plain warner; 
67|27|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve will be awry,  and it will be said (unto them): This is that for which ye used to call. 
67|28|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Say (O Muhammad): Have ye thought: Whether Allah causeth me  (Muhammad) and those with me to perish or hath mercy on us, still, who will protect  the disbelievers from a painful doom ? 
67|29|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Say: He is the Beneficent. In Him we believe and in Him we put our trust.  And ye will soon know who it is that is in error manifest. 
67|30|al-Mulk: The Kingdom|Say: Have ye thought: If (all) your water were to disappear into the earth,  who then could bring you gushing water ? 
68|1|al-Qalam: The Pen|Nun. By the pen and that which they write (therewith), 
68|2|al-Qalam: The Pen|Thou art not, for thy Lord's favour unto thee, a madman. 
68|3|al-Qalam: The Pen|And lo! thine verily will be a reward unfailing. 
68|4|al-Qalam: The Pen|And lo! thou art of a tremendous nature. 
68|5|al-Qalam: The Pen|And thou wilt see and they will see 
68|6|al-Qalam: The Pen|Which of you is the demented. 
68|7|al-Qalam: The Pen|Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is  Best Aware of those who walk aright. 
68|8|al-Qalam: The Pen|Therefor obey not thou the rejecters 
68|9|al-Qalam: The Pen|Who would have had thee compromise, that they may compromise. 
68|10|al-Qalam: The Pen|Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger, 
68|11|al-Qalam: The Pen|Detracter, spreader abroad of slanders, 
68|12|al-Qalam: The Pen|Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor 
68|13|al-Qalam: The Pen|Greedy therewithal, intrusive. 
68|14|al-Qalam: The Pen|It is because he is possessed of wealth and children 
68|15|al-Qalam: The Pen|That, when Our revelations are recited unto him, he saith: Mere fables of the  men of old. 
68|16|al-Qalam: The Pen|We shall brand him on the nose. 
68|17|al-Qalam: The Pen|Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they  vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning, 
68|18|al-Qalam: The Pen|And made no exception (for the Will of Allah); 
68|19|al-Qalam: The Pen|Then a visitation from thy Lord came upon it while they slept 
68|20|al-Qalam: The Pen|And in the morning it was as if plucked. 
68|21|al-Qalam: The Pen|And they cried out one unto another in the morning, 
68|22|al-Qalam: The Pen|Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit). 
68|23|al-Qalam: The Pen|So they went off, saying one unto another in low tones: 
68|24|al-Qalam: The Pen|No needy man shall enter it to-day against you. 
68|25|al-Qalam: The Pen|They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose. 
68|26|al-Qalam: The Pen|But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error! 
68|27|al-Qalam: The Pen|Nay, but we are desolate! 
68|28|al-Qalam: The Pen|The best among them said: Said I not unto you: Why glorify ye not (Allah) ? 
68|29|al-Qalam: The Pen|They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers. 
68|30|al-Qalam: The Pen|Then some of them drew near unto others, self-reproaching. 
68|31|al-Qalam: The Pen|They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous. 
68|32|al-Qalam: The Pen|It may be that our Lord will give us better than this in place thereof. Lo! we  beseech our Lord. 
68|33|al-Qalam: The Pen|Such was the punishment. And verily the punishment of the Hereafter is  greater if they did but know. 
68|34|al-Qalam: The Pen|Lo! for those who keep from evil are gardens of bliss with their Lord. 
68|35|al-Qalam: The Pen|Shall We then treat those who have surrendered as We treat the guilty ? 
68|36|al-Qalam: The Pen|What aileth you ? How foolishly ye judge! 
68|37|al-Qalam: The Pen|Or have ye a scripture wherein ye learn 
68|38|al-Qalam: The Pen|That ye shall indeed have all that ye choose ? 
68|39|al-Qalam: The Pen|Or have ye a covenant on oath from Us that reacheth to the Day of Judgment,  that yours shall be all that ye ordain ? 
68|40|al-Qalam: The Pen|Ask them (O Muhammad) which of them will vouch for that! 
68|41|al-Qalam: The Pen|Or have they other gods ? Then let them bring their other gods if they are  truthful 
68|42|al-Qalam: The Pen|On the day when it befalleth in earnest, and they are ordered to prostrate  themselves but are not able, 
68|43|al-Qalam: The Pen|With eyes downcast, abasement stupefying them. And they had been  summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt. 
68|44|al-Qalam: The Pen|Leave Me (to deal) with those who give the lie to this pronouncement. We  shall lead them on by steps from whence they know not. 
68|45|al-Qalam: The Pen|Yet I bear with them, for lo! My scheme is firm. 
68|46|al-Qalam: The Pen|Or dost thou (Muhammad) ask a fee from them so that they are heavily taxed  ? 
68|47|al-Qalam: The Pen|Or is the Unseen theirs that they can write (thereof) ? 
68|48|al-Qalam: The Pen|But wait thou for thy Lord's decree, and be not like him of the fish, who cried  out in despair. 
68|49|al-Qalam: The Pen|Had it not been that favour from his Lord had reached him he surely had  been cast into the wilderness while he was reprobate. 
68|50|al-Qalam: The Pen|But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous. 
68|51|al-Qalam: The Pen|And lo! those who disbelieve would fain disconcert thee with their eyes  when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Lo! he is indeed mad; 
68|52|al-Qalam: The Pen|When it is naught else than a Reminder to creation. 
69|1|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|The Reality! 
69|2|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|What is the Reality ? 
69|3|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Ah, what will convey unto thee what the reality is! 
69|4|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|(The tribes of) Thamud and A'ad disbelieved in the judgment to come. 
69|5|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the lightning. 
69|6|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And as for A'ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind, 
69|7|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Which He imposed on them for seven long nights and eight long days so that  thou mightest have seen men lying overthrown, as they were hollow trunks of palm- trees. 
69|8|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Canst thou (O Muhammad) see any remnant of them ? 
69|9|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And Pharaoh and those before him, and the communities that were  destroyed, brought error, 
69|10|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, therefor did He grip them  with a tightening grip. 
69|11|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Lo! when the waters rose, We carried you upon the ship 
69|12|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|That We might make it a memorial for you, and that remembering ears (that  heard the story) might remember. 
69|13|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And when the trumpet shall sound one blast 
69|14|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And the earth with the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with one  crash, 
69|15|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Then, on that day will the Event befall. 
69|16|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And the heaven will split asunder, for that day it will be frail. 
69|17|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And the angels will be on the sides thereof, and eight will uphold the Throne  of thy Lord that day, above them. 
69|18|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|On that day ye will be exposed; not a secret of you will be hidden. 
69|19|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say: Take,  read my book! 
69|20|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Surely I knew that I should have to meet my reckoning. 
69|21|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Then he will be in blissful state 
69|22|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|In a high garden 
69|23|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Whereof the clusters are in easy reach. 
69|24|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|(And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which  ye sent on before you in past days. 
69|25|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say: Oh,  would that I had not been given my book 
69|26|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And knew not what my reckoning! 
69|27|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Oh, would that it had been death! 
69|28|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|My wealth hath not availed me, 
69|29|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|My power hath gone from me. 
69|30|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|(It will be said): Take him and fetter him 
69|31|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And then expose him to hell-fire 
69|32|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits. 
69|33|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Lo! He used not to believe in Allah the Tremendous, 
69|34|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And urged not on the feeding of the wretched. 
69|35|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Therefor hath he no lover here this day, 
69|36|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Nor any food save filth 
69|37|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Which none but sinners eat. 
69|38|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|But nay! I swear by all that ye see 
69|39|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And all that ye see not 
69|40|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|That it is indeed the speech of an illustrious messenger. 
69|41|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|It is not poet's speech - little is it that ye believe! 
69|42|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|Nor diviner's speech - little is it that ye remember! 
69|43|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds. 
69|44|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us, 
69|45|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|We assuredly had taken him by the right hand 
69|46|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And then severed his life-artery, 
69|47|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And not one of you could have held Us off from him. 
69|48|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And lo! it is a warrant unto those who ward off (evil). 
69|49|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And lo! We know that some among you will deny (it). 
69|50|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And lo! it is indeed an anguish for the disbelievers. 
69|51|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|And lo! it is absolute truth. 
69|52|al-Haqqah: The Inevitable|So glorify the name of thy Tremendous Lord. 
70|1|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|A questioner questioned concerning the doom about to fall 
70|2|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Upon the disbelievers, which none can repel, 
70|3|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|From Allah, Lord of the Ascending Stairways 
70|4|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|(Whereby) the angels and the Spirit ascend unto Him in a Day whereof the  span is fifty thousand years. 
70|5|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|But be patient (O Muhammad) with a patience fair to see. 
70|6|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Lo! they behold it afar off 
70|7|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|While we behold it nigh: 
70|8|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|The day when the sky will become as molten copper, 
70|9|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And the hills become as flakes of wool, 
70|10|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And no familiar friend will ask a question of his friend 
70|11|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Though they will be given sight of them. The guilty man will long to be able  to ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children 
70|12|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And his spouse and his brother 
70|13|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And his kin that harboured him 
70|14|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And all that are in the earth, if then it might deliver him. 
70|15|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|But nay! for lo! it is the fire of hell 
70|16|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Eager to roast; 
70|17|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|It calleth him who turned and fled (from truth), 
70|18|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And hoarded (wealth) and withheld it. 
70|19|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Lo! man was created anxious, 
70|20|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Fretful when evil befalleth him 
70|21|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And, when good befalleth him, grudging; 
70|22|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Save worshippers. 
70|23|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Who are constant at their worship 
70|24|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And in whose wealth there is a right acknowledged 
70|25|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|For the beggar and the destitute; 
70|26|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And those who believe in the Day of Judgment, 
70|27|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And those who are fearful of their Lord's doom - 
70|28|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Lo! the doom of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure - 
70|29|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And those who preserve their chastity 
70|30|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Save with their wives and those whom their right hands possess, for thus  they are not blameworthy; 
70|31|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|But whoso seeketh more than that, those are they who are transgressors; 
70|32|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And those who keep their pledges and their covenant, 
70|33|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And those who stand by their testimony 
70|34|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|And those who are attentive at their worship. 
70|35|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|These will dwell in Gardens, honoured. 
70|36|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|What aileth those who disbelieve, that they keep staring toward thee (O  Muhammad), open-eyed, 
70|37|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|On the right and on the left, in groups ? 
70|38|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Doth every man among them hope to enter the Garden of Delight ? 
70|39|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|Nay, verily. Lo! We created them from what they know. 
70|40|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|But nay! I swear by the Lord of the rising-places and the setting-places of the  planets that We verily are Able 
70|41|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|To replace them by (others) better than them. And we are not to be outrun. 
70|42|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|So let them chat and play until they meet their Day which they are promised, 
70|43|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|The day when they come forth from the graves in haste, as racing to a goal, 
70|44|al-Ma`arij: The Ladders|With eyes aghast, abasement stupefying them: Such is the Day which they  are promised. 
71|1|Nuh: Noah|Lo! We sent Noah unto his people (saying): Warn thy people ere the painful  doom come unto them. 
71|2|Nuh: Noah|He said: O my people! Lo! I am a plain warner unto you 
71|3|Nuh: Noah|(Bidding you): Serve Allah and keep your duty unto Him and obey me, 
71|4|Nuh: Noah|That He may forgive you somewhat of your sins and respite you to an  appointed term. Lo! the term of Allah, when it cometh, cannot be delayed, if ye but  knew. 
71|5|Nuh: Noah|He said: My Lord! Lo! I have called unto my people night and day 
71|6|Nuh: Noah|But all my calling doth but add to their repugnance; 
71|7|Nuh: Noah|And lo! whenever I call unto them that Thou mayst pardon them they thrust  their fingers in their ears and cover themselves with their garments and persist (in  their refusal) and magnify themselves in pride. 
71|8|Nuh: Noah|And lo! I have called unto them aloud, 
71|9|Nuh: Noah|And lo! I have made public proclamation unto them, and I have appealed to  them in private. 
71|10|Nuh: Noah|And I have said: Seek pardon of your Lord. Lo! He was ever Forgiving. 
71|11|Nuh: Noah|He will let loose the sky for you in plenteous rain, 
71|12|Nuh: Noah|And will help you with wealth and sons, and will assign unto you Gardens  and will assign unto you rivers. 
71|13|Nuh: Noah|What aileth you that ye hope not toward Allah for dignity 
71|14|Nuh: Noah|When He created you by (divers) stages ? 
71|15|Nuh: Noah|See ye not how Allah hath created seven heavens in harmony, 
71|16|Nuh: Noah|And hath made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp ? 
71|17|Nuh: Noah|And Allah hath caused you to grow as a growth from the earth, 
71|18|Nuh: Noah|And afterward He maketh you return thereto, and He will bring you forth  again, a (new) forthbringing. 
71|19|Nuh: Noah|And Allah hath made the earth a wide expanse for you 
71|20|Nuh: Noah|That ye may thread the valley-ways thereof. 
71|21|Nuh: Noah|Noah said: My Lord! Lo! they have disobeyed me and followed one whose  wealth and children increase him in naught save ruin; 
71|22|Nuh: Noah|And they have plotted a mighty plot, 
71|23|Nuh: Noah|And they have said: Forsake not your gods. Forsake not Wadd, nor Suwa',  nor Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr. 
71|24|Nuh: Noah|And they have led many astray, and Thou increasest the wrong-doers in  naught save error. 
71|25|Nuh: Noah|Because of their sins they were drowned, then made to enter a Fire. And they  found they had no helpers in place of Allah. 
71|26|Nuh: Noah|And Noah said: My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers in the land. 
71|27|Nuh: Noah|If Thou shouldst leave them, they will mislead Thy slaves and will beget  none save lewd ingrates. 
71|28|Nuh: Noah|My Lord! Forgive me and my parents and him who entereth my house  believing, and believing men and believing women, and increase not the wrong-doers  in aught save ruin. 
72|1|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Say (O Muhammad): It is revealed unto me that a company of the Jinn gave  ear, and they said: Lo! we have heard a marvellous Qur'an, 
72|2|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Which guideth unto righteousness, so we believe in it and we ascribe no  partner unto our Lord. 
72|3|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And (we believe) that He - exalted be the glory of our Lord! - hath taken  neither wife nor son, 
72|4|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And that the foolish one among us used to speak concerning Allah an  atrocious lie. 
72|5|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And lo! we had supposed that humankind and jinn would not speak a lie  concerning Allah - 
72|6|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And indeed (O Muhammad) individuals of humankind used to invoke the  protection of individuals of the jinn, so that they increased them in revolt against  Allah); 
72|7|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And indeed they supposed, even as ye suppose, that Allah would not raise  anyone (from the dead) - 
72|8|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And (the Jinn who had listened to the Qur'an said): We had sought the  heaven but had found it filled with strong warders and meteors. 
72|9|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And we used to sit on places (high) therein to listen. But he who listeneth  now findeth a flame in wait for him; 
72|10|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And we know not whether harm is boded unto all who are in the earth, or  whether their Lord intendeth guidance for them. 
72|11|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And among us there are righteous folk and among us there are far from that.  We are sects having different rules. 
72|12|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And we know that we cannot escape from Allah in the earth, nor can we  escape by flight. 
72|13|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And when we heard the guidance, we believed therein, and whoso believeth  in his Lord, he feareth neither loss nor oppression. 
72|14|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And there are among us some who have surrendered (to Allah) and there are  among us some who are unjust. And whoso hath surrendered to Allah, such have  taken the right path purposefully. 
72|15|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And as for those who are unjust, they are firewood for hell. 
72|16|al-Jinn: The Jinn|If they (the idolaters) tread the right path, We shall give them to drink of  water in abundance 
72|17|al-Jinn: The Jinn|That We may test them thereby, and whoso turneth away from the  remembrance of his Lord; He will thrust him into ever-growing torment. 
72|18|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And the places of worship are only for Allah, so pray not unto anyone along  with Allah. 
72|19|al-Jinn: The Jinn|And when the slave of Allah stood up in prayer to Him, they crowded on  him, almost stifling. 
72|20|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I pray unto Allah only, and ascribe unto  Him no partner. 
72|21|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Say: Lo! I control not hurt nor benefit for you. 
72|22|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Say: Lo! none can protect me from Allah, nor can I find any refuge beside  Him 
72|23|al-Jinn: The Jinn|(Mine is) but conveyance (of the Truth) from Allah, and His messages; and  whoso disobeyeth Allah and His messenger, lo! his is fire of hell, wherein such dwell  for ever. 
72|24|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Till (the day) when they shall behold that which they are promised (they may  doubt); but then they will know (for certain) who is weaker in allies and less in  multitude. 
72|25|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): I know not whether that which ye  are promised is nigh, or if my Lord hath set a distant term for it. 
72|26|al-Jinn: The Jinn|(He is) the Knower of the Unseen, and He revealeth unto none His secret, 
72|27|al-Jinn: The Jinn|Save unto every messenger whom He hath chosen, and then He maketh a  guard to go before him and a guard behind him 
72|28|al-Jinn: The Jinn|That He may know that they have indeed conveyed the messages of their  Lord. He surroundeth all their doings, and He keepeth count of all things. 
73|1|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|O thou wrapped up in thy raiment! 
73|2|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Keep vigil the night long, save a little - 
73|3|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|A half thereof, or abate a little thereof 
73|4|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Or add (a little) thereto - and chant the Qur'an in measure, 
73|5|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|For we shall charge thee with a word of weight. 
73|6|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lo! the vigil of the night is (a time) when impression is more keen and  speech more certain. 
73|7|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lo! thou hast by day a chain of business. 
73|8|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|So remember the name of thy Lord and devote thyself with a complete  devotion - 
73|9|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lord of the East and the West; there is no God save Him; so choose thou  Him alone for thy defender - 
73|10|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|And bear with patience what they utter, and part from them with a fair leave- taking. 
73|11|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Leave Me to deal with the deniers, lords of ease and comfort (in this life);  and do thou respite them awhile. 
73|12|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lo! with Us are heavy fetters and a raging fire, 
73|13|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|And food which choketh (the partaker), and a painful doom 
73|14|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|On the day when the earth and the hills rock, and the hills become a heap of  running sand. 
73|15|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lo! We have sent unto you a messenger as witness against you, even as We  sent unto Pharaoh a messenger. 
73|16|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|But Pharaoh rebelled against the messenger, whereupon We seized him with  no gentle grip. 
73|17|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Then how, if ye disbelieve, will ye protect yourselves upon the day which  will turn children grey, 
73|18|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|The very heaven being then rent asunder. His promise is to be fulfilled. 
73|19|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lo! This is a Reminder. Let him who will, then, choose a way unto his Lord. 
73|20|al-Muzammil: The Mantled One|Lo! thy Lord knoweth how thou keepest vigil sometimes nearly two-thirds of  the night, or (sometimes) half or a third thereof, as do a party of those with thee.  Allah measureth the night and the day. He knoweth that ye count it not, and turneth  unto you in mercy. Recite, then, of the Qur'an that which is easy for you. He knoweth  that there are sick folk among you, while others travel in the land in search of Allah's  bounty, and others (still) are fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite of it that which  is easy (for you), and establish worship and pay the poor-due, and (so) lend unto  Allah a goodly loan. Whatsoever good ye send before you for your souls, ye will find  it with Allah, better and greater in the recompense. And seek forgiveness of Allah.  Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful. 
74|1|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|O thou enveloped in thy cloak, 
74|2|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Arise and warn! 
74|3|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Thy Lord magnify, 
74|4|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Thy raiment purify, 
74|5|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Pollution shun! 
74|6|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And show not favour, seeking wordly gain! 
74|7|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|For the sake of thy Lord, be patient! 
74|8|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|For when the trumpet shall sound, 
74|9|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Surely that day will be a day of anguish, 
74|10|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Not of ease, for disbelievers. 
74|11|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Leave Me (to deal) with him whom I created lonely, 
74|12|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And then bestowed upon him ample means, 
74|13|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And sons abiding in his presence 
74|14|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And made (life) smooth for him. 
74|15|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Yet he desireth that I should give more. 
74|16|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Nay! For lo! he hath been stubborn to Our revelations. 
74|17|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|On him I shall impose a fearful doom. 
74|18|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|For lo! he did consider; then he planned - 
74|19|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|(Self-)destroyed is he, how he planned! 
74|20|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Again (self-)destroyed is he, how he planned! - 
74|21|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Then looked he, 
74|22|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Then frowned he and showed displeasure. 
74|23|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Then turned he away in pride 
74|24|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And said: This is naught else than magic from of old; 
74|25|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|This is naught else than speech of mortal man. 
74|26|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Him shall I fling unto the burning. 
74|27|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One| - Ah, what will convey unto thee what that burning is! - 
74|28|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|It leaveth naught; it spareth naught 
74|29|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|It shrivelleth the man. 
74|30|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Above it are nineteen. 
74|31|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and their number  have We made to be a stumbling-block for those who disbelieve; that those to whom  the Scripture hath been given may have certainty, and that believers may increase in  faith; and that those to whom the Scripture hath been given and believers may not  doubt; and that those in whose hearts there is disease, and disbelievers, may say:  What meaneth Allah by this similitude ? Thus Allah sendeth astray whom He will,  and whom He will He guideth. None knoweth the hosts of thy Lord save Him. This is  naught else than a Reminder unto mortals. 
74|32|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Nay, by the Moon 
74|33|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And the night when it withdraweth 
74|34|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|And the dawn when it shineth forth, 
74|35|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Lo! this is one of the greatest (portents) 
74|36|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|As a warning unto men, 
74|37|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Unto him of you who will advance or hang back. 
74|38|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Every soul is a pledge for its own deeds;

74|40|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|In gardens they will ask one another

74|42|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|What hath brought you to this burning ?

74|47|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Till the Inevitable came unto us.

74|50|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|As they were frightened asses 
74|51|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Fleeing from a lion ?

74|53|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Nay, verily. They fear not the Hereafter. 
74|54|al-Mudathir: The Clothed One|Nay, verily. Lo! this is an Admonishment.

75|1|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Nay, I swear by the Day of Resurrection; 
75|2|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Nay, I swear by the accusing soul (that this Scripture is true). 
75|3|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Thinketh man that We shall not assemble his bones ?

75|13|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|On that day man is told the tale of that which he hath sent before and left  behind. 
75|14|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Oh, but man is a telling witness against himself, 
75|15|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Although he tender his excuses.
