75|30|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Unto thy Lord that day will be the driving. 
75|31|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|For he neither trusted, nor prayed. 
75|32|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|But he denied and flouted.

75|35|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Again nearer unto thee and nearer (is the doom). 
75|36|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Thinketh man that he is to be left aimless ?

75|39|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|And made of him a pair, the male and female. 
75|40|al-Qiyamah: The Resurrection|Is not He (Who doeth so) Able to bring the dead to life ? 
76|1|ad-Dahr: The Man|Hath there come upon man (ever) any period of time in which he was a thing  unremembered ? 
76|2|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! We create man from a drop of thickened fluid to test him; so We make  him hearing, knowing. 
76|3|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! We have shown him the way, whether he be grateful or disbelieving. 
76|4|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! We have prepared for disbelievers manacles and carcans and a raging  fire. 
76|5|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! the righteous shall drink of a cup whereof the mixture is of Kafur, 
76|6|ad-Dahr: The Man|A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allah drink, making it gush forth  abundantly, 
76|7|ad-Dahr: The Man|(Because) they perform the vow and fear a day whereof the evil is wide- spreading, 
76|8|ad-Dahr: The Man|And feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan and the prisoner, for love  of Him, 
76|9|ad-Dahr: The Man|(Saying): We feed you, for the sake of Allah only. We wish for no reward  nor thanks from you; 
76|10|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! we fear from our Lord a day of frowning and of fate. 
76|11|ad-Dahr: The Man|Therefor Allah hath warded off from them the evil of that day, and hath  made them find brightness and joy; 
76|12|ad-Dahr: The Man|And hath awarded them for all that they endured, a Garden and silk attire; 
76|13|ad-Dahr: The Man|Reclining therein upon couches, they will find there neither (heat of) a sun  nor bitter cold. 
76|14|ad-Dahr: The Man|The shade thereof is close upon them and the clustered fruits thereof bow  down. 
76|15|ad-Dahr: The Man|Goblets of silver are brought round for them, and beakers (as) of glass 
76|16|ad-Dahr: The Man|(Bright as) glass but (made) of silver, which they (themselves) have  measured to the measure (of their deeds). 
76|17|ad-Dahr: The Man|There are they watered with a cup whereof the mixture is of Zanjabil, 
76|18|ad-Dahr: The Man|(The water of) a spring therein, named Salsabil. 
76|19|ad-Dahr: The Man|There wait on them immortal youths, whom, when thou seest, thou wouldst  take for scattered pearls. 
76|20|ad-Dahr: The Man|When thou seest, thou wilt see there bliss and high estate. 
76|21|ad-Dahr: The Man|Their raiment will be fine green silk and gold embroidery. Bracelets of silver  will they wear. Their Lord will slake their thirst with a pure drink. 
76|22|ad-Dahr: The Man|(And it will be said unto them): Lo! this is a reward for you. Your endeavour  (upon earth) hath found acceptance. 
76|23|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! We, even We, have revealed unto thee the Qur'an, a revelation; 
76|24|ad-Dahr: The Man|So submit patiently to thy Lord's command, and obey not of them any guilty  one or disbeliever. 
76|25|ad-Dahr: The Man|Remember the name of thy Lord at morn and evening. 
76|26|ad-Dahr: The Man|And worship Him (a portion) of the night. And glorify Him through the  livelong night. 
76|27|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! these love fleeting life, and put behind them (the remembrance of) a  grievous day. 
76|28|ad-Dahr: The Man|We, even We, created them, and strengthened their frame. And when We  will, We can replace them, bringing others like them in their stead. 
76|29|ad-Dahr: The Man|Lo! this is an Admonishment, that whosoever will may choose a way unto  his Lord. 
76|30|ad-Dahr: The Man|Yet ye will not, unless Allah willeth. Lo! Allah is Knower, Wise. 
76|31|ad-Dahr: The Man|He maketh whom He will to enter His mercy, and for evil-doers hath  prepared a painful doom.

89|15|al-Fajr: The Dawn|As for man, whenever his Lord trieth him by honouring him, and is gracious  unto him, he saith: My Lord honoureth me. 
89|16|al-Fajr: The Dawn|But whenever He trieth him by straitening his means of life, he saith: My  Lord despiseth me. 
89|17|al-Fajr: The Dawn|Nay, but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan 
89|18|al-Fajr: The Dawn|And urge not on the feeding of the poor. 
89|19|al-Fajr: The Dawn|And ye devour heritages with devouring greed. 
89|20|al-Fajr: The Dawn|And love wealth with abounding love. 
89|21|al-Fajr: The Dawn|Nay, but when the earth is ground to atoms, grinding, grinding, 
89|22|al-Fajr: The Dawn|And thy Lord shall come with angels, rank on rank, 
89|23|al-Fajr: The Dawn|And hell is brought near that day; on that day man will remember, but how  will the remembrance (then avail him) ? 
89|24|al-Fajr: The Dawn|He will say: Ah, would that I had sent before me (some provision) for my  life! 
89|25|al-Fajr: The Dawn|None punisheth as He will punish on that day! 
89|26|al-Fajr: The Dawn|None bindeth as He then will bind. 
89|27|al-Fajr: The Dawn|But ah! thou soul at peace! 
89|28|al-Fajr: The Dawn|Return unto thy Lord, content in His good pleasure! 
89|29|al-Fajr: The Dawn|Enter thou among My bondmen! 
89|30|al-Fajr: The Dawn|Enter thou My Garden!
